loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia is married and has five children, between the ages of three and fifteen. Her husband works as an employee in a furniture store, but the salary that he receives is insufficient to cover the basic needs of their family. Faced with this necessity, Leticia decided to undertake her own business selling hardware and construction supplies. Preparing a place next to their home, she began with material for plumbing and electricity, and little by little, she has been improving what she supplies at her hardware store. Leticia is willing to work a lot in order to give her young children a good education and a better quality of life.

To continue growing, Leticia is now requesting a loan of $475 dollars, which she will use to purchase construction materials that are in high demand from her clients. In this way, she will be able to offer better service and increase her sales. She promises to repay the loan in six months. The well being of her family is in your hands. Decide if you want to support Leticia. She greatly appreciates the opportunity that you give her to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Leticia es casada y tiene cinco hijos, entre 3 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una mueblería pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ante esta necesidad Leticia decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de ferretería, acondicionando un lugar al lado de su vivienda, comenzó con material de plomería y eléctrico, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor su ferretería. Leticia está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su pequeños hijos, quiere ofrecerles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Para continuar creciendo, ahora Leticia solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de material de construcción que son productos muy solicitados por sus clientes, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un buen servicio e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Leticia, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le das de mejorar y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies that are in high demand

loans.name: Diana Guadalupe

texts.es:
In the town of Escobedo in Nuveo León lives Diana Guadalupe. She is married, has a son who is five years old, and a little daughter who is four years old. Her husband works, but unfortunately, his salary is very low and insufficient to cover the needs of their family. In search of another income that will allow them to improve their quality of life, three years ago Diana began to sell cosmetics and clothes from a catalog. She began selling amongst her relatives and friends, but soon she was able to increase her clients thanks to the easy payment methods she offered.

At this time, Diana requests a loan of $475 dollars that she will use to purchase merchandise, meet the demand from her clients, and continue growing. She offers to repay the loan in six months. Be an important part of the lives of Diana and her family by contributing to the growth of her business. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

En la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León vive Diana Guadalupe, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años y una pequeña de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero, sin embargo, su salario es muy bajo para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, en busca de un ingreso extra que les permitiera mejorar su calidad de vida Diana inició con las ventas de cosméticos y ropa por catálogo desde hace tres años, empezó entre sus familiares y amigos, pero pronto logró incrementar sus clientes gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofrece.

En estos momentos, Diana solicita un préstamo de $475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Diana y su familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, gracias.

loans.use: Order cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is a fast learner and very enthusiastic woman. She is married and has a young son. They live in Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo León. In order to earn some extra money and to help her husband to cover their household costs as his workers’ salary is very low, Cristina decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and shoes. Her love of sales and her desire to give her family the best has motivated her to try harder everyday. She wants her son to have a good quality education so that he can have better opportunities.

In order for her business to grow, Cristina would like a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise which her clients have asked for as she wants to offer them the quality service that they go to her for. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. You can help to improve this family’s life and to be a part of Cristina’s achievements. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Cristina es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, ellos viven en la localidad de Escobedo en el estado de Nuevo León. Para poder obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar porque su salario de obrero es muy bajo, Cristina decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y calzado, su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de darle lo mejor a su familia la han motivado a esforzarse cada día más, ella desea que su hijo pueda tener una educación de calidad para que tenga mejores oportunidades.

Para hacer crecer su negocio, ahora Cristina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía que le permitan poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella quiere ofrecer un servicio de calidad para continuar con su preferencia, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, forma parte en los logros de Cristina, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
For 20 years Juana Francisca has been in sales. She has 2 children. She started her business to help cover the household costs and the costs of her children’s education as her husband’s salary was not sufficient. She started off selling clothes and then started to sell other things such as jewellery, cosmetics and shoes, depending on what her clients wanted. This is how her business has grown, inspired by the love of her children and the faithfulness of her husband.

In order to meet her client’s demands Juana is now asking for a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Juana thanks you very much for the trust and support you can offer her so that her business can grow and improve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 20 años Juana Francisca se dedica a las ventas, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene dos hijos y con el ingreso de su esposo no se podían cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, ella empezó vendiendo ropa, después fue incorporando la venta de otros artículos ante la demanda de sus clientes, como joyería, cosméticos y zapatos, de esta manera es como ha hecho crecer su negocio impulsada por el amor que tiene hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, en este momento Juana solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Juana agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le puedas brindar para mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Rosalba Irene

texts.es:
Rosalba comes from Escobedo in Nuevo León. She is married and has a 20 year old son and a four year old daughter. It was because of them that she started her own business 15 years ago, selling hamburgers and tacos. Her husband is a taxi driver but his earnings are not enough to cover all the household costs. Rosalba started selling food from her house and then she got a cart which she can move around and sell food from.

Rosalba would like a loan of $750 which she will use to buy tables, chairs and some metal poles which she will use to refurbish her business. She hopes it will keep growing and that with this refurbishment she will have more space in which to serve her clients better. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Help Rosalba to improve her business. She and her family sincerely thank you for any help you can offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba es originaria de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene un hijo de 20 años y una pequeña de 4 años de edad, ellos han sido el motivo para iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de hamburguesas y tacos desde hace 15 años, su esposo es taxista pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar. Rosalba inició con la venta de comida en la cochera de su casa, después pudo adquirir un carrito ambulante equipado para realizar sus ventas.

Rosalba está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mesas, sillas y una malla metálica con la que remodelara su local, ella espera continuar creciendo y con esta remodelación tendrá más espacio para poder atender bien a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Rosalba a mejorar su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: Refurbishment/Remodelación

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca has two daughters, who are 7 and 8 years old respectively , and a 3 year-old son. She is a single mother and has never received support from the father to help raise their children. Five years ago Blanca decided to use her entrepreneur skills to sell used clothing in order to better provide for her family. Blanca wants her children to get a good education, thus, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes her sacrifice worthwhile.

Blanca sells her merchandise in street markets with help from her mother. Together they have been able to expand their business and to fulfill her clients demands she now needs a loan in the amount of US$375.00, which will be used to purchase new clothes. She promises to pay back the loan within 6 months. You could become an important part in Blanca family's life, she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca tiene dos hijas de 7 y 8 años y un pequeño de 3 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y nunca ha contado con el apoyo de su pareja para el sostén de sus hijos, así que Blanca por ser una mujer emprendedora decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada desde hace cinco años con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Blanca quiere que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y puedan tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro, esto es lo que la impulsa cada día a esforzarse más.

Blanca realiza sus ventas en los mercados ambulantes, donde recibe la ayuda de su madre, juntas han logrado hace crecer su negocio y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, que destinará a la compra de ropa nueva que le han estado solicitando sus clientes, ella promete regresar este dinero en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de Blanca y su familia, ellos te agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Señora P. is married and a mother of two school-aged children. Education is very important to her and she has created a library where many kids come to learn to read and write and begin using computers. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy more books so the kids can have a great variety of readings. She plans to invest the other part of the loan in the purchase of two computers and seats, in order to offer more comfort to her clients. She hopes that the loan will allow her to increase her income and attract more clients to her library.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. P. es casada y madre de 2 niños en edad escolar, para ella es muy importante la educación y ha creado una biblioteca a la que asisten muchos niños para aprender a leer y a escribir y para iniciarse en el uso de las computadoras. Está solicitando el crédito ya que quiere comprar más libros para que los niños cuenten con una gra variedad de lectura y también piensa invertir otra parte en la compra de 2 computadoras y asientos para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus ingresos y atraer más clientes a su biblioteca.

loans.use: Books, computers, and furniture for her library

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma is 35 years old. She is married and mother of two children - a 10 year-old boy and a 12 year-old girl. They are originally from the town of Escobedo located in Nueva Leon state. She started her own business selling cosmetic products so that she could help support her family and improve their living standards. Due to requests she received she began also selling sneakers and ladies' sandals to family members and friends. Soon her clientele increased thanks to the good service she has offered. She puts in a lot of effort to combine work 's and family's needs - she sells merchandise from home or door-to-door.

Alma wishes to purchase a pick-up truck that will be very useful to her business. In order to continue expanding her business she now needs a loan in the amount of US$1200.00. This amount will be used to purchase more merchandise to increase sales. She agrees to repay her loan within 3 months. Be a part of Alma's venture and make a point to sponsor her way to success. She and her family deeply thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de un niño y una niña de 10 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo en el estado de Nuevo León. Para poder contribuir con los gastos familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Alma inició su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, a petición de sus clientes fue incorporando la venta de tenis y sandalias, ella comenzó a realizar sus ventas entre familiares y amigos, pronto fue incrementando su número de clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece. Ella se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante su negocio sin descuidar a su familia, realiza sus ventas en su hogar y en ocasiones sale a ofrecer sus productos casa por casa.

Alma desea poder adquirir una camioneta que le será de mucha utilidad en su negocio, ahora para poder continuar creciendo, ella solicita un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte en los logros de Alma, y decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Señora M. is married and a mother of three children. She is requesting a loan to improve the conditions of her beauty salon. She wants to construct a wall to separate the salon from her house, because she says it will give her business a more professional appearance and attract more clients. She wants to also invest in new tools (brushes, a hair dryer, scissors, etc.), because the ones that she currently owns have already had many years of use.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. M. es casada y madre de tres hijos, está solicitando el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su salón de belleza, quiere construir una pared para separar el salón de su casa de habitación, ya que nos comenta que esto le dará una apariencia más profesional a su negocio y atraerá más clientes. Quiere invertir también en la compra de nuevas herramientas (cepillos, secadora de pelo, tijeras, etc.) ya que las que tiene tiene muchos años de uso.

loans.use: Build a wall to separate her salon from house and buy brushes, scissors, and a hair dryer

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were unable to verify that Ms. Moreno was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Thank you very much.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es:
Brenda is a young entrepreneur with a strong will power. After her parents divorce she wanted to keep going to school but her mother's income alone was not enough to cover the costs - that is why she started working at a sewing factory when she was 20 years old. Soon she realized she could start her own sewing business, so she spent the money she had saved to purchase a sewing machine that was used to fulfill small orders. Thanks to the good quality of her products, demand for her merchandise increased considerably - she now has three employees helping her out.

Brenda asks for US$550.00 that will be used to buy an extra sewing machine that will increase production output; thus, covering customers' demands. She commits to paying back her loan within 6 months. You have the chance to become a vital part of this business growth. She thanks in advance the opportunity you can provide to expand her small-business.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice.

Brenda es una joven emprendedora, con grandes deseos de superación, después del divorcio de sus padres ella quería continuar estudiando pero su madre sola no podía cubrir todos los gastos, por esta razón ella empezó a trabajar en un taller de costura a sus 20 años, pronto se dio cuenta de que ella podría iniciar su propio negocio y con los ahorros que tenia compro una máquina de coser usada con la que inició a realizar algunos pequeños trabajos, gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora la demanda por sus servicios se ha incrementado considerablemente, por lo que ahora cuenta con la ayuda de tres empleados.

Para continuar creciendo ahora Brenda solicita $ 550 dólares que utilizará para comprar una máquina de coser con la que espera incrementar su producción para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser una parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Brenda, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para continuar creciendo como microempresaria.

loans.use: Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Señor B. is married and a father of two children. He is also the owner of a mill, which has been operating daily for over fifteen years. In his mill, Señor B. prepares the corn meal that is used to make tortillas. He is visited every day by about fifteen tortilla makers and sellers who come to his business to grind the corn meal for their tortillas. He is requesting a loan to buy pieces necessary for the upkeep of his mill. He hopes that by repairing his mill, it will stop giving him problems, and he won't need to stop operations, which causes him to lose a lot of his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. B. es casado y padre de 2 hijos, es además propietario de un molino que tiene más de quince años de esar operando diariamente, en su molino el Sr. B. elabora la masa que es utilizada para hacer tortillas y es visitado diariamente por alrededor de 15 tortilleras que asisten a su local para moler la masa con la que elaborarán las tortillas. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar unas piezas necesarias para darle mantenimiento a su molino. Espera que con esta reparación el molino no siga dando problemas y no se vea en la necesidad de para operaciones, lo cual le haría perder gran parte de sus ingresos.

loans.use: The upkeep and repair of his mill

payments.comment: During our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Blanco was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and I hope you continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Señor A. is the owner of a mill where tortillas are made. Additionally, coffee and cocoa beans are ground here and prepared into different national drinks. He is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials for maintaining his work site. He plans to repair the roof, because the last rains damaged his mill. He plans to change the floor, because he says the current floor gives his business a bad appearance. With the repairs, he hopes to increase his number of clients and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. A. es propietario de un molino en el cual se fabrican la masa con la cual se elaboran tortillas, además se muele café y cacao con el cual se preparan diferentes bebidas nacionales. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para realizar el mantenimiento a su local, piensa reparar el techo, ya que las últimas lluvias lo han dañado y piensa cambiar el piso ya que según el Sr. A. le da mal aspecto a su negocio. Con las reparaciones espera incrementar el número de clientes y elevar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Repair the roof and improve the floor of his work site.

payments.comment: In our latest audit, we were not able to verify that Mr. Aguilar was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George William is 59 years old. He is married with three children, a boy in University, a girl in primary school grade seven and the last boy in primary school grade four. He is an electrician by profession. He opened a shop which deals in electrical materials especially those used in wiring houses. He has 19 years experience.

He requests a loan of US $1200 to purchase more stock; i.e., electric wires, earth load, extension cables and many more items. When he increases the stock, he will attract more customers, increase the sales and the profit margin will go up.

He plans in future to open a spare parts shop for bicycles, which are in high demand in the area. He plans to pay back the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: To increase  stock of electrical supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Boost Up Her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of bicycle parts

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a bakery in the Kikruk market. His brothers work with him and he is responsible for supporting a big family. He is applying for a loan of $1200 from Al-Aman to purchase new oven for his shop. He is hoping for a good future, and to develop himself and improve his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase  new oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of maize and beans

loans.name: Khaya Gul

texts.en: Khaya Gul lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family. She is uneducated but she is a driver and she has lots of experience. The engine of her car is not working. She wants to take a group loan to buy a new engine for her car to help her husban support their family. She is happy with this loan and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new engine

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and she is educated. She lives with her children and she is the only support of her family. She is a tailor. She wants to take a group loan to buy sewing machines and also to change the design of her shop to attract more clients and help her family. She is happy that she can support her family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Farima

texts.en:
Farima lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family. She is an embroiderer. She works at home because her husband does not allow her to take a shop in the bazaar.

She wants to expand her home business so she wants to take a group loan to buy all the necessary materials to make a good income and help her family. She is excited about this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Zarmena

texts.en:
Zarmena lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is not married. She makes artificial flowers. She loves this work a lot and she has good experience.

She wants to expand her business so she wants to take a group loan to buy all the materials for making flowers. She wants to attract more clients and make a good income so that she can improve her life.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for artificial flowers

loans.name: Nshingia

texts.en:
Nshingia is 40 years old and married with three children, two in primary and one in secondary school.

When she was young, Nshingia's family could afford to give her only a primary-school education, but she is committed to do well and achieve much in life. After getting married, for example, she decided to do more than stay at home and be a housewife. She joined several credit associations and, with the help of her husband, managed to open a shop that sells many products that turnover quickly, such as cold drinks.

Nshingia recently expanded her business with a loan from Kiva, and would like to thank everyone who made the expansion possible. She has repaid this loan in full.

Nshingia's shop is located close to a recreational center where many workers eat while on break, and their presence nearby gives her a chance to expand her business again. Her goal is to increase her stock of cold drinks and snacks, as well as the number of tables and chairs available to her customers. To do this, she has come to us for a new loan of $1,000.

loans.use: Add to stock of cold drinks, and purchase more tables and chairs for her shop

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Titi is a housewife with three children who has been married for 26 years. Her family could not afford to give her more than a primary-school education, but Titi is an ambitious person who joined various groups in her area that are committed to empowering women. Her membership in these groups inspired her to open a shop where she sells cold drinks to both retail and wholesale customers.

This business is doing well, and Titi would like to thank all of the lenders who made her first Kiva loan possible, because this support allowed her to increase her stock of sodas, juices and beers to sell, and start construction of a hair salon that she plans to open as soon as construction is complete.

Titi is excited about this new business, which she believes will do well because it is in a good location in a new neighborhood with no competing salons and lots of potential customers. Titi has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to equip her salon with hairdryers and curlers, a fan, hairdressing materials and other items.

loans.use: To buy driers, hairdressing materials and other items for a new salon

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with three children and lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam, where she runs a food-vending business along the shores of Indian Ocean. Most of her customers are fishermen.

Fatma would like to thank all the lenders who participated in her first loan with Kiva, now fully repaid, which allowed her to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, cornflower, cooking oil, sugar and beans to sell to her customers. The loan also allowed her to buy a small refrigerator which she uses to sell cold drinks to thirsty fishermen who come to her shop for to eat after spending their mornings fishing in the Indian Ocean.

Fatma is requesting a new loan from Kiva so that she can improve her business by buying a larger stock of cold drinks, along with dishes, chairs, tables and food-wrapping materials for customers who would like to take their food away to eat later. She would also like to buy uniforms for the three assistants who help in her shop. The $750 loan she is asking for will make her business more attractive to customers, and take her one step closer to realizing her dream of becoming a professional caterer who also owns a guest house.

loans.use: Add to stock of food items and cold drinks and  buy serving dishes, tables, chairs and food-wrapping material

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en: Neneh J. is thirty-seven years of age and married with three children.  Her husband is unemployed and Neneh is the only income earner in the family.  She is engaged in selling eggs.  She sells both wholesale and retail in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone, and is being assisted by her three teen-age children.  Neneh is requesting a second larger loan from SMT for expanding her business, especially the wholesaling portion.  She is committed to providing for her family’s needs and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: Expand wholesale portion of egg selling business

loans.name: Anjay

texts.en:
Anjay T. is forty-five years of age and married with four children. He started his business after dropping out of school twenty-five years ago. He owns a small business at the center of Makeni town of Sierra Leone and deals mainly in selling music tapes. He used the profit earned from his first loan for the education of his children and made a promise to himself that his children will not drop out of school like he did.

A hardworking man, he has been able to repay his loans on time and is determined to improve the general welfare of his family. Anjay requests larger loan to increase his inventory and selection to attract more customers.

loans.use: Increase inventory and selection of music tapes

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia M. K. came from a small village in Northern Sierra Leone.  He is thirty-six years old and married with four children.  He migrated to Makeni some years ago for business purposes.  Zacharia owns a stall in Makeni town market where he sells building materials.  Having struggled for years, he used his first loan for expanding his business and made a profit  for the family needs.  He intends to use the second larger loan for the same purpose. Zacharia said that his goal is to provide his children with their basic needs, especially education, medical care, and better housing.

loans.use: Expand his inventory of building supplies

loans.name: Bai

texts.en: Bai S. runs his business at the Makeni town market of Sierra Leone.  He manages a stall where he sells building materials.  He is forty-five years old and married with three children.  Bai is a hardworking man.  With his previous loan he used the profit to renovate part of the family house and he is optimistic that the profit he earns from business made with a larger second loan will enable him complete the repairing of the house.

loans.use: Increase inventory of building supplies

loans.name: Rugie

texts.en: Rugie M. was born in Northern Sierra Leone.  She is thirty-five years of age and is married. Her husband is currently unemployed.  With three children, Rugie takes care of the family expenses. She sells sandals in the center of town and offers a wide selection to her customers. With her business income, Rugie has been able to provide three meals a day for the family.  She will use the larger second loan for expanding her business and she is determined to improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: Increase the selection and variety of sandals she sells

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie K. is 48 years old and the mother of four children. As a single mother, Amie is responsible for providing for her children's needs. A hard working woman, she is the chairperson of the women’s subsistence farmers’ cooperative association in Fadugu village of Sierra Leone. The association came together to help each other with their farms.

From her small farm of rice, Amie was able to generate enough start-up capital for her business. She runs a small grocery which she intends to expand and is requesting a loan of $350 which she will be able to repay within twelve months. With confidence, Amie said, “I would like to bring up my children to be useful citizens of Sierra Leone with a good education."

loans.use: Increase inventory in small grocery store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
At forty-nine years old, Esther has six girl children and she also adopted two children from a deceased uncle. These children are her big responsibility and she works hard by selling plastic utensils and palm oil to earn income for her family. All the eight children are in school, and with her small business, Esther is able to provide them with their basic needs.

Esther has an innovative business. She buys goods from the capital, Freetown, and distributes them among her agents in remote villages around Kabala, and collects the receipts every week. Her activity has provided needed goods to the more remote areas of the district. Esther’s vision is to see all her children acquire a good education. She is requesting a $350 loan to expand her inventory and would like to purchase the goods from Conakry where she said it is cheaper than Freetown.

loans.use: Expand her wholesale inventory

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mrs. But V. is 22 years old and works with her husband to produce mortars and pestles. They earn about $2/day in this business, and it takes them many many hours to produce these products by hand.

Mrs. But V. is seeking a $400 loan so that she can purchase a machine to help produce her product. This machine will greatly help her and her husband to produce more of their product which is currently in high demand by their clients. As they save more money from their income, Mrs. But V. and her husband hope to purchase more tools to make the production process faster and more efficient.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce mortars and pestles

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. is 28 years old and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband and their two children.  Mrs Heng S. sells mangoes to the people in her village, while her husband works as a construction foreman.  Combined, their income is around $4/day.  She is seeking this loan in order to purchase a wood frame and construction materials to build a small cart for selling her mangoes.  She believes this new cart will help her to expand her sales area and also her daily income.  In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business in order to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase wood frame to hang mangoes for her business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Heng Sokleng for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom R. is a 29-year -old widow living in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She owns and operates a small booth selling a variety of fruits and duck eggs.  She earns about $4/day in this business which is enough to support her one child and her mother who lives with her.  This loan will be used for purchasing more fruit and duck eggs for her booth.  Currently, her clients demand more products, but she cannot satisfy them because she doesn't have enough capital.  This loan will help her to increase her income so she can continue to support her child and mother.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and eggs

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Prom Ry has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van V. works as a tailor in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of 2 young children.  Her husband works at a private company, and earns about $6/day, while Mrs. Van V. earns $3/day at her tailoring business.  This loan will be used to purchase cloth for her business.  She hopes to continue gaining new clients so that she can build up enough savings to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mrs. Prun O. is a 61 year old widow living in Kampong Cham Province with her children.  Her children have all stayed around home to help their mother, and they have a variety of jobs.  One daughter works in a garment factory, one son is a mototaxi driver, and the youngest son runs a small booth filling up gasoline.  Mrs. Prun O. works with the youngest son at his stand, and she sells jewelry to her neighbors.  This loan is being used to fund the gasoline stand and Mrs. Prun O.'s jewelry business.  Both of these businesses are profitable and the demand for both has been high lately.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline and jewelry for her family's businesses.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Prum Ol has finished repaying this Kiva loan early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest capital for their small businesses. We hope that you will continue your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs via Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Choeum

texts.en: Mrs. Choeum S. is a 48 year old widow with 4 children.  She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, and helps her son (pictured here) who works as a carpenter/construction worker.  Her son, with her help, provides enough income for the entire family at about $4.50/day.  This loan will be used to purchase some carpentry tools to add to their business.  With the new tools, Mrs. Choeum S. and her son will be able to serve more people more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry supplies.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Choeum Sin start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Karomadjon

texts.en:
Karomadjon is divorced and has 2 beautiful girls. She lives with her elderly parents. They are pensioners. So Karomadjon is the one who earns money to support the family.

She has a small business place. Her business is the trade of candies. She brings her goods from Atushbazaar, which located in the district of Khujand. It is a wholesale market of cheaply priced goods. For this reason, Karomadjon buys candies from there and sells them in Panjshanbe at a higher price. She earns a small profit from her business.

You can see in the photo that she has sad eyes. She is in a difficult situation because her elder daughter must go to school during this school period, but Karomadjon’s profit is not enough to send her daughter to school. She needs extra capital for expanding the assortment of her goods, and she wants to increase her profit. She plans to save money to pay for school requirements and further education. Karomadjon says that she tries to do her best to educate her daughters and will help them to find a good job in future.

loans.use: Purchase 40kg of candies.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy S. and her husband are farmers in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  They grow a variety of crops and then harvest them and sell them to the market.  This business earns them about $4/day on average, although it is obviously a seasonal activity.  Mrs. Thuy S. will use this loan to purchase a motorbike to transport their crops.  Currently, it is difficult and slow to transport their crops to market, but with a motorbike, they will be able to move their crops further, faster, and more easily.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport their crops to the market

loans.name: Lut

texts.en: Mrs. Lut E. is a 50 year old widow living with her four children in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  One of her daughters (pictured here) works at a garment factory, one works at a restaurant and two are students.  Mrs. Lut E. must pay for motor taxis each day to take her children to work and school.  This has become very expensive for the family and they are seeking this loan in order to purchase their own motobike.  In the long run, this will help the family to save money on transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en:
Savri is 45 years old. She was married and has 5 children. Several years ago her husband died, and Savri was compelled to find a job to support her big family. The hard life conditions made Savriniso stronger and self-reliant.

She started working at the knitting workshop in 1982. Her business is to buy half-finished details of knitted garments and sew them into clothes ready to wear. The profit of her business depends on the number of products she sews to sell in the market. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. The loans from this organization gave her the opportunity to enlarge the number of her products so she could increase the turnover of her working capital. Now she plans to spend her future loan to purchase the next batch of details. She needs $500 to make this purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of knitting details

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat has been in business for over 9 years. She is married and has 5 children. She has a very friendly family. Her husband goes on the trip to purchase goods. They have three places of trade; her elder son and daughter are responsible there. They have a good profit from this kind of business and are satisfied with their trade places.

Muhabat became a client of MicroInvest in 2001. Her first loan was $100; she spent it to purchase a new batch goods. Gradually she could increase the turnover of her working capital and rent two trade places for her children. In the future Muhabat wants to open her own bookstore and office supply shop in the center of Khujand.

Muhabat plans to spend her next loan to purchase two boxes of pens and pencils, 2000 copy-books, 120 sketch-books, and 20 school bags. She wishes to see a profitable month before the school period.

P.S. Muhabat's elder daughter Munirahon is pictured.

loans.use: Purchase office supplies for school season

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs Pich S. is 34 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a grocer and earns 4 dollars a day. Her husband is a farmer and earns 3 dollars a day. They have one child. 
Mrs Pich S. would like to buy a cow and a horse to expand their farm.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and a horse to expand their farm

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng T. is 49 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. Her husband is 50. They have 2 children. They make caps and sell them to wholesalers. They would like to have a store where they could produce caps. In the future they would like to expand their business.

loans.use: To build a store where they could produce cap

payments.comment:
Congratulations to Seng Thy for successfully paying back the Kiva loan early! Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs like Seng Thy are able to access capital to fund their small businesses.

We hope that you will continue your investment in Cambodian entrepreneurs and CREDIT MFI.

Kind Regards,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow
Cambodia

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs Mom T. is 47 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a farmer and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. They earn 4 dollars a day. 
Mrs Mom T. would like to purchase a tractor to expand their farm and make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Mi

texts.en:
Mrs Mi H. is 29 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She sells vegetables and her husband sells wood. They earn 12 dollars a day. They have 3 children who are still students. 
Mrs Mi H. would like to purchase wood to expand her husband's business. The picture shows Mrs Mi H. with her husband and a credit officer.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her elder son served in the army and now has arrived home. The other two 2 are minors and study at school. Her husband works in local wood processing factory in a construction brigade. The money earned by him is not sufficient for the maintenance of the family.

Farida has been engaged in business for some years. She sells an assortment of children’s clothes and footwear. Every year in July she and her family are engaged in processing and drying apricots for the month. Two years ago she received a loan from MicroInvest for this purpose. After the sale of the processed fruits she received the next loan to expand her assortment of clothes and footwear. Now a new season of apricot processing is coming and she wants to get loan to purchase and dry apricots.

loans.use: To purchase and dry apricots

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mrs Sy T. is 52 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman and earns 4 dollars a day. They have 4 children. They would like to purchase a small boat and fishing tools to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase a small boat and fishing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tomato business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his spare parts business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fresh fruit and juice business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her spare parts business

loans.name: Nghoun

texts.en:
Mrs Nghoun S. is 37 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She runs a small grocery and her husband is a policeman. They earn 5 dollars a day. They have 3 children who are still students. 
Mrs Nghoun S. would like to purchase goods to expand her grocery store. In the future, she would like to own a big store with a wide variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase more products to expand her grocery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her little café and green-grocery

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Mrs Oum P. is a farmer in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She earns 1 dollar a day. Her husband is a moror-taxi driver and earns 6 dollars a day. His motorbike is now broken. They have 4 children. Two of them are still students.
Mrs Oum P. wants to purchase a motorbike to allow her husband to continue his job. In the future, she would like to purchase land to expand her farm. In the picture, we can see Mrs Oum P., her parents and a credit officer.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to allow her husband to continue to run his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand the inventory of her cereals  business

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs Hai T. is 41 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She sells porridge and other products in her area. Her husband is 45 and is a farmer. Together, they earn 12 dollars a day and have 2 children. 
Mrs Hai T. would like to purchase more products to expand her business. In the future, she would like to sell a wider range of products to meet the needs of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three bicycles for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his spare parts business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his auto spares shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Mobile Shop Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his dried fish selling business

loans.name: Marhamathon

texts.en:
Marhamathon is 58 years old. She and her husband have been on pension for a long time. She has three children: 2 sons and one daughter. Two of her children already have families and live separately. She and her husband live with their eldest son.

Marhamathon can’t sit without doing business and has had a small shop near their house for some years. Her trading day begins in the evening, and she trades till late at night. She spends the received income for herself and her husband and on sweets for the grandsons. One year ago she received a small loan from MicroInvest and has increased her working capital. After receiving new loans, she gradually expanded her assortment of goods. Now you will find everything in her shop that is necessary in life. Now she wants to get the next loan for further expansion.

loans.use: To expand assortment of goods

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina has a business selling leather purses from a little market stall at the Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. An experienced entrepreneur, she has been developing her business over the past seven years. Loans Marina has received from Nadiya Ukraine have been instrumental in helping her through the years. During her entire partnership with our organization, she has never been delinquent with a loan. Marina has requested a short term loan of $300 to help her purchase some additional inventory. We look forward to many more opportunities to continue assisting Marina as she develops her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Nine years ago, Irina opened a lingerie kiosk at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Facing a difficult financial situation, Irina started her business to support herself and her daughter. With financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine, Irina has developed her business, allowing her to employ and support her mother as well. Focused and with a strong sense of determination, Irina has used past loans to expand her business. She has repaid each loan with a perfect credit history. While Irina’s business has grown, finances remain tight for her family. Currently, she is seeking a loan for $1,200 to expand her inventory. With the additional inventory, Irina plans to attract additional clients and increase her monthly profits. With the profits, Irina hopes to further develop her business and increase the standard of living for her daughter, her mother, and herself.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is a hard-working entrepreneur with a big heart. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing at the Rushski market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Through her hard work and good business decisions, she has developed her little enterprise to the point where she is able to help others. In business for twelve years, her income has been a great help to her and her husband, Victor, as they’ve raised their two daughters. Ludmila was able to help one of her daughters purchase an apartment. She has also been able to use her earnings to assist her aging parents. Ludmila has the ability to purchase her clothing inventory from Turkey. She has requested a loan to buy inventory in bulk which will allow her to cut her overhead expenses and continue to make a good profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina supports herself and her son with a small business selling women’s shoes in Melitopol, Ukraine. In business for twelve years, she has built a successful and profitable enterprise. During a typical month she makes around $1600 in profits and has built up about $8000 worth of inventory for her business. Marina has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine, paying all loans back with no problems. She appreciates the support that she has received by having financial services available. Marina has requested a loan for $1000 to help her purchase additional shoe inventory. She looks forward to continuing to develop her business in the future.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana S. is an experienced business owner from Melitopol, Ukraine. She has been in business for the past twelve years and currently operates a little market kiosk where she sells a variety of socks and women’s hosiery. Svetlana is divorced and has one daughter. Her daughter also has her own business which Svetlana has been helping to get up and running. Svetlana’s business is her main source of income. She makes around $700 per month, enough to meet her basic needs. She has requested a loan for $400 to help purchase some additional inventory. She hopes to continue developing her own business and help her daughter be successful in her venture as well.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana has operated a toy kiosk at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine for the past ten years. She began her business to support her family and aging parents. For Tatyana, the choice to focus her business in children’s toys was a simple one for the joy she receives in bringing happiness into children’s lives. Since she opened her business, her professional growth and development have consistently been supported through Nadiya Ukraines’s micro-finance program. A veteran client, Tatyana has repaid each loan faithfully and fully. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan for $500. With this loan, Tatyana plans to purchase additional inventory, maintaining the stable, consistent growth her business has enjoyed across the past decade.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena runs a small business selling leather purses and wallets at the busy Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has been in business for five years. In a typical month, she makes about $400 profit. Elena is married. She and her husband, Victor, have a nine year old son. One of Elena’s goals for her business is to generate sufficient income so that they can purchase an apartment. Elena has requested a loan for $450 to help purchase new inventory for her kiosk. She hopes to see a boost in sales and profits over this busy time of the year. We are happy for the opportunity to support Elena’s business endeavors and help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya is an up and coming entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. Two years ago she started her small business selling leather purses at one of the busy markets in Melitopol. She has a good location at the market as there are not many competitors close by. Over the last two years, Nataliya has built up around $4000 worth of inventory on hand to display and sell. Her net profit is usually around $400 per month. Nataliya has benefited from the financial services provided by Nadiya Ukraine. She has been a great client and has repaid every loan she has taken with no delays. Nataliya has requested a short term loan of $450 to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mwajabu is married with six children. She lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business for years now. Mwajabu thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. She has repaid the loan in full. With the loan money she received, Mwajabu replenished her stock of cosmetics and she has had success selling her products. She hopes to continue to grow her cosmetics business by increasing her stock of cosmetics and introducing women's clothing in her shop. This could help her do more business. When a customer comes for cosmetics, she’ll also have a chance to view some clothes. The new line of business also needs some additional funding. She requests a loan worth USD 750 to increase her stock of cosmetics and purchase the right quantity of clothes.

Mwajabu’s success with cosmetics has stoked her entrepreneurial spirit, and she now also operates a second business in the transportation industry. She has purchased, with the help of her husband, a commuter bus that operates in the Kigamboni neighborhood. The city of Dar es Salaam does not provide bus services; rather, bus services are a private enterprise. Buses (called Dala Dalas) are owned by private individuals who rent them to drivers. The driver pays the owner a certain amount each day and anything he/she makes over that amount is theirs to keep. Mwajabu has purchased a Dala Dala for a route in Kigamboni and makes money renting out the vehicle to service the growing number of residents.

Her income from these ventures helps pay for family expenses and school fees for her children. Her excitement for these businesses was apparent when we talked with her.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Edgar would like to diversify and increase his inventory for his store.

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is married with two children. She lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She runs a food vending business in a busy area of Kigamboni. Mwasiti thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan, she was able to purchase a blender so that she can offer fresh juice to her customers. She also purchased a deep freezer so that she is now able to keep more fish and juice in stock. She is very delighted with these purchases because they have helped her increase her revenue.

Mwasiti has started to build a permanent structure where she can conduct her business. She is requesting a loan worth USD1200 for finishing the structure and buying tables, chairs, food serving dishes, food display cages and ceiling fans.

loans.use: To buy building materials, tables, chairs, and food serving dishes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widow and a mother of three. She hails from the Gulu district but lives in Kampala for now. She has been an active artisan at Life in Africa for the past one and a half years. During these past months she got a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings (about US$150) from Kiva through the LIA community guarantee process. With this loan she developed her peanut butter business which continued to do better with more capital. She bought more raw materials to serve more of her ever-increasing customers.

Through her hard work , Florence managed to pay back her loan in three months. She thinks that she has managed to win many customers due to the increase in her production. The only problem she has now is getting enough product to supply them all. Most of these customers are monthly income earners who take delivery and make payments at the end of the month. During the rest of the time she would be waiting without doing anything. Even if there were more customers to be supplied, she would not have the stock at hand, so she says she needs to really increase her stock to meet the needs of all her customers.

She therefore seeks a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$150) to enable her to meet this high demand. She will be able to repay the loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget in full:

1- groundnuts --------- 180,000/=

2- containers --------- 15,000/=

3 - charcoal ---------- 15,000/=

4- simsim --------- 10,000/=

5- milling charges ------- 20,000/=

6- transport ---------- 10,000/=

TOTAL ----------------- 250,000/=

loans.use: Buying more materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. owns a small shop selling household items. She was able to open her business thanks to a loan from her husband who sent $300 from Italy where he works. Every day from 7am until 9pm, Ms. G. runs her store, which happens to be located in her house.

Victoria is applying for her second loan with Mifex and Kiva. Her first credit was a success as she was able to improve the appearance of her store and invest in products that increased profits and business. She saves a part of her profits in order to improve the standard of living of her children and save up to pay for their education. She says it is hard living as a single mother, but she has no desire to uproot her family and move to a foreign place. This 32 year-old entrepreneur who is from the Provincia de los Rios wants nothing more than to succeed in business and give her kids a better life than she had growing up.

loans.use: Victoria would like to continue investing in different products for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Felix would like to invest in more chickens and feed.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Carmen began her business nine years ago with a little bit of capital that she obtained from selling products such as gifts, paper and craft supplies, and games. Carmen made use of this money and invested it in the preparation of encebollados (a typical food in Ecuador made with albacore fish), which yielded a better income for her. Her business is taking care of her clients daily from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. She also sell sodas and juices.

Loan Use

Carmen needs a loan in order to increase her sales by buying fish, yucca, tomatoes, onions, and lemons in advance preparation for the weeks to come. Carmen tells us that by making this investment, her costs for shipping will go down, because she would like to make her purchases only twice a month. Also, her profits will improve her work site so that it will attract more clients.

Personal Information

Carmen is 43 years old and has three kids who are studying. Carmen is single; her spouse abandoned her four years ago, and since then she has carried on and continued taking care of her children and home. Carmen indicated to us that the reason that she is taking a loan is that she knows her buisness and that money makes more money. With this extra income, she plans to continue improving her home and increasing security for her family, because the area where she lives is dangerous but they have to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Carmen inicio su negocio hace 9 años con un pequeño capital que logro obtener productos de la ventas de artículos como regalos, papelería, juguetes. Carmen dispuso de este dinero y lo invirtió en la elaboración de encebollados (comida tipica de Ecuador hecha con el pescado albacora) que le producen mayores ingresos. Sus ventas son diarias atiende a sus clientes desde las 6: AM a 12: PM además vende colas, jugos

Uso del Préstamo

Carmen necesita de un crédito para poder incrementar sus ventas comprar pescado, yuca, tomates, cebollas y limón para las quincenas. Carmen nos dice que realizando esta inversión sus costos por transporte bajarían porque sus compras las harías 2 veces por mes y pasando 3 días. Además con sus ganancias mejoraría su local para dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Carmen 43 años y 3 hijos que están estudian. Carmen esta sola su esposo la abandono hace 4 años y desde ahí ella ha sacado adelante sus hijos y hogar. Carmen nos indica que es el motivo que hace recurrir a un préstamo, ella sabe hacer negocio y dice que la plata hace la plata. Con esto Carmen piensa seguir adecuando su casa y dar mayor seguridad a su familia porque sector por donde vive es peligroso pero tenemos que sobrevivir indica.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for preparing her client's meals

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Business Description

Hugo began his business five years ago with his own savings. His business is selling plastic articles for the home, such as jars, plates, waste baskets, laundry baskets, brooms, and more. Hugo serves his clients from the shop that he rents near the main avenue of Trinipuerto from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day of the week.

Loan Use

Hugo requests a loan so that he can increase his business and meet the demand of his clients. Due to his service and low prices, his business is in high demand. Hugo will buy more laundry and waste baskets, big and small, and plates and trays.

Personal Information

Hugo is 37 years old and has two children who are studying. Hugo's wife supports him by tending to the clients. Hugo indicated that with this loan he will be able to increase his business and generate a better income that will enable him to give his family a better quality of life. Hugo also plans to save his profits to buy land and be able to build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Hugo se inicio con su negocio hace 5 años con ahorros propios. Su negocio es la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar como: Jarras, Platos, Cestos de Basura y de Ropa. Recogedores de Basura, Escobas y otros artículos más. Hugo atiende a sus clientes en local que arrienda acerca de avenida principal del trinipuerto en horario de 7: AM a 20: PM todos los días de la semana

Uso del Préstamo

Hugo solicita un crédito para incrementar su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes que por la atención y bajos costos de sus productos, tiene mayor demanda. Hugo compra más cestos de ropa y basura, lacaras grandes y medianas, platos y bandejas de loza.

Información Personal

Hugo tiene 37 años y 2 hijos que están estudian. Esposa de Hugo lo apoya en la atención de los clientes. Hugo indica que con el crédito podrá incrementar más su negocio y generar mayores ingresos que permitirían dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Además Hugo piensa ahorrar para poder comprarse un terreno y poder construir su vivienda.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of plastic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tomato-selling business

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia is a local saleswoman of bottled water and soft drinks. In the poor neighborhoods in Ecuador drinking water is scarce. Ligia takes advantage of this situation by providing safe drinking water and other beverages to the members of her community. She uses a tricycle with a platform on the back to sell and deliver these products. She has also discovered that many of her clients would also like the convenience of receiving other products at their door step.

Ligia’s first loan was used towards investing in more bottles of water and buying complimentary products like snack items and candy. She was able to increase her client base and saw her profits increase as a result. She will use her next loan in a similar fashion so she can continue to see her business grow. She and her husband have four children. He helps her with this business and also creates hand made sandals to sell.

loans.use: Ligia would like to buy bottles of water and other complimentary products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tomato-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her little restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her clothing business by adding to her inventory

loans.name: Ángel Iván

texts.es:
Ángel is married and has two children ages 4 and 6. For two years Ángel has worked in a factory located in Escobedo, Nuevo León. But the salary he earned was not enough to meet the needs of his family. Facing this situation, a year ago he decided to start his own business selling tacos. Little by little he has become known among his neighbors for the high quality of his products, which has grown his business.

He is now requesting a loan for US$550 to purchase supplies for his tacos, which he will use to increase production and continue to grow his business. He commits to repay this loan within 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business. Contribute to improve the quality of life of Ángel and his family, they thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Ángel es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 4 y 6 años de edad. Desde hace dos años Ángel es obrero en una fábrica de la localidad de Escobedo en el estado de Nuevo León, pero el salario que recibe era insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta situación decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de tacos hace un año. Poco a poco se ha dado a conocer entre los vecinos y ha hecho crecer su negocio gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos.

Ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los tacos, con esto planea incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, contribuye a mejorar la vida de Ángel y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Mr. Ventura is originally from Escobedo, Nuevo León and has two children who are already married. Given the lack of jobs and the difficulty to earn enough to support his family, six years ago Venture and his wife started their own business selling groceries. Together they grew their business and little by little added to the variety of products offered to provide better service and earn the loyalty of their customers.

The quality of their service and daily efforts helped them retain this business. Ventura wants to boost his sales and therefore he is requesting a loan for US$475 to purchase merchandise. He will repay the loan in 6 months. You can play an important part in the support of this family. Now is the time to help those who need it most.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

El señor Ventura es originario de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León y tiene dos hijos que ya están casados. Ante la falta de empleo y la dificultad para obtener los recursos que necesitan para sostener a su familia, Ventura y su esposa iniciaron su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes desde hace siete años, juntos han logrado sacar adelante su negocio y poco a poco ir surtiendo mejor para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad y contar con la preferencia de sus clientes.

El buen servicio que ofrecen y su esfuerzo diario les ha ayudado a permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio, pero ahora Ventura desea darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en esta familia, hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is 54 years old, single and a mother of three children who are all married. She never had the support of a spouse to raise her children and always had to work very hard to meet their needs. For 20 years she has been selling clothing and cosmetics. She began selling door-to-door and in the traveling markets but her dream was always to own a proper business. Little by little she increased the variety of her products. Recently she leased a retail space, which she hopes will help grow her small business.

Amalia is requesting a loan for US$1,100 to purchase a variety of merchandise for her store. She hopes to provide seasonal items to her customers, which will help boost her sales. She commits to repay this loan within just 5 months because she is confident that her products will sell quickly. Be an important part of Amalia’s success. She needs your support to continue growing and she thanks you for whatever help you can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Amalia tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera y madre de tres hijos, todos ellos ya casados. Ella nunca ha contado con el apoyo de su pareja para el sostén de sus hijos, por lo que Amalia ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para poder darles lo necesario, desde hace 20 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, inició vendiendo casa por casa y en lo mercados rodantes, pero su sueño era tener un negocio bien establecido. Poco a poco fue incrementando la variedad de los productos que comercializa y recientemente ha logrado rentar un local, en el que espera poder continuar creciendo como microempresaria.

Para poder surtir bien su negocio, Amalia está solicitando un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera tener artículos de temporada que ofrecerle a sus clientes para incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en sólo 5 meses, porque confía en la alta rotación de sus productos. Se parte importante en los logros de Amalia, ella necesita de tu apoyo para continuar creciendo y agradece cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is a widow and has two daughters ages 18 and 25. She started her business 5 years ago to help support them. At first it was to help her husband with the household expenses, but later she was left alone to care for her family. She began selling cosmetics and later expanded to sell clothing and shoes, which have been more successful. With this work she has supported her daughters so that they can continue with their studies and hope for a better future.

Gregoria now needs a loan for US$925 to purchase seasonal merchandise which she hopes will boost her sales and grow her business. She commits to repay the loan within 6 months. You can be an important part of Gregoria’s success and help her daughters finish their education. They all thank you sincerely for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Gregoria es viuda y tiene dos hijas de 18 y 25 años de edad, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual inició su negocio hace cinco años, primero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos y después porque quedó sola a cargo de su familia. Empezó a vender cosméticos y fue incorporando la venta de ropa y calzado con lo que ha tenido mejores resultados, de esta manera es como ha apoyado a sus hijas para que continúen estudiando, porque ella quiere que sus hijas puedan concluir sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro.

En estos momentos Gregoria necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía de temporada con lo que espera darle ese impulso que necesita su negocio y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Gregoria y ayuda a que sus hijas puedan finalizar sus estudios, ellas agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana is 38 years old, single with two children ages 16 and 19. They are all originally from Tampico, Tamaulipas. She never had the support of a spouse to help raise her children so she has had to work very hard to earn enough to meet their needs. Since her first child was born Juana has sold cosmetics part time in addition to her full-time job at a local company. Given her situation, and the difficulties she had to meet the family expenses, her children left their studies to begin to work. But Juana wants them to continue with their education, so she has started selling clothing and shoes to earn more money.

In order to grow her business and support her children, Juana needs a loan of US$925 to purchase merchandise. She travels to the city of Moroleón in Guanajuato to purchase goods at wholesale prices, which will help to increase her profitability. She commits to repay the loan within 6 months. Now is the time to help someone who most needs it. Decide to support this family who sincerely appreciates your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Juana tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 19 años de edad, ellos son originarios de la ciudad de Tampico, Tamaulipas. Ella nunca ha tenido el apoyo de su pareja para sostener a sus hijos por lo que ella ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para obtener los recursos que necesitan, desde que nació su primer hijo Juana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sus tiempos libres porque también estaba empleada en una empresa. Ante la situación en la que se encontraba y la dificultad que tenía para poder cubrir sus deudas, sus hijos abandonaron sus estudios y comenzaron a trabajar, pero Juana desea que ellos puedan continuar estudiando para esto ha incorporado la venta de ropa y calzado con lo que está obteniendo mejores resultados.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos, Juana necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella viaja a la ciudad de Moroleón en Guanajuato donde puede conseguir precios de fábrica, con lo que incrementa sus ganancias, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar es esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Romana

texts.es:
Romana is a responsible, hard-working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has a son and a daughter who are 28 and 18 respectively. She and her husband began their own business 24 years ago to support their family. They opened their own hardware store taking advantage of her husband’s knowledge in the field. Little by little their business improved and sales grew. Thanks to the good service they provided, they have now realized the dream of opening two other small stores.

Romana and her husband want to continue growing as small business owners. Therefore they are requesting a loan for US$1,100 to purchase additional merchandise to offer a better variety of products that will best meet the needs of their customers. She commits to repay the loan within 5 months. Become an important part of the growth of this business. Romana thanks you for the opportunity you provide with your contribution which will improve and help grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Romana es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene un hijo y una hija, de 28 y 18 años respectivamente. Ante la necesidad de superarse como familia, hace 24 años ella y su esposo iniciaron su propio negocio, aprovechando los conocimientos y experiencia que su esposo tenía en este ramo iniciaron su ferretería, poco a poco fueron surtiendo mejor e incrementando sus ventas, gracias al buen servicio que ofrecen hoy pueden ver cumplido su sueño al abrir otros dos pequeños locales.

Romana y su esposo desean continuar creciendo como microempresarios, para esto están solicitando un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera tener un buen surtido en su ferretería y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Romana agradece la oportunidad que le brindas con tu contribución de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
