Maria del Carmen is from García, Nuevo Leon. She has 2 children, ages 12 and 15. She has had to work very hard to raise her children because she is divorced and did not have the support of a husband. This is why she started her own business selling tacos. Little by little her client base has grown thanks to the quality of her product and her good customer service.

To further support her business and boost sales, Maria is requesting a loan for US$275 to purchase a grill that will help her increase her taco production and grow her business. She plans to repay the loan within 4 months. Help Maria and her children improve their quality of life by contributing to the growth of her business. Your help will be very useful for this family. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

En La señora Maria del Carmen es originaria de la localidad de García en Nuevo León, ella tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad. Maria ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola porque es divorciada y no cuenta con el apoyo de una pareja para su manutención, esta es la razón por la que inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos, poco a poco se han incrementado sus clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y el buen servicio que ofrece.

Para poder darle un impulso a su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de una parrilla que requiere para la elaboración de los tacos, con esto espera incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Ayuda a que Maria y sus hijos puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida contribuyendo a mejorar su negocio, se parte en este crecimiento, tu ayuda será de mucha utilidad para esta familia, gracias.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Miriam Deyanira

texts.es:
Deyanira is a very hard-working and cheerful woman. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her family is fortunate to own its own home, but they still have mortgage payments to meet so in order to help her husband with the family expenses Deyanira started her own business selling cosmetics. She began selling to friends and neighbors about a year ago. Since then her client base has expanded. At this time she would like a loan of $475 to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Deyanira appreciates your support in the success of her business and the well-being of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Deyanira es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. Afortunadamente les ha sido posible adquirir su propia vivienda, pero aun están pagando las hipotecas lo que reduce el ingreso familiar, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar Deyanira emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos desde hace más de un año, inició vendiendo entre sus vecinas y familiares, gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes ahora se han incrementado mucho sus pedidos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ahora Deyanira está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia y en el crecimiento de este negocio, Deyanira agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena lives in García, Nuevo León. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband's salary is insufficient to meet the cost of raising and educating the children so Rosa helps by selling cosmetics, linens, shoes and food. She would like to see her business expand and is asking for a loan of $650 to buy the merchandise she needs to satisfy customer demand. She will repay the loan within 6 months. Rosa appreciates your help in growing this business and improving her family's quality of life.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En la localidad de García, Nuevo León vive Rosa Elena ella siempre se ha dedicado a las ventas, los productos que comercializa son cosméticos, blancos, zapatos y comidas. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos que se están estudiando, el salario que recibe su esposo es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia razón por la que Rosa inició su negocio. El gusto por las ventas y el deseo de que sus hijos puedan tener una educación de calidad ha hecho que este negocio prospere.

Rosa tiene el deseo de mejorar su negocio y continuar creciendo, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía con la que podrá surtir los pedidos que tiene, para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Celida

texts.en:
Celida E. C. and her husband Victor have eight children and 14 grandchildren. Her small grocery store, named "Colmado Anaceli” after her second daughter, sells food staples, household items and cooking ingredients to her neighborhood of La Pacuala in the northern peninsula of Samana. She would like this loan to continue to restock her store with rice, salt, sugar, filtered water packets, etc. She puts everything that she saves back into the store and she hopes to expand with this loan to increase profits and therefore savings to provide better for her family.

NOTE: Celida is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Celida would like to purchase rice, salt, sugar and filtered water packets for her store.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite J. is the owner of Fritura Margo, a grocery store service in La Union where she sells food products like chicken, plantains, butter, and sugar, as well as essentials like oil for cooking meals. Since she is without a physical storefront, Marguerite is often seen walking the streets of her community faithfully delivering her customer’s orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand the inventory of her store to better meet the needs of her customers. Originally from Haiti, 60-year-old Marguerite is a single mom who enjoys spending time with her oldest son, Leonel, when she is not tending to her business.

Note: Marguerite is one of five microentrepreneurs in her solidarity group - part of an Esperanza Bank of Hope, which they have named "La Union". All of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Marguerite would like to purchase chicken, plantains, cooking oil, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Mrs. P. is married and a mother of two children in school age. Education is very important for her so she created a library where a lot of children go to learn how to read and write and to star using computers. She is asking for the loan because she wants to buy more books so the children are provided with a big variety of reading material. She also plans to invest part of the loan in buying 2 computers and furniture so her clients are more comfortable. She is hoping the loan will allow her have bigger revenue and more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. es casada y madre de dos niños en edad escolar, para ella la educación es muy importante y ha creado una biblioteca a la que asisten muchos niños para a prender a leer y escribir e iniciars en el uso de computadoras. Está solicitando el crédito ya que quiere comprar más libros para que los niños cuenten con una gran variedad de lectura y también piensa invertir otra parte en la compra de 2 computadoras y muebles que den a sus clientes mayor comodidad. Espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus ingresos y atraer más clientes a su biblioteca.

loans.use: The loan will be use to buy books, computers and furniture.

payments.comment: During our most recent audit, we were unable to verify that Ms. Payan was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Deizi (Daisy)

texts.en:
Deizi is a 47 year old single mother. She has a son, Gerson, 10, and a daughter, Fiorella, 18. Deizi currently buys clothes from Lima, formal and informal wear for adults, and sells them to friends and other people she knows. Most of her clients buy on credit and pay her back monthly. In order to have a more consistent income flow, Deizi has started a pastry business, which she prefers rather than selling clothes. She uses a small oven at her home to make a few dozen empanadas, which she sells in the main Plaza in Juliaca. Fieorella and Gerson often stay up until 2:00 am helping their mother make dough for the empanadas.  

She is seeking a loan in order to start up a pastry tienda. She has researched the items necessary in order to begin her business. An industrial oven she would need runs for $1,000 and rent for a small shop in Puno, the busy touristic center in which she hopes to open her shop, is about $150 a month. The $325 loan in addition to the savings and capital she has accumulated would allow Deizi to purchase the necessary startup items she would need to set up her shop and as well as allow her to hire a couple of employees to help manage her pastry/bakery.

loans.use: Expand Pastry Business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Twelve years ago, Alejandrina bought a doll in Cuzco and was dissatisfied with its quality, an event that inspired her to begin making her own dolls.  Since then, she has greatly expanded her doll-making business, selling her items in cities all over Peru.  With the help of her 4 children, Alejandrina works from 6 AM to 10 PM each day, producing at least 200 dolls which she then sells to retailers.  Recently, Alejandrina has expanded her business to include woven items including backpacks, gloves, hats, and sweaters, an enterprise that also allows her to provide employment to many of the women in her loan group.

With a $425 loan, can continue to improve the quality of her products by improving the quality of materials she uses. Alejandrina would someday like to open her own store in Lima where she would exclusively sell products she has made by hand.  She would also like to begin exporting her products to other countries, a goal which requires that she constantly focus on improving the quality of her goods.  If able to open her own store, Alejandrina will be able to enjoy the freedom and profits that accompany self-employment.

loans.use: Improve quality of dolls and woven items.

loans.name: Galdina

texts.es:
Since 6 years ago, I have dedicated myself to sell rustic household items for the home. WIth this business, I have move forward and have been able to provide for my two children and my mother. I'm asking for a $1200 dollars loan to buy merchandise. Thanks to God and to my dedication and enthusiasm, I have got good sales but I need more inventory to supply my business and the needs of my customers. Thanks for you support.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años me he dedicado a la venta de artículos rusticos para la casa. De este negocio he salido adelante con mis dos hijos y mi madre. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la compra de mercancía ya que gracias a Dios he tenido buenas ventas pero necesito mas inventario.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her household products business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos lives in Santa Catarina and has been a carpenter for more than 20 years. When he was very young he started to work in a workshop where he learnt the trade and thanks to his desire to do well he saved in order to open his own workshop. It is here that he earns money to sustain his family. He is married and has a young son and they have been his motivation to improve and grow this business.

The good service and the quality products that he offers have lead him to earn a lot of clients however his production has been interrupted as one of the machines he uses has broken down. In order to repair this machine he is asking for a loan of $275 which he will repay over a period of 3 months. You can help this family as with your contribution Carlos can continue to work. He and his family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Santa Catarina vive Carlos, tiene más de 20 años que se dedica a la carpintería, desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en un taller donde aprendió el oficio, gracias a sus deseos de superación fue ahorrando para lograr abrir su propio taller de carpintería, de donde ahora obtiene los recursos que necesita para el sostén de su familia, él es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, ellos han sido su motivo para mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

El buen servicio y la calidad de los productos que ofrece lo ha llevado a ganar muchos clientes, ahora su producción se ha visto interrumpida porque una de las máquinas que emplea se ha descompuesto y para su reparación está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, con tu contribución Carlos podrá seguir trabajando, él y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To repair machinery/Reparación de maquinaria

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl is married and has 2 children who are studying. He is a busboy in a restaurant but in order to cover their household costs he started his own business selling food at the weekend. With the help of his family this has gone well and he has increased the variety of foods that they offer as the clients like the good quality of his food. The family union has been key in the development and growth of this business.

In order to increase his earnings he would like to open his business during the week too, and for this he is asking for a loan of $750 which he will use to buy ingredients to increase his production. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Be a part of this growth and help Raúl and his family to take the next step in this business. They thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Raúl es casado y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, él trabaja como mesero en un restaurante pero para poder cubrir con los gastos de su hogar inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, que realiza solo los fines de semana, con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado sacarlo adelante y ha incrementado la variedad de comidas que ofrece al igual que sus ventas porque la buena calidad de sus productos han sido del gusto de los clientes. La unión familiar ha sido pieza clave en el desarrollo y crecimiento de este negocio.

Para poder incrementar sus utilidades, Raúl desea que su negocio pueda creer para lo que planea abrirlo toda la semana para esto está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte en este crecimiento y ayuda a Raúl y a su familia a que den el siguiente paso en su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia is a very hard working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and her husband does seasonal agricultural work. It was therefore difficult to meet their household costs. Hortencia therefore started her own business selling perfumes house to house. In this way she has been able to help her husband cover their costs. Her love of sales and her character has made it easy for her to relate to people and her business has grown.

In order to meet her clients’ needs, Hortencia is asking for a loan of $375 which she will use to buy merchandise. She will repay this amount over a period of 5 months. You can be a part of the growth of this business and help to improve the living conditions of this family. Don’t think twice, they will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hortencia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, ella es casada, su esposo es albañil y realiza trabajos sólo por temporadas por lo que en ocasiones era muy difícil cubrir las deudas del hogar, como Hortencia es una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, también realiza ventas de perfumes casa por casa, de esta manera es como apoya a su esposo con las obligaciones de su hogar. Su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con las demás personas le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Hortencia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 5 meses. Tú puedes ser parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira lives in G. in Nuevo León. She is a very fast learning and active woman. She is married with 3 children; the youngest is 2 years old. They were her motivation for starting her own business more than a year ago. Her husband is a worker and his salary is not sufficient to cover their household costs. To help him with these costs Rosa started to sell homemade food which she delivers to people’s houses for which she has a lot of clients.

In order to keep her business growing Rosa needs a loan of $250 which she will use to buy ingredients to increase the variety of foods that she offers and to increase her sales. She promises to repay this loan over as period of 3 months. You can be a part of her achievements; she wants to improve the quality of life of her family and thanks to you it can be possible, don’t doubt, just support her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de G., Nuevo León vive Rosa Elvira ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, es casada y tiene tres hijos, el más pequeño es de sólo 2 años de edad, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio desde hace más de un año. Su esposo es obrero y su salario es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, para poder apoyarlo en los gastos Rosa empezó con la venta de comidas, ella elabora estos alimentos en su hogar y realiza entregas a domicilio, esto le ha permitido incrementar su clientela rápidamente.

Para poder continuar creciendo, Rosa necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para incrementar la variedad de comidas que ofrece a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte en los logros de Rosa, ella desea poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, gracias a ti puede ser posible, no lo dudes más y apóyala.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria  Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepción has been making cakes for 10 years. She has 3 children who are married so she now lives alone. In order to earn an income which would cover her household costs Maria started her own business doing in children’s parties. Fortunately, it has gone very well, and she also offers a cake making service. Thanks to her experience as a cake decorator her client base, and therefore her business, has grown.

In order to increase production and improve the quality of her cakes Maria is now asking for a loan of $925 which she will use to buy an industrial size cake mixer which will mean that she can meet her clients’ needs. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. She thanks you very much for the opportunity that you can offer her to improve and grow as a micro businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Concepción tiene más D. 10 años dedicándose a L. elaboración D. pasteles, elL. tiene tres hijos que ya están casados y ahora vive soL.. Para poder obtener un ingreso que permitiera cubrir sus gastos, Maria inició su propio negocio con L. renta D. un salón D. fiestas infantiles, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien, también ofrece sus servicios D. repostería y gracias a L. experiencia que tiene realiza originales decorados D. pasteles lo que le ha ayudado a incrementar sus clientes y crecer con su negocio.

Para poder incrementar su producción y mejorar L. calidad D. sus pasteles, ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo D. $925 dólares que utilizará en L. compra D. una batidora industrial, D. esta manera espera poder cubrir L. demanda D. sus clientes, elL. se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte D. sus logros, elL. agradece L. oportunidad que le brindas D. mejorar y crecer como microempresaria.

loans.use: To buy equipment/Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is a very hard working and responsible woman. Her husband works in a factory where he earns very little. Therefore, Candelaria started her own business selling stationary about a year ago. Little by little her business has grown and the quality of her service has improved. In this way she is able to earn money to cover their household costs which her husband’s salary could not.

Candelaria is now asking for a loan of $200 to buy a machine which will allow her business to grow. She will repay this loan over a period of 4 months. Today you can help someone who really needs it and contribute to the growth of her business. Candelaria thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Candelaria es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, su esposo labora en una empresa ladrillera donde gana muy poco, ante esta necesidad Candelaria inició su propio negocio vendiendo papelería hace más de un año, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio y mejorando la calidad del servicio que ofrece, de esta manera obtiene un ingreso que le permite cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y pagar los servicios básicos que sólo con el salario de su esposo sería imposible.

En estos momentos, Candelaria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de una máquina para enmicar, la necesita para hacer crecer su negocio ya que sus clientes le demandan mucho este servicio, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Candelaria te lo agradece mucho.

loans.use: To buy equipment/Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is a very hard working man and comes from Guadalupe in Nuevo León. He is disabled and this means he cannot find work in a company. After having been rejected for various jobs he decided to start his own business doing electrical repairs two years ago and he started it from his home. The good service that he offers has brought him a lot of clients and now he employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs.

Armando’s desire is to keep growing as a micro businessman, and in order to do this he is asking for a loan of $750 to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment so that he can improve the quality of service that he offers and so that his business can continue to grow. He will repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Your help will be very useful for Armando and he sincerely thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Armando es un hombre muy trabajador, es originario de la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León, él tiene una discapacidad y esto le impedía conseguir un empleo en una empresa, después de haber sido rechazado en varios trabajos decidió iniciar su propio negocio haciendo reparaciones eléctricas desde hace dos años, inició en su propio domicilio acondicionando un pequeño lugar. El buen servicio que ofrece pronto le llevó a tener muchos clientes y ahora cuenta con la colaboración de una persona para poder cubrir la demanda por sus servicios.

El deseo de Armando es continuar creciendo como microempresario, para esto solicita de un crédito por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su local y compra de equipo de trabajo, para mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para Armando, él agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Refurbishment and to buy equipment/Remodelación y compra de equipo

loans.name: Narcedalia

texts.es:
Narcedalia has three children of 1, 7 and 9 years of age. They are what motivated her to start her own business selling cosmetics. She is separated from her husband and has to work hard everyday to keep her family going. She started in sales 6 years ago to help her husband cover their household costs and to improve their quality of life. After the separation she was in sole charge of their children and her desire to give them the best motivates her to improve and see her business grow everyday.

In order to meet her clients’ needs she is now asking for a loan of $550 to buy merchandise. She promises to repay this sum over a period of 6 months. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands. They thank you very much for the trust and support you can give them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Narcedalia tiene tres hijos, de 1, 7 y 9 años de edad, quienes fueron su motivo para iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y blancos, ella está separada y se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a su familia. Comenzó con las ventas seis años atrás, para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida, después de la separación ella se quedó sola a cargo de sus hijos y el deseo de darles lo mejor la impulsan cada día a mejorar y a hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora está solicitando un crédito de $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a very responsible woman. She has four children ages 12, 15, 20, and 22 years old. She has thirteen years of sales experience. Eight years ago and due to her husband's separation, she works full-time selling clothes and electric appliances at the markets. She is the main breadwinner of the family. She does it to obtain the income that her family needs and to be able to support her children's education. All that responsibility hasn't been easy on Martha but her family's welfare is her reward.

To make her business grow and increase the selection of products, Martha asks for a $375 dollars loan. She will use it for buying seasonal clothes and electric appliances. She promises to return the loan in 4 months. Help improve this family's life. Martha needs your help a lot so she can help her family move forward. Martha thanks you for the trust and support that you give her.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer muy responsable. Tiene cuatro hijos, de 12, 15, 20 y 22 años de edad. Tiene trece años de dedicarse a las ventas. Desde que se dio la separación de su esposo, hace ocho años, se dedica de tiempo completo a la venta de ropa y aparatos eléctricos en los mercados ante la necesidad de obtener los ingresos que su familia requiere y para que sus hijos pudieran continuar estudiando. No ha sido fácil para ella tener tanta responsabilidad pero el bienestar de su familia es su mejor recompensa.

Para hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar la variedad de sus productos Martha solicita un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de ropa de temporada y aparatos electrónicos. Ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Martha necesita mucho de tu ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos y agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Carla Deyanira

texts.es:
Responsibility and enthusiasm are traits that Carla possess. She is married and is the mother of three children ages: 3, 5, and 8 years old. Her husband works in construction and with his salary they were unable to cover all the family needs.

Aftr the birth of their third child, the household expenses increased considerably. Since Carla is an entrepreneurial woman, she started her own business selling cheeses and "chorizos"(sausages) to help her husband with the debts. She started buying and re-selling these products but now she is able to buy them directly from the wholesaler. It has help her to increase her profits.

Carla wishes that her business grows and she is asking now for a $1,100 dollars loan. She will use it for buying merchandise to cover her customers' demands and continue offering the preferred products. She offers to return the amount back in 6 months. Be part of this business! Help by improving the life of this family. They thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsabilidad y entusiasmo son características que posee Carla. Ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 5 y 8 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción y con su salario no se podían cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia.

Después del nacimiento de su tercer hijo los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron considerablemente, y como Carla es una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio con la venta de quesos y chorizos para poder ayudar a su esposo con las deudas. Inició comprando y revendiendo estos productos pero ahora se surte directo del proveedor lo que le ha ayudado a mejorar sus ganancias.

Carla desea que su negocio crezca y ahora está solicitando un préstamo por $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia. Ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her cheese and sausage shop.

loans.name: Alma Mireya

texts.es:
Eight years ago and motivated by the desire to improve her family's quality of life, Alma started her own business by selling shoes from a catalog. She is married and has two children ages 10 and 15 years old. Her husband is a laborer and works on his own. That has made it a little difficult to get what her family needs. Alma wants to give her kids and education so they have a better future, but with her husband's salary alone, it is not possible.

She likes sales and her character has help her very much in growing as an entrepreneurial woman. Now her orders have increase considerably and needs a $1,200.00 dollars loan to fulfill them.She commits herself to return this amount in only 3 months. She trusts the speed of rotation of her products.and her ability. Contribute to the growth of this business! You can be an important part of this family's life. Thank you

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ocho años Alma inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado por catálogo, motivada por el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 10 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y trabaja por su cuenta. Esto ha dificultado un poco el obtener lo necesario para su familia. Alma quiere que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tengan un mejor futuro, pero sólo con el salario de su esposo esto no es posible.

El gusto por las ventas y su carácter le han ayudado mucho a crecer como microempresaria. Ahora sus pedidos se han incrementado considerablemente y necesita de un préstamo de $1,200 dólares para poder surtirlos. Ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses, porque confía en la rapidez de rotación de sus productos. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de esta familia, gracias.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her shoe business.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe was born in Garcia, Nuevo Leon.. She is a hard working and responsible woman. All of her children are already married and today she lives by herself. For more than 5 years, she has dedicated herself to sell cosmetics. This business is her only income source and one of her sons helps her with the distribution of the products. Her wish is to move forward with her business and her love for sales had allow her to improve and grow her business.

Due to the high demand for her products, Maria asks for a $250 dollars loan. She plans to invest it to buy merchandise. This way she can offer better customer service. She commits to return this amount back in 4 months. Be an important part of Maria's life. Help her to continue working. She thanks you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe nació en García, Nuevo León. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Sus hijos ya están casados y actualmente vive sola. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos donde la ayuda uno de sus hijos en la distribución de sus productos. Su deseo de salir adelante y su gusto por las ventas han permitido que Maria mejore y haga crecer su negocio.

Ante la creciente demanda por sus productos, Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que planea invertir en la compra de mercancía y de esta manera ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Maria, ayúdala a continuar trabajando. Ella agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her cosmetics' business.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Don José works as teacher in a school of his community; he has a teaching experience of 25 years. He has 10 years experience working in agriculture and 20 years experience working in commerce. He has a small shop where he sells supplies, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. Since the rice crop season is over, at the moment he is only working in commerce and in education, having this way different sources of income.

Loan Use

José needs the loan to buy merchandise such oil, soap, supplies and other products for the shop, in order to a larger variety of products and keep his clients satisfied.

Personal information

At present our friend José is 49 years old, he lives with his wife, who helps him with the work around the house, they have a very clean cement structure house. Thanks to both their efforts they have their beautiful son in school, since they were only able to have one. José's dream is to reactivate the economy and commerce in the area and generate more sources of work for the inhabitants of the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don José se dedica como maestro en una escuela de su comunidad, en la que tiene 25 anos de experiencia, educando. Además también se dedica a la agricultura con 10 anos de experiencia y al comercio con 20 anos, como una pequeña tienda de venta de víveres, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.…. Por motivo que la temporada de siembra de arroz ya paso, solamente se ha dedicado por el momento al comercio y a la educación, teniendo así otras fuentes de ingresos.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como aceites, víveres, jabones y otros productos de tienda, para así tener mas surtido el local de tal manera que mantenga su clientela, con el propósito de atenderlos adecuadamente y así tener a sus clientes conformes y satisfechos.

Información Personal

En la actualidad nuestro amigo José tiene 49 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposa, quien le ayuda con las labores del hogar y gracias a ello tienen su casa de estructura de cemento, muy aseada. Gracias al esfuerzo que realiza junto a su esposa tienen estudiando a un bello hijo, ya que solo han podido procrear uno. Los sueños de José es reactivar la economía y el comercio en el sector y generar mas fuentes de trabajo a los ciudadanos del sector

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

José has only worked in agriculture; he has had crops of pigeon-peas and corn. Thanks to his more than 10 years experience, he has been able to support himself economically. Now he has a small shop where he works from very early of the day, gaining clientele and experience in the business.

Loan Use

Our friend José is asking for the loan to reactivate his sown land. He want to buy the inputs and products needed for his crops like corn, but his biggest investment will be the purchase of merchandise for his small but cozy shop, since he wants to work not only in agriculture but in commerce as well.

Personal information

At present José is 47 years old and he is married. His wife also helps him with the crops. They work every day for the well-being of their only son who is in school now. They have a cozy house with a cement structure, they have happily lived in this area for 20 years. He hopes that with the loan his life conditions will improve and this way he will serve better the community and relatives of his area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

José se a dedicado netamente a la agricultura, llegando a tener cultivos de Gandul y Maíz, en la que gracias a su experiencia, que tiene ya 10 anos, a podido mantenerse económicamente. Y gracias a ello tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual se dedica desde muy temprano del día, ganando clientela y experiencia en el negocio

Uso del Préstamo

Nuestro amigo José pide el préstamo para reactivar sus sembríos, comprando los insumos y productos que requiere y necesita dicho cultivo como es el Maíz, pero su mayor inversión es en la compra de víveres para su pequeña pero acogedora tienda, ya que no solo se quiere dedicar a la agricultura sino también al comercio .

Información Personal

En la actualidad José tiene 47 anos de edad y actualmente esta casado. Su esposa también le ayuda en la agricultura. Ellos luchan día a día por el bienestar de su único hijo que ha llegado a procrear el mismo que actualmente estudia, las condiciones de su vivienda son acogedoras de estructura de cemento, felizmente tienen viviendo 20 anos en esta zona. El aspira que con el préstamo sus condiciones de vida lleguen a mejorar para así servir aun más a la comunidad y allegados de su sector.

loans.use: Invest in his shop and his land

loans.name: Alsi

texts.es:
Business Description

Alsi has been buying and selling bottled water for the past 8 years, he started his business with little money he saved from the company he used to work. He bought large water bottles and started distributing them in different domiciles around the area where the lives. He works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. At present he has 3 persons helping him in the distribution of the water.

Loan Use

Alsi wants to use the loan to improve the premises where the water is bottled. This way, he will be able to sell water of better quality and he will be able to get more clients in other areas, since the demand of bottled water is growing.

Personal information

Alsi is 39 years old, he is married and has 2 young children who are in school. His wife has a canteen, this business helps as well with the family’s expenses. Alsi lives in his mother’s house, she gave him the upstairs part of the house so he could live there with his family. The house is of cement and still needs to be finished. Alsi wants to use the loan to help in the grow of his business and in this way grow with his family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Alsi tiene 8 años dedicado a la compra y venta de botellones de agua, el empezó su negocio con un pequeño dinero que tenia de un empresa donde laboró. Compro botellones de agua y empezó a distribuirlos en diferentes domicilios por el sector donde el vive. El trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 17pm. Actualmente tiene 3 personas que le ayudan en la distribución del agua.

Uso del Préstamo

Alsi desea el crédito para mejorar su local donde embasan el agua. Para de esta manera vender agua de mejor calidad y poder captar mas números de clientes en otros sectores. Ya que la demanda que el tiene de los botellones de agua esta en crecimiento.

Información Personal

Alsi tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están estudiando en el colegio. Su esposa tiene un comedor y también con esto ayuda para los gastos de la casa. Alsi vive en la casa de su mamá que le dio parte de arriba de la casa para que viva el con su familia. La casa es de cemento y aun falta de terminarla. Alsi desea el crédito con el fin de crecer en su negocio y de esta manera ir creciendo con su familia.

loans.use: Refit his business premises

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Business Description

Aura has an experience of 15 years as a merchant. She started selling food 10 years ago. Thanks to the help of her husband she gathered the capital and started selling lunches and snacks. She has done well due to the good taste of her meals. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. and in the weekends until 12 p.m. She is also investing in the purchase of yogurt per liter. Moreover she sells clothes to her friends being this another source of income.

Loan Use

The loan will be use to buy kitchen tools. She will also buy merchandise since she has a business unit at the city’s market. She has a good demand and she hopes to please all of her clients.

Personal information

Aura is married. She is 46 years old and has 5 children. Two of them are in school. In their free time they help her mother to serve the clients and also with the purchases. His husband works as a bus driver. Thanks to both their work, they have managed to finish little by little their small house. Her wish is to give a better home environment to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Aura tiene una experiencia de 15 años con el comercio. Hace 10 se inicio sola con la venta de comida. Gracias a la ayuda de su esposo reúne capital y comienza con su venta de almuerzos y meriendas. Le ha ido muy bien que la buscan debido a su buena sazón en las comidas. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. y los fines de semana hasta las 12 p.m. También esta invirtiendo en la compra de yogurt por litro. Además también vende ropa a sus amistades convirtiéndose este en otro ingreso para el hogar.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de utensilios de cocina. Y también en la compra de mercadería ya que ella tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad. Tiene una buena demanda y espera poder complacer a todos sus clientes.

Información Personal

Aura esta casada. Tiene 46 años y 5 hijos. Dos de ellos estudian. En sus momentos libres le ayudan a su mama en la atención del local y también con las compras. Su esposo trabaja de chofer en un colectivo de la ciudad. Gracias a su trabajo y el de su esposo ha logrado poco a poco ir terminando su casita. Su deseo es darle un mejor ambiente a su familia.

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools and merchandise

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Business Description

David has helped serving his mother’s business since he was quite young. From his father he learned the baker’s occupation. He got married one year ago and along with his wife managed to establish his own bakery. His sister helped him with merchandise. Little by little and being responsible he has managed to obtain loans so his business is the source to support his family. David has a shop and a bakery where he has put into practice the knowledge that his parents taught him. He works every day from 5:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. His wife helps him serving the clients. He also sells gas cylinders for domestic use.

Loan Use

The credit will be use to buy merchandise in order to have other products that have a lot of demand. He will refit his premises to provide a better service.

Personal information

David is 23 years old. Currently he has no children. His wife besides helping him in the business, she sells cosmetics. His wish is to be able to buy the small house where they live now and have the shop. The house belongs to his sister and she will allow them to pay her in installments to be able to buy it. He hopes that with the loan he will be able to fulfill his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

David desde muy joven le ayudaba a su mama en la atención del negocio. Con su papa aprendió el oficio de elaborar panes. Hace un año se caso y junto a su esposa logro montar su propio local. Su hermana le ayudo con mercadería. El poco a poco siendo responsable ha logrado obtener créditos con los que su negocio ha podido mantenerlo. Tiene una tienda y panadería donde ha puesto en práctica sus conocimientos. Gracias a la ayuda de sus padres que le enseñaron. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 5:30 a.m. hasta las 9:30 p.m. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención del local. También tiene venta de cilindros de gas de uso domésticos.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además exhibir otros productos que tiene demanda. Adecua un poco su local para dar mejor servicio.

Información Personal

David tiene 23 años. Al momento no tiene hijos. Su esposa a más de ayudarle en el local se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Su deseo es poder comprar la casita donde viven y tienen el local. La casa es de su hermana y ella les va ha dar facilidad para poder obtenerla. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder cumplir su sueño.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem Sok H. is 26 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has one child, who is still too young to attend school. To cover the family’s living expenses, Kem Sok H. sells various soft drinks to the people in her area. From this business activity she makes on average about $3.70/day in income. Her husband is employed as a police officer and earns around $3/day.

Kem Sok H. has to spend a lot on transportation every day, especially on transporting the products she sells from the wholesalers to her store. She is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorcycle to allow her to cut down on transportation costs and improve her profit margin. She and her family are grateful and appreciative of your kind support.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her business transportation.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Kem So Hoeun has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin S. is a married woman aged 40 who has three children. She and her husband work diligently on their farm growing rice and breeding ducks. They typically earn up to $4/day in income from selling ducks' eggs and a variety of their crops. Two of their children are employed at a local garment factory, and the other attends school.

This couple would like to raise more ducks to generate more income from eggs, but financial constraints limit them. Currently, Bin S. is requesting a loan of US$ 400. She hopes the expansion of her family's farming business will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks to raise for eggs

payments.comment: Bin Sokha has successfully repaid her loan early! Thank you for helping her to expand her business and improve life for her family.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John B. is a Ugandan from the Muyankole tribe. He is a client of Life in Africa , through which he received his first Kiva loan. He resigned from his previous job to work with Life in Africa, where he is employed as a gardener. John is very dedicated to his work.

His first loan request was for $480 to finish building his house, which he successfully completed. He made regular payments for the first four months but faced some difficulties paying in the last two months because his wife, who was expecting, fell ill and later delivered. Happily, he eventually paid off his loan in full.

John is now requesting a loan to build a kitchen so as to separate the living room in his house from the kitchen. As the project will cost $300 and John has just $150 in savings, he is requesting a loan for the other $150 from Kiva.

Apart from his gardening work at Life in Africa, John has a shop that will help him repay his loan. Once given this loan he will be able to repay in three months.

Below is his budget: (The individual items are denoted in Ugandan shillings and the total has been converted to US$)

8 iron sheets of 32 gauge @ 12,000/= …………….96,000

1000 bricks @ 70…………………………………...70,000

5, bags of cement @ 20,000……………………….100,000/=

8 roofing timbers @ 5500…………………………..44,000/=

2 trips of sand @ 60,000…………………………..120,000/=

4kgs of nails @ 2500………………………………10,000/=

Labor @ 60,000……………………………………..60,000/=

Total………………………………………………..500,000/= ($300 : $150 from John's savings and $150 from a Kiva loan)

loans.use: Buying building materials

loans.name: Vitervo

texts.es:
Business Description

Vitervo has 15 years of experience in agriculture and knows how to grow rice, corn, beans and such. In addition, he is an experienced cattle-trader, a pursuit which takes up much of his time, though of course, on the farm, time is always at a premium.

Use of Loan

Vitervo will use this loan to purchase more cattle, supplementing his income from farming.

Personal Information on the Borrower

Vitervo is married to Santa with whom he has five beautiful children, two in school. He works very hard to care for his family and their small, charming cement home. He hopes to increase the acreage and head of cattle under his care.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Vitervo es agricultor en la cual se a dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 15 anos ganando cada día mas experiencia en el manejo de los cultivos como arroz, maíz, gandul etc.…a mas también se dedica la compra y venta de ganado, ya que la ganadería es otro tipo de ingreso que Vitervo posee, la mayoría del tiempo la dedica a esta actividad, que por ser netamente del campo siempre la disponibilidad de tiempo es total.

Uso del Préstamo

Vitervo necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor cabezas de ganado, ya que no solamente de la agricultura se mantiene, sino que busco otra manera de ingresos y una de esas actividades es la ganadería.

.

Información Personal

Actualmente Vitervo es casado con dona Santa, en donde han llegado a procrear 5 hermosos hijos, que en la actualidad estudian 2 de ellos. Vitervo con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo mantiene su familia unida, en su pequeña y acogedora casa de estructura de cemento. Nuestro amigo Vitervo tiene por objetivos tener mayor número de terrenos para cultivarlas y tener mayor cantidad de cabezas de ganado

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. hails from western Uganda and a mother of four children. She is a humble lady and very honest. She is a Life in Africa member and is one of the most dedicated members of the community. She works as a cleaner and also does some handicraft work. She has been a Life in Africa member for the last two years. She previously requested a loan of $480 for the purpose of buying and selling produce, a business which she has been operating very profitably.

Rose is among Life in Africa's best borrowers. She has never had any complications in paying back her loan despite her many responsibilities as a single parent raising and paying school fees for her children. Her business has dipped slightly because of paying school fees for one of her children who is in senior four and about to sit for the national examinations.

However, Rose still feels that she should continue with her business. She is therefore seeking a $150 loan to restock her business. She will be able to repay this loan once given in four months

Below is her budget:

(The individual items are listed in Ugandan shillings and the total has been converted to US$)

3 sacks of beans @ 80,000…………………….240,000/=

Transport from the truck to the store …………6000/=

3 bags @ 1000…………………………………3000 / =

Others…………………………………………..1000/=

Total …..................250,000 ($150)

loans.use: Buying more produce

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Manzura is  47 years old and is married with 5 children.  She lives in a 2 room apartment with her husband and two little girls. Two of her sons  work in Russia. Another one is in the army. Her husband is unemployed.  Manzura has been dealing in children's clothes and boots. It is the single source of income of her family. Last year, she received a loan from Microinvest, which really stimulated her business. Her business increased and with the profit she purchased two sheep for feeding. She is asking for another loan for the further extension of her business.

loans.use: for the further extension of her business

loans.name: Nighty

texts.en:
Nighty, who hails from the northern district of Kitgum in Uganda, has been a member of LiA since 2005. She has also been working with the Invisible Children bracelet project where she still works. These one and half years have really changed Nighty. She has been able to make a big change in her housing with her first Kiva loan of $480 through LiA. She managed to pay this loan back largely efficiently. With this loan she has built a small family house and worked so hard that she has been able to roof the whole house.

This development has brought back her husband who had initially deserted the family for another woman. Nighty and her husband are once again living happily together with their children. This has given Nighty more motivation in her work. She deeply wishes to have a very strong home and wishes to see her children and everybody in her household living a happy life.

She therefore would like to fix the windows of her new house. Currently, they are only covered with pieces of timber which can‘t be opened at all. She would therefore like to buy fittings for her windows so as to have proper windows. She believes having proper windows will help her maintain better health for her children, since there’s no fresh air in the house and this can pose some health problems for her family.

To help her accomplish this plan, Nighty is requesting a loan of $150 which she will be able to repay in 4 months.

Below is her budget in full: (The individual items are listed in Ugandan shillings and the total has been converted into US$)

1- window frames 3x 30,000/= ------ 90,000/=

2- shutters 3 x 50,000 ------150,000/=

3- Transport ------10,000/=

4- TOTAL -------250,000/= ($150)

Nighty has already saved $50 which she will use to pay for labour to install the windows.

loans.use: Buying window fittings

loans.name: Sing

texts.en:
A 62-year-old woman, Sing N. is a widow and lives with her 2 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a diligent mother who struggles to cover the family's expenses by making and selling several kinds of Khmer traditional cakes such as Num Korng and Num Krouch to the people in her community.

With this business activity, Sing N. can typically make about $2/day in profit. Her two children help the family generate more income by working as tailors. Currently, Sing N. needs more cloth and thread for her children's inventory due to increased demand from their clients. This family believes they will be able to save enough to expand their business still further in the next couple of years.

loans.use: Needs cloth and thread for her children's tailoring business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sing Nhan has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you make it possible for entrepreneurs around the world to access loans to invest into their small businesses and families. 

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Lili

texts.pt:
Lili R. was born September 1, 1950 in Catembe, Maputo. Her parents split when she was young and she lived with her mother, but her mother didn't have the money to pay for schooling, so she only studied through 4th grade. Life was hard, and she had to get a job at age 15 in a shoe factory where she worked for 5 years. Her family moved, and because the new house was far from the factory, Lili had to look for work closer to home.

She became pregnant at age 18 and stopped working. Life became more difficult all the time since the father of her child was older and had a wife. Lili had to look for another job in a tailor shop where she worked as a seamstress for a few years. Later, she got together with a Portuguese man who wanted her to go to Portugal with him. Out of fear, she refused to go. After that, she met another man with whom she had 4 children and they still live together to this day.

The tailor shop closed and she decided to open her own business by going to South Africa to buy clothes and selling in Mozambique. After facing some difficulties, LIli decided to move the business and she traveled northern Mozambique buying cows, goats, and cereals to resell in Maputo. Since this business was so demanding and risky, she quit and traveled to Inhambane where she bought fish and chickens to resell in the capital city. Some time later, one of her daughters taught her to raise broiler chickens, which she continues to do.

With the loan, she will buy chicks and feed which will improve her business. In the future, she hopes to build a large aviary where she will raise a other birds such as turkeys, swans, ducks. She hopes to employ 3 men to help her carry out this activity once she buys land for it in the Marracuene district of Maputo.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilí R. , nascido em 1 de Setembro de 1950 na Catembe em Maputo. ainda muito nova os pais separaram –se tendo ficado a viver com a mãe e porque esta não tinha condições para custear os seus estudos , estudou apenas até 4ª classe . Porque a vida estava difícil , teve que procurar emprego aos 15 anos numa Fábrica de sapatos onde trabalhou durante 5 anos .A família muda de residência e , porque onde foram morar era longe do serviço e o que ganhava não dava para cobrir despesas de transporte e outras , teve que procurar emprego próximo de casa.

Aos 18 anos fica grávida e deixa de trabalhar , porque a vida tornava-se cada vez mais difícil uma vez que o homem que lhe engravidara era mais velho e tinha outra Mulher teve que procurar outro emprego numa Alfaiataria onde trabalhou como Custureira alguns anos. Depois juntas com um português e este dicide ir com ela á Portugal e por medo recusou-se a ir com ele , pouco tempo depois junta-se com outro homem com qual tem 4 filhos e com ele vive até hoje.

Porque a Alfaiataria fechou , decide iniciar o seu negócio indo á RSA comprar roupas e vender em moçambique tendo encarado algumas dificuldades .Assim sendo , decide mudar de negócio onde passou a viajar ao norte de Moçambique comprando gado bovino e caprino , Cereais para revender em Maputo e por ser um negócio que exijia muito esforço e certos riscos, abandona este negócio passando a viajar á Inhambane onde comprava peixe e galinhas para revender na capital. Algum tempo depois uma das filhas ensina lhe a criar frangos de corte actividade que desenvolve até então.

Com o crédito de 17.000,00 mt comprou pintos e ração o que dum certo mudo melhorou o seu negócio. Futuramente pretende construir um grande Aviário onde deseja criar uma série de Aves como perús , Gansos, patos , poedeiras e empregar três Homens para lhe ajudar nesta actividade uma vêz que já possui um terreno para tal no distrito de Marracuene na provincia do Maputo.

loans.use: Chicken production

payments.comment: Lili has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
Regina J. was born August 1, 1956 in the Chamanculo neighborhood of Maputo. Her parents abandoned her when she was 5 and she went to live with another woman and was raised by that woman's mother. At the age of 13, she lost this second mother and went to live with her older brothers until she was 19 years old. She studied through the 7th grade. She also had small businesses. When she was 30, her older brothers died and she lived with her nephews.

She learned to weave textiles, and she made cloth and towels for sale. Later, she left this activity to sell drinks instead. She also tutored children from grades 1 through 5 in her home, and was able to save enough money to build a stand where she carries out her business today.

She lives with 8 people, 6 of whom she supports. She learned of Hluvuku through a neighbor. Because she is disabled and cannot move about easily, she took advantage of the fact that one of the loan officers works in the area and she applied for a loan.

She has applied to buy inventory for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a hair salon and to buy a car to make transportation easier. As a disabled person, she moves with the help of a small cart and some transport vehicles will not accept her onboard.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Rejina José nascido no dia 1 de agosto de 1956 , no bairro de chamanculo em Maputo . Quando tinha cinco anos ,o pai lhes abandona e foi viver com outra mulher ficando a ser criado por sua mãe. Aos 13 anos perde a Mãe passando a viver com os seus irmãos mais velhos até aos 19 anos, estudou até 7ª classe e ,tambem fazia pequenos negócios aos 30 anos os dois irmãos mais velhos morrem passando a viver com seus sobrinhos.

Aprendeu a fazer tecelagem, onde passou a fazer panos e toalhas para venda .Algum tempo depois abandona esta actividade passando a vender refrigerantes e tambem dava explicação a alunos da 1ª a 5ª classe em casa tendo juntado algum dinheiro com qual construiu uma barraca onde até então desenvolve a sua actividade comercial.

Vive actualmente com 8 pessoas em que 6 estão na sua responsabilidade. Atravês duma amiga Vizinha ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku e porque ela é deficiente físico e não pode se deslocar facilmente , e porque um dos oficiais de crédito tem trabalhado na quela zona , aproveitou formalizar o seu pedido.

Com o valor de 10.000,00mt financiado aplicou na compra de produtos para reforçar o seu negócio . Futuramente pretende construir um salão de cabelereiro e comprar uma viatura para facilitar a sua locomoção sendo deficiente físico actualmente desloca-se com auxílio de uma carrinha e alguns transportadores não aceitam lhe levar.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Amelia M. was born July 25, 1953 in Catembe, Maputo. After her parents divorced when she was very young, she spent her childhood with her mother. She studied until 5th grade because her mother did not have the money to pay for more schooling.

At age 15, she got together with her first husband, with whom she had 5 children. She had to divorce her husband for a number of reasons, and to provide for her children she worked as a seamstress in a tailor shop. Later, the tailor went out of business and she decided to go to R.S.A. to work as a hairdresser, one of 3 jobs. Her sister fell ill and she had to spend her savings to cure her. Still at the R.S.A., she worked enough to buy a car and pay for the schooling costs of her son.

In 1999, she returned to Mozambique and bought land to construct a house. She traveled to the R.S.A where she bought clothes and meat to resell in Mozambique and sometime later, she began the business of raising boiler chickens. She also runs a business in secondhand clothing.

She discovered Hluvuku [Translator's note: the local microfinance institution] though a cousin and has applied for a loan to buy chicks for fattening. In the future, she hopes to build a large aviary on the land that she owns in Marracuene.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Amélia M. nascido em 25 de Julho de 1953 na catembe , província de maputo viveu a sua infância com a mãe uma vez que o pai se devorciou com a mãe quando ela ainda era muito nova , estudou apenas até 5ªclasse porque a mãe não tinha mais condições para custear estudos.

Aos 15 anos junta-se com seu primeiro marrido com qual tiveram cinco filhos , devido algumas situações teve que se devorciar do marrido, e para sustentar os filhos teve que procurar emprego onde foi trabalhar como custureira numa Alfaiataria algum tempo depois a Empresa fecha e ela decide ir á R.S.A onde trabalhou como cabelereira tendo criado três postos de trabalho e, sua irmã fica doente e ela teve que gastar as suas economias para curá-la , ainda na R.S.A conseguiu comprar um carro e custeiar despesas de estudo do filho.

Em 1999 volta á Moçambique compra um terreno e constroe uma casa e passou a viajar a R.S.A onde comprava roupa e carne para revender em Moçambique e , algum tempo depois iniciou a actividade de criação de frangos de corte e compra e venda de roupa da segunda mão desenvolvendo estas actividades até então.

Atravez dum primo residente na catembe soube da existéncia da Hluvuku , tendo sido financiado por 10.500,00 mt aplicando na compra de pintos para engorde. Futuramente pretende se tornar uma grande Avicultura onde pretende construir um grande Aviário no terreno que possui no distrito de Marracuene.

loans.use: Chicken production

payments.comment: Amelia has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Acira Ismael

texts.pt:
Ácira Ismael T. was born on 06/01/80 in Maputo. She lived for 5 years in Alto Mae, later she had to move with an aunt in Xai Xai. There she completed her primary schooling, and returned to Maputo. When she was 12 years old she continued studying and finished secondary school. Her life has not been easy. She became pregnant when she was 17, that was when she decided she had to work for herself and the child. Acira went to work for a beauty salon where she also apprenticed. She saved enough money to buy a small house with the help of her father.

She learned about LHUVUKU through one of her clients. With the loan of 15.000,00 she plans on paying off her house and expanding her small business. Her work has a positive impact in the community because it brings the service closer to men and women in her community. After paying off this loan, Gilda plans on requesting another one in order to open another location.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Ácira Ismael T. Tarmamade Actividade: comércio Valor do empréstimo:15.000.00 (600.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo-compra de produtos de beleza Início: 10/07/07 Fim : 31/08/08 Ácira Ismael T. Tarmamade nascida em 06/01/80 em Maputo.nasceu e viveu ate aos 5 anos no bairro do Alto Maé onde depois foi obrigada a ir morar com uma tia na cidade de Xai-Xai quando seus pais separaram. Fez o ensino Primário do 1ºgrau na cidade de Xai-xai , voltou a cidade de Maputo com apenas 12 anos onde continuo com os estudos fez o 2º grau. A sua vida foi muito deficil por essa razão acabou engravidando com apenas 17 anos e foi obrigada a trabalhar cedo porque apartir daquela altura gerava se uma nova vida dentro dela e que era necessário trabalhar para o seu sustento assim como da crianca que viria a nascer. E o seu 1º emprego foi no salão de beleza ideal onde aprendeu a trabalhar graças a bondade da patroa.

Assim sendo foi trabalhando neste salão onde foi fazendo pequenas economias ate que no principio deste ano conseguiu um pequeno imóvel com ajuda do pai. Conheceu a LHUVUKU atravéz duma cliente sua que é gestora de crédito tendo lhe explicado todos os procedimentos para acesso ao crédito. Com o crédito dos 15.000.00 pretendia concluir o pagamento do imóvel e ampliar o seu negócio. Com ampliação do negócio abriu mais dois postos de trabalho, a sua actividade tem um impacto bastante positivo na cumunidade porque é responsavel pelos bons cuidados da aparencia femenina assim como masculina. No entanto após a conclusão do empréstimo pretende solicitar mais um empréstimo para abrir mais um salão.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her salon

payments.comment: Acira has successfully repaid this loan in full ahead of time.

loans.name: Romao Casimiro

texts.pt:
Romão Casimiro T. is a fisherman and a cattle farmer. He was born on January 1st 1956, in the city of CaT. in Maputo. His father was a carpenter and his mother a mais who also worked with Liquor retail. He lost his father at an early age. Romao then went to live with his uncle who was a shoe repairer. There Romao learned the trade from his uncle and made a living reparing shoes until he became interested in the selling of sodas, which were scarce in CaT.. Later, he also worked as a street vendor. In 2002, by recommendation of his friends, he began to work with frozen chicken from the neighboring country of South Africa. Romao encountered financial difficulties, he then took out a loan of 6.000,00 through Hluvuku to expand his business.

Latter he requested 3 more loans of 8.000,00, 1.250,00 and 15.000,00 which enabled him to expand and strengthen his business, stat construction of his house and buy a fishing boat. With the 6th loans he bought fishing nets. Romao currently employs 6 people. He intends to buy a motor for the fishing boat and buy more cattle.

His activities have a positive impact in his community in that it brings sea food to his community, generates employment and increases the cattle number in his community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Romão Casimiro T. Actividade: Pesca Valor do emprestimo: 30.000,00MT (1,200.00US$) Aplicação do emprestimo: Redes de pesca Início: 10/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Romão Casimiro T., pescador e criador de gado bovino, nasceu aos 1 de Janeiro de 1956, em CaT. Cidade de Maputo, filho de pai Carpinteiro e mãe doméstica que se dedicava també ao fabrico e comercialização de bebidas alcoolicas em pequena escala. Perdeu o pai muito cedo, facto que lhe levou a viver com um padrasto que era sapateiro, aproveitando assim a aprender um ofício que lhe ajudou a auto sustentar-se até ao momento em que interessou-se pela comercialização de refrigerantes, produtos que escasseavam na CaT. e mais tarde vendia também o açucar, embora de forma ambulante. Por influência de amigos, em 2002 iniciou o negócio de frangos congelados que adquiria na vizinha República da Africa do Sul, tendo enfrentado algumas dificuldades financeiras e recorrendo assim a um empréstimo de 6.000,00mt na Hluvuku para reforçar o seu negócio. Recoreu a mais 3 emprestimos sucessivos de 8.000,00mt, 10.250,00mte 15.000,00mt, para fortificar o seu negócio que era segundo ele bem sucedido, o que lhe permitiu acomular alguns fundos para construção da sua casa e ainda para comprar um barco e redes, iniciando assim o investimento na pesca. Com o sexto e ultimo empréstimo de 30.000,00mt comprou redes para pesca. Tem actualmente 11 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e como perspectiva pretende comprar um motor para barco de modo a rentabilizar cada vez mais a sua actividade e ainda aumentar o numero de cabeças de gado bovino de modo a ter seu próprio cural ja que de momento deixou em no cural de um amigo. As actividades por ele abraçadas são de grande impacto pois para além de abastecer o mercado de mariscos, garantem postos de trabalho e por outro lado aumenta a população de bovinos que constituem a melhor forma de poupança para as comunidades rurais.

loans.use: To buy nets

payments.comment: Romao has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Domingos Pequenino

texts.pt:
Domingos Pequenino N. is a carpenter. He was born on October 28, 1952 in Inhambane, previously known as “ Terra de Boa Gente” – the land of good people. He studied until the 4th grade at he Escola Oficial de Catembe. When he was 15 years old, Domingos started working at the MI commercial enterprise until in 1967 it closed due to bankruptcy. Domingos then moved to Ribeiro Furnitures which also closed. Domingos then started working for himself, counting on his 30 years of experience.

Today Domingos employs 5 people. One of whom is his son. With the loan of 50,000.00 MT he strengthened his business and, since he was working from a home in the interior region of Guaxene, Domingos decided it was important to move the business to a shop close to the market.

With the loan of 10,000.00MT Domingos hopes to expand his business and be able to better cope with the demand of his clientele. Domingos work has a positive impact in his community because it generates employment and makes furniture available at a convenient location, thus saving his clients transportation costs.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Domingos Pequenino N. Actividade: Serviços Valor do emprestimo: 10.000,00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação do emprestimo: Compra de matéria prima para estofaria Início: 13/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Domingos Pequenino N. carpinteiro estufador de profissão, nasceu aos 28 de Outubro de 1952 em Inhambane antes conhecida como “Terra de Boa Gente”, filho de pai que era ajudante alfandegário e mãe doméstica.Estudou até 4ª classe na Escola Oficial da Catembe. Aos 15 anos começou a trabalhar como ajudante de estufador na antiga empresa M.I. Comercial em 1967 onde por motivos de falência desta veio a ingressar como estufador na empresa Moveis Ribeiro a qual veio também a fechar por tempo indeterminado, motivo que lhe levou a optar em desenvolver a mesma actividade a conta própria uma vez que ja contava com larga experiência acomulada durante 30 anos de trabalho. Conta ter ja trabalhado com 5 ajudantes tendo sido um deles seu filho, embora estes tem lhe abandonado logo que se sentem capazes de fazerem o trabalho sozinhos.

Com um emprestimo de 5.000,00mt reforçou a sua actividade, adquirindo materia prima para estofaria em quantidades sufucientes para responder à demanda na altura, e como trabalhava em casa localizada no interior do bairro Guaxene, sentiu a necessidade de se instalar num local aberto e próximo do mercado para melhor colocar e publicitar as suas obras. Recorrendo ao segundo empréstimo de 10.000,00 mt, peretende aumentar seu volume de produção e responder às necessidades dos seus clientes embora de forma não cabal. Como perspectiva, almeja ter um espaço próprio na zona comercial da Catembe, ja que o actual é arrendado, como forma de minimizar os custos de produção fazendo face à concorrência . Conta actualmente com 5 pessoas na sua responsabilidade e trabalha com 2 ajudantes, daí o impacto positivo da sua actividade em sustentar a sua família para além de garantir o emprego e fornecer mobiliário às pessoas residentes poupando-lhes o tempo e o custo de transporte.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Gilda Fernando

texts.pt:
Gilda Fernando Novele M. is 30 years old. She was born in Manjacaze on November 13, 1977. She is married with 2 children. Gilda lost her father at an early age, she lived with her aunt and studied until the 4th grade, when her aunt passed away and she returned to live with her mother in 1989. There she started selling bread. She also worked as a maid from1994. In 1999, Gilda married and stopped working as a maid. She saved whatever money she could to buy products which she sold from her backyard in Maxaquene neighborhood in Maputo.

In 2000, Gilda moved to Catembe because she was pregnant with her first child. She then started selling basic products such as tomatoes, sugar and onions in her backyard. Through her church, Gilda found out about Hluvuku. With the loan of 10,000.00MT Gilda plans on buying more products to sell. In the future, she hopes to remodel her small store to be able to sell more and become a successful entrepreneur.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Gilda Fernando Novele M. Localização: Bairro Chali- Catembe Actividade: Servicos Valor financiado: 10.000,00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação empréstimo: Venda de comida Início: 02/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Gilda Fernando Novele M., 30 anos de idade, nascida em Manjacaze aos 13 de Novembro de 1977, casada com 2 filhos, perdeu o pai muito cedo e foi viver com a tia até aos 11 anos onde frequentou a 4ª classe, só para infelecidade dela esta veio a perder a vida anos mais tarde e teve que retornar a casa da mãe em Maputo em 1989, lá para não ficar sem fazer nada vendia paezinhos. Começou a trabalhar como empregada doméstica em 1994 e recebia pouco valor. Em 1999 veio a casar-se e não deixou de trabalhar como empregada, ela relata que passou momentos difíceis e poupava algum dinheiro para compra de alguns produtos que os vendia no seu quintal onde vivia no bairro de Maxaquene na cidade do Maputo.

No ano de 2000 passou a viver em Catembe e porque estava grávida de seu 1° filho e não mais aguentando fazer trabalhos pesados teve que abdicar do mesmo e é nisto que relançou a ideia de montar uma banca no quintal para venda de tomate, açucar, cebola, etc. Foi através da irmã espiritual da Igreja que teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku. Com crédito de 10.000,00MTN pretende comprar produtos diversos para confecionar comida. O trabalho desenvolvido por esta cliente tem impacto positivo na comunidade, póis oferece uma alternativa para compra de comida e diminue as distãncias que as pessoas tinham que percorrrer ,por um lado emprega duas trabalhadoras contribuindo para redução dos índices já elevados de desemprego. A perspectiva futura é conseguir remodelar o seu pequeno estabelecimento e colocar mais produtos para alcançar mais clientes e ser uma empresária de sucesso.

loans.use: To increase stocks of food in her restaurant

payments.comment: Gilda has repaid this loan in advance.

loans.name: Rute Alberto

texts.pt:
Client: Rute Alberto L.
Location: Bairro Chamissava- Catembe- Maputo- Mozambique
Business Name: Retail
Loan Amount: 600.00US$
Loan Use: To increase stocks in her shop
Start: 07/10/2007
End: 07/31/2008
