Rute Alberto L., 29, is civilly married with 4 children. She lived in Catembe with her parents, and her father died when she was 12 years old and in the 4th grade.

She then lived with her aunt and went to school until 8th grade, and then left school due to financial difficulties.

She took a typewriting course (without much success) at Lewis Petrus [school] and later emigrated in 1996 to South Africa in search of better living conditions in order to help her mother and younger siblings. In Rand, she met her husband with whom she currently lives.

In 2005, she decided to return to Mozambique to live in her house, and built a small shop where she sells various kinds of basic necessity products. She heard of Hluvuku [MFI] from her brother-in-law and decided to ask for aid to order to develop her business.

With the US$600 loan, she intends to increase her business by buying bagged/packaged goods, chickens and chicken-related products, which will allow her to increase her monthly income.

The location of her business has been a significant help, as it reduces the distance she has to go to purchase various products, and she also has an employee.

Her goal is to increase the number of customers, to save some money, and to make improvements to her shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Dan Foster, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Rute Alberto L.
Localização: Bairro Chamissava- Catembe
Actividade: Comércio
Valor financiado: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$)
Aplicação empréstimo: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade
Início: 10/07/2007
Fim: 31/07/2008

Rute Alberto L., tem 29 anos de idade, casada maritalmente, tem 4 filhos, viveu com os pais na Catembe e que anos mais tarde este veio a falecer quando tinha 12 anos e nessa altura frequentava a 4ª classe.

Passou a viver com a tia onde estudou até 8ª classe e depóis deixou de estudar por dificuldades financeiras.

Frequentou sem sucessos o curso de dactilografia na Lewis Petrus e mais tarde emigrou para África de Sul a procura de melhores condições de vida isto em 1996 por forma ajudar a mãe e seus irmãos mais novos, na terra do Rand conheceu o marido com quem vive actualmente.

Em 2005 decide voltar a Moçambique para viver definitivamente em sua casa, constrói uma pequena mercearia onde vende diversa gama de produtos de 1ª necessidade.

Soube da existência da Hluvuku atravéis da cunhada e decide pedir auxílio para incrementar seu negócio.

Com o crédito de 15.000,00 MTn pretende aumentar o volume de negócio comprando produtos em sacos, frangos e derivados deste, o que lhe permitira aumentar sua renda mensal.

Pela localização deste empreendimento veio ajudar de forma significativa póis reduz a distânicas que percorriam para compra de diversos produtos e também emprega um trabalhador.

A perspectiva futura é ter cada vez mais clientes , poupar algum dinheiro, melhorar a mercearia.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

payments.comment: Rute has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Alice M. is 37 years old. She was born in the Ilha de Inhaca, in the city of Maputo on 01/01/1970. She lived with her mother and step father, and studied until the 4th grade. In her spare time, Alice always helped her family. Today she is married and has 5 children, 4 boys and 1 girl. In order to continue her studies she moved to Maputo, where she married and returned to her parents home in Inhaca. There she sold drinks and fresh fish.. Later, she joined her husband in Maputo and purchased a home. She learned about the possibility of acquiring credit through an organization from Ponte Catembe but because they did not honor their commitments, Gilda did not continue to work with them. Gilda then heard about micro credit and Hluvuku-Adsema in Catembe.

In 2007 she received her first loan of 5.000,00MT which she invested in buying fabrics. She repaid that loan. With the loan of 10.000,00MT, Gilda plans on increasing the volume of her business, and diversify her stock. With the income from her business Gilda contributes to maintaining her household, fixing the house and some furniture. In the future she hopes to build a small super market in Ilha de Inhaca.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Alice M. Localização: Bairro Chali- Catembe Actividade: Comércio Valor empréstimo: 10,000.00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação: Compra e revenda de tecidos Início: 18/04/2007 Fim: 10/08/2008 Alice M., nasceu a 37 anos na Ilha de Inhaca- Cidade de Maputo no dia 01/01/1970 e viveu com a mãe e padrasto onde estudou até 4ª classe e nos tempos livres ajudava nos trabalhos da machamba, é casada e tem cinco filhos dos quais 4 são do sexo masculino e 1 femenino. Para dar continuidade aos estudos foi estudar na cidade de Maputo e frequentara a 5ª classe, altura que foi casada tradicionalmente, vulgo “lobolo” e teve que voltar à casa dos pais na Inhaca onde vendia bebidas tradicionais e peixe fresco. Mais tarde veio a mudar-se para Cidade de Maputo onde passou a viver com o marido e nessa altura tiveram oportunidade de comprar uma residência na catembe e par não ficar de braços cruzados ela vendia no seu quintal diversos produtos. Teve contacto com crédito pela 1ª vez numa organização sediada na ponte-catembe onde se concedia crédito em grupo e teve problemas mais tarde póis alguns membros do grupo não honravam com compromisso o que lhe obrigou a abandonar esta maneira de trabalhar. Assim teve conhecimento da existência duma Microfinança( Hluvuku-Adsema) na catembe que financia várias actividades, atravéis de amigas.

Em 2007 teve o 1° crédito de 5.000,00MTn o qual aplicou na compra de tecidos e pagou sem sobressaltos. Com crédito de 10.000,00MTn pretende aumentar o volume do negócio, ter mais capital por forma a diversificar os produtos que oferece aos clientes e ter mais rendimentos. Com os rendimentos(lucros) do negócio ajuda nas despesas domésticas, apetrechar a casa com alguns bens móveis. No futuro perspectiva construir uma mercearia na Ilha de Inhaca.

loans.use: To increase stocks

payments.comment: Alice has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Business Description

Manuel has worked in agriculture for 12 years growing rice, corn and other crops. In addition, he tends a small mango farm. He rises at 5:00AM seven days a week and returns home only when the work is done. Through his hard work, and that of his children, he has seen his crops thrive.

Use of Loan

Manuel will use this loan to care for his land and mango orchard, which have been neglected of late for lack of funds. He needs to buy fungicide, herbicide and fertilizer to keep his mango trees thriving and competitive.

Personal Information on Borrower

Manuel is 38 years old. His wife and their two children help with work on the farm. A close family, they have overcome many difficulties together and are particularly proud to have given the children a good education. Manuel hopes to boost his production of mangoes and earn a better livelihood for his family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Manuel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 anos, teniendo muchas otras actividades, como a la siembra de arroz, maíz y mango. Además es administrador de una pequeña finca de mango. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde la 5 de la mañana, pero no tiene hora fija de retorno al hogar, ya que por trabajar en el campo se necesita de mucho tiempo. Gracias al esfuerzo que realiza junto con sus bellos hijos a llegado a mantener el negocio a flote, tanto en los cultivos como en la administración de la finca.

Uso del Préstamo

Manuel necesita el préstamo para reactivar sus tierras y adecuar sus sembríos de mango, ya que por falta de recursos no lo ha nutrido de la manera correcta. Comprando insumos agrícolas como, fungicidas, herbicidas y abonos, para mantenerlos a nivel de competencia, ya que por este sector se dedican mucho a la siembra de este cultivo.

Información Personal

Nuestro amigo Manuel tiene 38 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a sus 2 hermosos hijos, quienes junto a su esposa le ayudan en las actividades de la finca, son una familia unida y gracias a ello han llegado a salir de dificultades económicas y demás índoles. Gracias al esfuerzo de Manuel a llegado mantener a sus hijos estudiando, inclusive a su esposa ya que es un ejemplo de superación. Los sueños de Manuel es comercializar aun más su producto como son los mangos, de tal manera que llegue a mejorar su estilo de vida.

loans.use: To care for mango trees.

loans.name: Gilda Sebastiao

texts.pt:
Client: Gilda Sebastiao C. Area of business: Retail Loan Amount: 12.000.00 mt ( US$480.00) Purpose of the Loan: Purchase and sale of merchandise Loan Payment Beginning Date: 07/10/07 Loan Last Payment Date: 07/31/08

Gilda Sebastiao C. was born on December 10th, 1965, in the city of Chibuto in the Gaza province. She lost her father before she was born, so her mother and her older siblings were responsible for her upbringing. She went to school until the seventh grade and got pregnant when she was seventeen years old - that lead her to move in with the baby's father, with whom she later had three more children. Twenty years later, her husband, after retiring from the company he worked for, left Gilda and took on a relationship with his fex-wife in the city of Inhambane. In order to provide for her children she tried to find a job but had no success.She, then, came up with the idea to start up a business to sell clothes and assorted products. With the help of a friend she began traveling to South Africa - it still is the place where she buys her merchandise from. She has been able to support five people with the income generated from her business. She became aware of Hluvuku through her son-in-law, who works at Catembe. She was approved for a 12.000,00 mt loan which she spent buying additional merchandise to strenghten her business that was dwindling financially at that point. In the future, she intends to settle in a shop where she can accommodate and sell all of her products. Currently, she has no fixed location to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer Cliente: Gilda Sebastião C. Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo: 12.000,00mt (480.00US$) Aplicação do Empréstimo: Compra e venda de produtos Início: 10/07/07 Fim: 31/07/2008 Gilda Sebastião C. nascido em 10 de Dezembro de 1965 em Chibuto na província de Gaza. Perdeu o pai antes de nascer .tendo sido criado por sua Mãe e irmãos mais velhos , estudou até 7ª classe e aos 17 anos fica grávida e teve que viver com o seu marrido com qual tiveram quatro filhos. Vinte anos depois o marrido teve reforma na Empresa em que trabalhava abandonou-lhe e foi viver com a primeira Mulher em Inhambane . Para garantir o sustento dos seus filhos tentou procurar emprego não tendo conseguido, pensou em iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos e roupa e com ajuda de amigas passou a viajar á África do sul onde até agora tem feito compras.na base deste negócio,consegue sustentar um agregado de cinco pessoas. Atravês do seu genro que trabalha na Catembe , ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo ido solicitar um financiamento. Com o valor de 12.000,00mt financiado aplicou na compra de produtos reforçando o seu negócio uma vêz que já tinha insuficiência financeira. Futuramente pretende obter uma mercearia onde poderá colocar os seus produtos uma vêz que agora trabalha em regime ambulatório.

loans.use: To increase stocks of clothes

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Business Description

Ricardo has a small store where he sells sandwiches, colas, empanadas, lunches, etc. His store is located in a school where he sells his products from the very early morning hours, from 7am and during recess, to the students and teachers who work there. Because he has not mechanized his land, he has dedicated himself totally to his store, as it is another source of income for his family. [Translator's note: the wording suggests that Ricardo owns a plot of land, which he chooses not to cultivate, or which simply may not be an important source of income.]

Use of the Loan

Ricardo will use this loan to further improve his small store with the purchase of more products and a greater variety of offerings, so that his clients with have more options when they buy from him. Thanks to his humble and responsible nature he has been able to maintain his store inside the school.

Personal Information

Ricardo is 40 years old. With his wife's support, he has been able to keep his 5 children healthy and in school. His house is made of cement and it is very cozy and organized. Ricardo dreams of having his own store in a much more commercial area. Thanks to the work and unconditional support of his family, he has been able to provide for them.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ricardo tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de sanduiches, colas, empanadas, almuerzos, etc... Que se encuentra ubicada dentro de una escuela, donde provee sus productos muy temprano en la mañana, desde las 7 am y durante la hora del recreo, a los estudiantes y maestros que laboran ahí. Por no tener mecanizadas sus tierras se a dedicado netamente a esta actividad ya que es otra fuente de ingresos para el y su familia.

Uso del Préstamo

En lo que tiene fijado el préstamo solicitado, Ricardo lo utilizará para adecuar aun mas su pequeña tienda, como en la compra de mayores productos y variados, para que así su clientela tenga otras opciones de escoger a la hora de comprar. Ya que gracias a su humildad y responsabilidad a podido mantener el local dentro de la escuela.

Información Personal

Ricardo tiene 40 anos de edad, que gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado su esposa en el negocio, ha llegado a mantener sus ingresos de tal manera que tienen a sus 5 saludables hijos estudiando. La estructura de su vivienda es de cemento muy acogedora y ordenada. Los sueños de Ricardo es tener su propia tienda fuera de la escuela en un lugar mucho mas comercial, que gracias al esfuerzo y al apoyo incondicional de su familia se a mantenido económicamente

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Isabel Jose

texts.pt:
Client: Isabel Jose M. Area of business: Retail Loan Amount: 15.000,00 MT (US$600.00) Purpose of the Loan: Purchase and sale of clothes Loan Beginning date: 07/11/07 Last Payment due date: 07/31/08

Isabel Jose M. was born on June 23rd, 1957 in the city of Matola, province of Maputo. She was raised by her parents and went to school until the seventh grade. She was forced to stop going o school to look after her mother, who had fallen ill. She got married when she was 18 years old and had four children. Her husband subsequently passed away. In 1981, when she turned 26, she got married to her second husband and had three more children. She tried to work as a house-keeper but it did not work out - that is when she decided to start a business selling clothes that were purchased during trips to South Africa. Her business' income has helped her husband cover their children's expenses- his income comes from a pension plan. In 2006, she was tipped off by a friend about Hluvuku. She was granted a loan in the amount of 8.500,00mt. A year after that she applied for another loan in the amount of 15.000,00mt. Both amounts were used to buy additional clothes that gave the business a more solid structure. In the future, she wishes to build a bigger house where she can live with her family with dignity, for their current home is too small and it is not in good condition. She also wants to settle in a small store where she could sell clothes and a vehicle to transport merchandise, which is now needed thanks to high demands.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Isabel José M. Actividade:Comércio Valor do Empréstimo:15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação do Empréstimo:compra e venda de Roupa Início:11/07/2007 Fim:31/07/2008 Isabel José M. nascido em 23de Junho de 1957 em Matola na província de Maputo ,cresceu junto dos seus pais tendo estudado até 7ªclasse . A sua mãe fica doente facto que lhe fez deixar de estudar para cuidar dela. Aos 18 anos junta-se com o seu primeiro marrido tendo tido quatro filhos tempo depois , veio este a falecer. Aos 26 anos já em 1981 junta-se com outro homem com qual tem 3 filhos.Tentou trabalhar como empregada doméstica e não deu certo é quando decide iniciar o negócio de venda de roupa tendo passado a viajar á Africa do sul para adquirir a mercadoria. Atravêz deste negócio ,consegue ajudar o marrido no sustento dos filhos sendo este pensionista. Em 2006 atravês de amigas ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku , tendo solicitado um financiamento no valor de 8.500,00mt . No corrente ano voltou a solicitar outro financiamento de 15.000,00mt ,ambos valores foram aplicados na compra de roupas o que veio a reforçar o seu negócio. Futuramente almeja construir uma casa grande onde possa viver condignamente com sua família porque a casa na qual reside actualmente é pequena e não está em boas condições. Tambem pretende adiquirir uma pequena loja onde possa colocar o seu negócio e viatura para lhe facilitar no transporte de mercadoria vista o aumento do volume do seu negócio.

loans.use: To increase stocks of clothes in her business

loans.name: Fd

texts.en: test here

loans.use: sdfsd

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Business Description

Juan works in agriculture. He has dedicated himself completely to agriculture for the past 30 years, gaining much knowledge in the cultivation of rice, corn, etc. Because he is a totally dedicated to his work, he spends most of his time there, since this line of work demands total commitment.

Use of the Loan

Juan needs this loan to buy more supplies. This way, he can mechanize his crops, using pumps and other instruments in such a way that he won't have to spend the sowing period waiting to cultivate and produce, in this case, the corn crops.

Personal Information

Juan is married and has 7 children, 3 of whom are in school. Juan keeps his family together through much dedication and work. His small and cozy house is made of cement. Our friend Juan hopes to obtain more land to cultivate and in this way keep his family comfortable and stable.

Translated by Bianca V., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Juan es agricultor trabajador, se a dedicado de lleno a la agricultura desde hace 30 anos ganando mucho conocimiento en el manejo de los cultivos como arroz, maíz, etc. Por ser netamente de este sector, la mayoría del tiempo la dedica a esta actividad, que por ser netamente del campo siempre la disponibilidad de tiempo es total.

Uso del Préstamo

Juan necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos, de esa manera tiene sus tierras mecanizadas, con la utilización de bombas y otros instrumentos, de tal modo que no tiene que esperar la temporada de siembra para poder cultivar y producir, en este caso es el cultivo de maíz.

.

Información Personal

Actualmente Juan esta casado, donde tiene 7 hijos, que en la actualidad estudian 3 de ellos. Juan con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo mantiene su familia unida, en su pequeña y acogedora casa de estructura de cemento. Nuestro amigo Juan tiene por objetivos tener mayor número de terrenos para cultivarlas y así tener a su familia cómoda y estable

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Business Description:

Mr. Hipolito has been dedicated to farming since an early age. He learned this activity from his parents. He sows rice, corn, etc. He works all day without a fixed schedule. Although the sowing season for rice is past, he has his own irrigation system and he can continue sowing.

Use of the Loan:

Mr. Hipolito wants to acquire supplies with this credit such as fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc. Since for lack of funds he has not been able to maintain an optimal level of production for development.

Personal Information:

Mr. Hipolito is 60 years old and is happily married. He actually has three children but all are already of majority. His house is built of wood, very orderly and welcoming. The aspirations of Hipolito are to buy more land in order to thus get them to yeild crops, generating income that will allow a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Hipolito se dedica a la agricultura desde temprana edad, el aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, el siembra arroz, maíz...etc. Su trabajo lo realiza todo el día sin un horario fijo, aunque la temporada de la siembra de arroz ya paso, el tiene sus propia maquina de riego y el puede continuar sembrando.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Hipolito desea adquirir c0n el crédito insumos como; fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos etc. Ya que por falta de capital no podía mantener un nivel de producción optimo para su desarrollo

Información Personal

Don Hipolito tiene 60 anos de edad esta felizmente casado. En la actualidad tienen 3 hijos pero todos ya de mayoría de edad. Su casa es de estructura de madera, muy ordenada y acogedora. Las aspiraciones de Hipolito es comprar más tierras para así llegar a producirlas, generando ingresos que le permitan darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm -  Comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy L. is a 30 year old lady who has worked very hard to overcome many difficulties to reach where she is now. She lost her father when she was only 17 and it was extremely difficult for her to continue with studies. However, with her mother’s courage and hard work, she finally completed a diploma course in accountancy. She now works as an accounts assistant at a university .

Lucy has seen the suffering that her mother is still going through with the younger children, because she had seven other children after Lucy, who is the first-born. Lucy has thought of earning an additional income to help her mother with some school fees and other school requirements for her siblings.

There is a big compound near Lucy's house which she says she can utilize for rearing chicken. This would be very useful for the community since people in her neighbourhood currently have to travel at least 2km to buy chicken. Lucy has already started working on saving for the chicken coop and already has $180 which will be enough for the coop.

She is now requesting a loan of $150 which will help her buy chickens and their feed. She is going to repay the loan in 4 months. With this loan she is going to buy:

(The individual items are listed in Ugandan shillings and total has been converted to US$)

1- 100 Chicks @ 150/= ------------ 150,000/=

2- 4 bags of feed@ 20,000/= ------- 80,000/=

3- transport costs----------20,000/=

TOTAL ------------250,000/= ($150)

loans.use: Buying chicks and feed

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica A. hails from the new Amuru district in northern Uganda and has been living in Kampala for the past 10 years. She has been her family's primary income earner for the past few years with her husband suffering ill health due to attacks by rebels while still in the war zone of northern Uganda.

Through her hard work, she managed to set up a small retail shop with her first Kiva loan, which she obtained through LiA. To date, she has only made one late loan payment. Her shop has been doing well and through it she has managed to pay fees for her children and buy some household items.

She however feels that she can do better by adding more stock to the shop. In this way she can even supply her clients who always pay at the end of month, so she will not run out of stock even if she is still waiting for them to pay. In order to do this she needs more money to restock the shop especially with sugar and maize flour, which are her most popular items.

She therefore seeks a loan of $150 in to buy more items for her shop. She will be able to repay this loan in 4 months

Below is her budget in full: (The individual items are listed in Ugandan shillings and the total has been converted to US$)

1-sugar 2 bags @ 80,000/= ---------- 160,000/=

2- maize flour 50kgs 2bags @ 35,000/= ---- 70,000/=

3- transport ----------- 20,000/=

Total ----------- 250,000/= ($150)

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Vicente is totally dedicated to agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice and other crops like papaya and mango. He has 25 years of experience in this career. Thanks to his effort and performance, he has been able to seek other opportunities, not just the cultivation of one crop. He works from the early morning hours because in this field of work one needs to dedicate a great deal of time every day of the week.

Use of the Loan

Vicente needs this loan for his work in agriculture, to buy supplies for the growth and development of the crops, in this case, the cultivation of corn. His sons help him with the crops, contributing to the family income so that the daily needs of the household are met.

Personal Information

Our friend Vicente is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 sons. Through dedication and restraint, he and his wife have been able to keep the two boys in school. They live in a wood house, which thanks to the collaboration of his wife and sons, is in a comfortable condition. Vicente hopes that his sons achieve an academic level that he was not able to reach himself due to life circumstances.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Vicente esta netamente dedicado a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz y otros cultivos como la papaya y mango, en esta actividad tiene ya 25 anos de experiencia. Gracias a su esfuerzo y desempeño ha podido buscar otras alternativas, y no solamente cultivar un solo producto. Trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ya que para esta labor se necesita mayor tiempo y dedicación durante todos los días de la semana.

Uso del Préstamo

Vicente necesita el préstamo para dedicarlos a la agricultura, como la compra de insumos para el crecimiento y desarrollo del cultivo, en este caso el cultivo de maíz, ya que también sus hijos le ayudan en el trabajo de cultivar las tierras, ayudando en el ingreso económico del hogar y así no falte el pan de cada día en su mesa.

Información Personal

Nuestro amigo Vicente tiene 47 anos de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, donde con dedicación y mesura ha podido junto a su esposa mantenerlos estudiando. La vivienda en que habitan es de estructura de madera, que gracias a la colaboración de su esposa e hijos mantiene el domicilio en condiciones confortables. Los anhelos de Vicente es que sus hijos alcancen el nivel académico que el por cosas del destino no pudo alcanzar.

loans.use: to buy supplies for corn crops

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Zebo is a 29 years old teacher, married with two children. Her husband went to the Russia for employment. He sends money for his family, but Zebo wanted to help her husband support the family so she decided to rent small food-shop.   Today Zebo lives with her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law looks after the children, when Zebo works at the food-shop. The shop located in Isfara, Tajikistan.
Zebo teaches in the school every morning while her sister-in-law runs the business. Zebo is a very cheerful person and is very creative. Her beautiful smile attracts many clients to her food shop. Her small shop is one of the famous shops in the area. Zebo wants to expand her assortment of goods and that’s why she is requesting 1200USD.

loans.use: Business developing.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is married and has 3 children.  She has been selling modern women dresses for 5 years. Her husband is her business partner and he is responsible for trips to the wholesale market. Her daughter and her son help her to arrange goods in her trade place. Salomat’s business place is located in open-air market, in the 32nd district in Khujand. Salomat became a client of Micro Invest in 2001.  Her first loan was 50USD.  She spent her loan buying goods such as socks, men's underwear, and women’s headscarves.  Gradually she increased the turnover of her working capital and noticed the high demand for women's dresses. Today she sells women garments and is happy with her choice.  
The government is planning to build a big supermarket where the open-air market now stands.  Salomat wishes to rent one shop from there for her business. She is requesting 700USD for it.

loans.use: Renting  premises for shop.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu A. is thirty-three years of age and married with four children.  She started her business three years ago on a very small scale in Kabala town in Sierra Leone.  Fatu changes her business activity according to the season.  She sells clothes at certain seasons and engages in the buying and selling of agricultural products during harvest periods.  Fatu also purchases food crops such as rice, dried beans, palm oil and honey, and stores them until they are scarce in the market, then she sells them at a higher price.  She plans to build a shelter for her business at the market and is therefore requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: Construct a shelter for her market business

loans.name: Haja Furan

texts.en:
Haja Furan K. is forty years old, married with five children. She is a subsistence farmer in Kurumaslaiya village outside of Kabala in Northern Sierra Leone. Haja has been farming for nearly twenty years. She grows cabbage, hot peppers, peanuts and some rice but is not able to grow enough to earn sufficient income for the family because the work is very labour-intensive.

Haja and other village women have organized themselves into farmers' groups and have started a savings club. Their aim is to increase their farming products to improve their income. Haja is therefore personally requesting a loan of $175 so that she can hire seasonal labourers and purchase seeds.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and hire seasonal labor

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan C. is married with only one child, but he also takes care of his sisters and brothers and pays for their school expenses. At thirty-five years of age, he runs a small store selling bicycle and motorbike spare parts and lubricant in Kabala town in Sierra Leone. His aim is to increase his stock by purchasing parts wholesale from the Republic of Guinea.

C. used a previous loan from SMT to diversify his business by including the sale of lubricant. He is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more lubricant so that he can earn more income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase lubricant wholesale for resale in his bicycle shop

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed M. is thirty-five years old and married with two children.  He runs his business in a small village trading center of Fadugu in Sierra Leone, just outside Kabala.  Mohamed was not able to go further with his education and therefore decided to establish a small grocery shop.  He says his goal is  to provide his children with a good education, food and other basic needs.  He is requesting a third loan of $350 from SMT to allow him to diversify his business.  He would like to purchase100 gallons of palm oil and sell them wholesale in other close-by districts.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil to sell wholesale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed J. is forty-nine years of age and married with five children. J. runs a small store selling onions, tomato paste and cooking oil in Kabala in Sierra Leone. J. is requesting a second loan of $200 from SMT to increase his inventory so he will be able to earn more income from his little store. He wants to be able to provide more towards the education of his children and the up-keep on his house.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of food items sold in the market

loans.name: Obid

texts.en: Obid R. is married and has 3 children.  He used to work in a factory as a welder but after the economic collapse, the salary was not enough to support his family. He decided to sell children clothes in the market, because he loves children very much. His wife is an accountant, but she could not find a good job too so she decided to help her husband in his business. Obid brings goods from the wholesale market and his wife and his eldest daughter sell them in the market.  Obid is an active client of Micro Invest. His first loan was for 100USD and he used it to develop his business. Gradually he increased his working capital and now his business is one of the better known trade places in the market.  Obid would to a loan of 800USD to rent another store space for his daughter, P.S.In the photo is of his daughter Farzonahon.

loans.use: Open a new trade store.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman S. is thirty-five years old and married with five children.  He started carpentry work twenty years ago but his business was interrupted by the eleven-year civil war in his country that ended eight years ago.  Osman runs a small carpentry workshop with about four apprentices who help him with the work.  He makes chairs, beds, tables and school furniture.  Osman sometimes receives offers of contracts but can not take them on due to lack of capital to purchase enough lumber.  He is therefore requesting his second loan, this time of $350, to purchase lumber and to employ more two apprentices after their training.

loans.use: Purchase lumber for furniture making

loans.name: Sajoh

texts.en: Sajoh J. is thirty-three years old and married with one child. He opened a small store in the open-air market in Kabala town of Sierra Leone soon after the end of the civil war.  In spite of the small scale of his business, J. managed to save some of his profit to increase his inventory.  He used a previous loan from SMT to construct a wooden shelter in a residential area in Kabala where he sells his goods.  J. completed his first loan repayment successfully and is requesting a second loan of $200 to further expand his inventory.

loans.use: Expand the inventory in his small grocery store

loans.name: Sankoh

texts.en:
Sankoh K. is forty years old, married with five children. He owns a small shop in the village of Fadugu in Sierra Leone, located near Kabala. He sells engine oil, spare parts, kerosene and bicycles. Sankoh provides a basic but much needed service to the community. He travels very often to Freetown or Makeni to purchase his goods.

Sankoh says that he spends a lot of money on transport because of having to buy in small quantites and travel so often. He is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase a barrel of engine oil and twenty-five gallons of kerosene to expand his business. The loan will enable him to purchase these goods in bulk, thus reducing the frequency of his procurement trips and cutting down his costs so that he can improve his profit margin.

loans.use: Purchase oil and kerosene in bulk to reduce travel costs

loans.name: Julpa

texts.fr: Madame Julpa L. est âgée de 44 ans est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de la sucrerie. Elle cherche à augmenter le niveau de son commerce par l'achat des caisses de sucrerie supplémentaires et de 2 glacières et chaque de la glace. Les glacières permettront de conserver les boissons fraiches et attireront les clients.  Pour réaliser son projet, elle sollicite un prêt de 650 dollars. C'est une femme dynamique et pleine de volonté qui mérite d'être encouragée dans sa volonté d'améliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat des caisses de sucrerie, de 2 glacières et de la, glace

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr: Monsieur Edouard B. est âgé de 56 ans, il est marié et père de 6 enfants. Il a travaillé plusieurs années comme menuisier à la mairie. Il vient d'être retraité et a ouvert un atelier de menuiserie dans sa propre concession. Il travaille avec 2 de ses fils. Ils ont l'habitude de fabriquer des chaises, des tables et des lits qu'ils revendent facilement. Il sollicite un prêt de 525 dollars pour acheter un rabot neuf, une scie et un lot de bois pour augmenter leur production. Ils ont une clientèle assurée. ce prêt  lui permettra de continuer à assurer la nourriture pour ses enfants, payer leurs écoles, mais surtout de former ses fils et les autres jeunes du quartier dans la menuiserie

loans.use: Achat des outils et d'un lot de bois pour fabrication des meubles

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Antonio Aguero S. is 28 years old, married and has a son. He has been working in this field for 10 years. He attended school and finished high school but couldn't continue his education due to the limited resources and funds that his parents had. Since an early age, he had to look for work to help with his family needs.

He started to work at the mechanic shop that his uncle owns. He quickly learned the skills to repair cars and after years of savings, he became independent. 4 years ago he started his own shop. Today, he works happily at his shop where he provides employment to other young men that help him and like he are looking to prosper and become independent.

Antonio's shop has a very good reputation and is well recognized in the zone that he lives. He has a good clientele and they are very satisfied with his work. Antonio specializes on auto body repairs and painting. He had asked for a loan before and had paid it on time. He invested that money in buying a car painting machine. Today, he is asking for a new loan which he will invest in buying car paints and other supplies for his body shop. Thanks to his great work, the demand has increased

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, KIva Volunteer.

El Sr. Antonio A. S., tiene 28 años, está casado y tiene un hijo, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 10 años. Curso sus estudios hasta terminar la secundaria (High School) pero no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres, por lo que desde temprana edad tuvo que salir a trabajar para poder de esta forma ayudar con el sustento de su familia.

Empezó a trabajar en el taller mecánico de su tío donde adquirió rápidamente habilidades en la mecánica automotriz; tras años de ahorro pudo independizarse y desde hace 4 años posee un taller propio. Hoy día el trabaja alegre en su taller donde provee de fuentes de trabajo a otros jóvenes que lo ayudan en el taller y que al igual que El están en busca de prosperar e independizarse algún día.

El taller de Don Antonio es muy reconocido en la zona, tiene muchos clientes y estos están bastante satisfechos con su trabajo. Antonio se ha especializado en el ramo de la chapería y pintura. Anteriormente ya había solicitado un crédito, con buena puntualidad en el pago, y lo invirtió en la compra de una máquina para pintar autos. Hoy está solicitando un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de pinturas para autos y otros insumos, pues gracias a su buen trabajo la demanda ha aumentado.

loans.use: Buying paints and supplies for his auto body shop.

loans.name: Dingamyom

texts.fr: Monsieur Dingamyom D. est âgé de 34 ans. Il est célibataire et a bénéficié d'une formation dans le domaine de la coordonnerie. Il a ouvert un atelier de réparation des chaussures au coin d'une rue dans le quartier qu'il habite. Les gens sont satisfaits de son travail, parce qu'il repare rapidement les chaussures usées qu'on lui confie. Il veut se lancer dans la fabrication des chaussures locales, mais il manque de ressources financières pour acheter le cuir, la colle et les ficelles. Pour son projet, il sollicite un prêt de 225 dollars. Cet prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son revenu

loans.use: Achat de cuire, de la colle et des ficelles pour fabriquer des chaussures

loans.name: Eleucadio

texts.es:
Business Description

Valentin started his business 7 years ago. He makes custom doors, gates, and roof structures. He works every day from 7am to 6 pm.

Use of the Loan

Valentin needs this loan to invest in the purchase of a machine to cut the metal sheets and materials that are used in the creation of his products.

Personal Information

Valentin is 43 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He has been interested in metalworking since he was very young. Unfortunately, his house was affected by the rainy season. He had to use a large part of his working capital to fix it somewhat. With the little money that remains, he still struggles but employs one person who works with him. Valentin hopes to improve his business and income and provide a better home for his family.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Valentín inicio su negocio hace 7 años. El producto que elabora y vende son puertas, rejas, estructuras para techos atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 7am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Valentín necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de una maquina cortadora de planchas metálicas y materiales que son utilizados para la elaboración de los productos que ofrece en su negocio.

Información Personal

Valentín tiene 43 años es casado tiene 3 hijos. Desde muy joven se intereso por aprender y trabajar en la cerrajería. Lamentablemente por motivo de las lluvias de invierno su casa se vio afectada. Tuvo que utilizar gran parte de capital trabajo para medio arreglarla. Con el poco capital que le quedo, sigue luchando y ofreciendo empleo a una persona que trabaja con el. Valentín aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos y brindar un mejor hogar para su familia.

loans.use: invest in machinery.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. José sells groceries from his store, which is located in his home. He learned how to be successful in this trade from his parents, working hard from early in the morning. In addition, he also works on his land cultivating rice, corn, fruits, etc…. He works all day long, without fixed hours. Since the seeding time for rice already passed, at this moment he focuses on his store.

Loan Use

Mr. José wants to use the loan to buy much more merchandise. This way, he will make sure that his assortment is larger than that of other stores to reduce competition, as at this moment all that sets his store apart is his service level. José feels and thinks that with the loan, the future of his store is bright. He builds on his experience to improve his business.

Personal Information

Mr. José is 45 years old and married to Mrs. Juana. They have 3 children, and they pay for the studies of the youngest one thanks to the efforts of himself and his wife. The other children are older. His house is very ordered and cozy, even though it is made of wood. José’s aspirations are to buy more land to make it produce, and this way generate another income that will allow him to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Descripción del Negocio

Don José se dedica a la venta de víveres en su local que se encuentra en su domicilio, ya que es una actividad que por enseñanza de sus progenitores la a sabido aprender y a ejecutar correctamente, trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana. Además llevado de la mano también trabaja en sus tierras cultivando y produciendo cultivos como arroz, maíz, frutales, etc…. Su trabajo lo realiza todo el día sin un horario fijo, aunque la temporada de la siembra de arroz ya paso, solo se dedica de lleno al comercio en su tienda.

Uso del Préstamo

Don José desea adquirir c0n el crédito mucha mas mercadería, de tal manera que tenga su tienda mas surtida que las demás y así no sentir mucho la competencia, ya que la diferencia de su tienda con las demás es la atención que el les brinda. José siente y piensa que con el crédito que solicita el futuro de su tienda mejorara, llevado de la mano con la experiencia que el posee llevara adelante su negocio.

Información Personal

Don José tiene 45 anos de edad esta casado con la Sra. Juana. En la actualidad tienen 3 hijos que gracias al esfuerzo que el realiza junto a su esposa mantiene al menor estudiando. Porque los otros son mayores de edad. Su casa a pesar de ser de estructura de madera es muy ordenada y acogedora. Las aspiraciones de José es comprar tierras para así llegar a producirlas, generando otros ingresos que le permitan darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy more  merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her inventory of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Boost her green grocery business

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is 48 years old and has 5 children. Her husband works on the land cultivating corn. She wants to invest her loan to buy clothing from people who bring this from Puebla, which she subsequently sells to people in her neighborhood. She belongs to the group “Flor de Tila 1”, together with Higinia Gordillo L. (who sells footwear), Mrs. Mercedes Abadia Gutierrez (who sells shoes and handmade sandals). These two plan to invest their part of the loan to buy a large amount of shoes that they sell in the city, close to the marketplace.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

ROSAURA TIENE 48 AÑOS , 5 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN EL CULTIVO DEL MAIZ, ELLA VA A INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO EN COMPRAR ROPA A PERSONAS QUE LA TRAEN DE PUEBLA Y POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLA CON GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE TILA 1 JUNTO CON HIGINIA GORDILLO L. ( VENDE CALZADO ) Y DOÑA MERCEDES ABADIA GUTIERREZ (VENTA DE CALZADO Y SANDALIAS ARTESANALES ).ELLAS DOS ESPERAN CON LA PARTE DE SU PRESTAMO INVERTIR COMPRANDO MAYOR CANTIDAD DE CALZADOS PARA TAMBIEN SALIR A VENDER A LA CIUDAD EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO .

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the group “Flor de Tila 1”, together with Mrs. Maria del Carmen Gordillo Aguilar (who makes bread and sells it door-to-door) and Mrs. Amelia L. Guillen (who sells perfumes and cosmetics). They plan to invest the loan in their businesses: Mrs. Rosa plans to buy non-perishable food, Amelia will invest it in the purchase of more perfumes, and Mrs. Maria del Carmen will buy 100 kg (220 lbs) bags of flour to increase the production of bread.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

ROSA TIENE 37 AÑOS , CASADA ,3 HIJOS ,.SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN LA CONSTRUCCION COMO ALBAÑIL. ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE TILA 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN GORDILLO AGUILAR ( HACE Y VENDE PAN Y LOS VENDE DE CASA EN CASA ) Y DOÑA AMELIA L. GUILLEN ( VENDE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS ). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS ; DOÑA ROSA COMPRANDO MERCADERIA DE ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES Y AMELIA INVERTIRA EN COMPRAR MAS PERFUMES , DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN COMPRARA QUINTALES DE HARINA PARA PRODUCIR MAYOR CANTIDAD DE PAN .

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadelupe is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. She prepares food in her house which she delivers to people’s home as ordered, or as a street vendor to the people of her community. She belongs to the group “Flor de Tila 2”. The other group members are Mrs. Maria del Carmen Lopez Velasco (who sells clothing and shoes), Mrs. Cruz Mireya Daniel Arguello (who sells tamales door-to-door), and Mrs. Matilde Velasco Arguello (grocery store). They want to invest the loan in their businesses in order to increase their profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

GUADALUPE TIENE 42 AÑOS , CASADA 2 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AGRICULTOR.ELLA PREPARA COMIDA EN SU CASA Y LA SALE A VENDER A DOMICILIO A PEDIDOS Y COMO VENDEDOR AMBULANTE .ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD.PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE TILA 2. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON DOÑA MARIA DEL CARMEN LOPEZ VELASCO ( VENDE ROPA Y CALZADO ) DOÑA CRUZ MIREYA DANIEL ARGUELLO ( VENDE TAMALES DE CASA EN CASA ) Y DOÑA MATILDE VELASCO ARGUELLO ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS PARA OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS .

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is 71 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer seeding sugarcane. She will invest the loan to set up a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the group “Flor de Caña 1”. The other group members are: Mrs. Graciela Candelaria Alvarez (who sells clothing that she buys in Comitan), and Mrs. Luz Angelina Arguello (grocery store). With the loan the want to buy merchandise in sufficient quantities to stock their businesses for a long time, and this way increase their profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

MARIA DEL CARMEN TIENE 71 AÑOS , CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA SIEMBRA DE LA CAÑA , ELLA INVERTIRA SU PRESTAMO COLOCANDO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 1 LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : DOÑA GRACIELA CANDELARIA ALVAREZ ( VENDE ROPA QUE COMPRA EN COMITAN ) Y DOÑA LUZ ANGELINA ARGUELLO (TIENDA DE ABARROTES )CON SU PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR MERCADERIA EN CANTIDADES SUFICIENTE COMO PARA ABASTECER SUS NEGOCIOS POR UN LARGO TIEMPO Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS .

loans.use: to increase their stock

loans.name: Maria De La  Cruz

texts.es:
Maria de al Cruz is 22 years old and married. Her husband works in the fields. She buys clothing at the border at an establishment where they sell it at wholesale prices. Later she sells the clothing to the people of her community. She belongs to the loan group Flor de Caña 1, along with Mrs. Elena N. Arguelllo, who also sells clothing, and Flor Alvarez Hernandez, who sells homemade food products out of her house. They hope to receive the loan in order to invest it in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA DE LA CRUZ TIENE 22 AÑOS , CASADA SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO.ELLA SE DEDICA A COMPRAR ROPA EN LA FRONTERA EN UN LUGAR DONDE VENDEN AL MAYOREO Y POSTERIORMENTE LA VENDE ENTRE LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA ELENA N. A. (VENDE ROPA ) Y DOÑA FLOR ALVAREZ HERNANDEZ ( VENTA DE ALIMENTOS TIPICOS ARTESANALES EN SU CASA ) CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS .

loans.use: VENTA DE ROPA

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his Jaggery (brown sugar) stocks

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
Maria Amparo is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has a grocery store in her home. She belongs to the loan group Flor de Caña 2. The other members of this group are Maria Angelina Jimenez Lopez, who crafts homemade mats from palm leaves, Karina Guadalupe Gordillo, who has a grocery store, and Guadalupe Jimenez Perez, who sells panela, pieces of compacted sugar she prepares herself. They will invest their loan in supporting their businesses by buying what they need to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA AMPARO , TIENE 48 AÑOS , CASADA 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES AGRICULTOR . ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA .PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 2 .CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO Y OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 2 LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : MARIA ANGELINA JIMENEZ LOPEZ ( COMPRA DE PALMAS CON LAS CUALES HACEN TEJIDOS DE TAPETES ARTESANALES) KARINA GUADALUPE GORDILLO ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) Y GUADALUPE JIMENEZ PEREZ ( VENDE PANELA , TROZOS DE AZUCAR COMPACTADA QUE ELLA PREPARA ) INVERTIRAN SU PRESTAMO EN APOYAR A SUS PROPIOS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO LO NECESARIO PARA AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS .

loans.use: Sales of homemade food products

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia belongs to the loan group Flor de Caña 2. She is 30 years old and married with one child. Her husband works in the fields as a cane farmer. She works in her house preparing tacos filled with chicken, vegetables or meat. She also makes panela, sugar compacted into pieces and used in the preparation of desserts and juices. With the loan she hopes to invest in kitchen tools to help her better prepare her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA EUGENIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE CAÑA 2 , ESTA CASADA TIENE 30 AÑOS Y UN HIJO , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO COMO AGRICULTOR DE CAÑA ,ELLA TRABAJA EN SU CASA PREPARANDO TACOS QUE SON MASAS RELLENAS DE POLLOS , VERDURAS O CARNES Y TAMBIEN ELABORA PANELA QUE ES AZUCAR COMPACTADA EN TROZOS QUE SE USA PARA LA ELABORACION DE POSTRES Y JUGOS ..CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA QUE LE AYUDARAN A REALIZAR MEJOR SUS PRODUCTOS .

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools with which to prepare her food products

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
Maria Lidia is 42 years old and married with 1 child. Her husband works in the fields. She sells tostadas filled with meat, chicken, lettuce, tomato and onion. She is a member of the loan group Dulce 1. With the loan she will buy kitchen tools to better prepare her products. She will also improve the area in her house where she sells her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA LIDIA TIENE 42 AÑOS , CASADA 1 HIJO SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO , ELLA SE DEDICA A VENDER TOSTADAS RELLENAS DE CARNE, POLLO , LECHUGA , QUESO , TOMATE Y CEBOLLA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 1. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA PARA ELABORAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y ACONDICIONARA MEJOR EL LUGAR QUE TIENE EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS.

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools with which to prepare her homemade food products

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
Yuliana is 18 years old and single. She is a craftswoman. During the mornings she studies and during the afternoons she makes blouses and cloth napkins. She adds handcrafted needlework and then sells them to the tourists who visit the area. Yuliana is a member of the loan group Dulce 1, along with Carolina M. Hernandez, who works in her house making candles to sell in the city. Both hope to use the loan to buy raw materials for their businesss and increase their production.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

YULIANA TIENE 18 AÑOS SOLTERA , ELLA ES ARTESANA EN LAS MAÑANA ESTUDIA Y EN LAS TARDES CONFECCIONA BLUSAS , SERVILLETAS DE MANTA Y LUEGO LAS BORDA Y LAS VENDE ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA CAROLINA M. HERNANDEZ QUIEN TRABAJA EN SU CASA ELABORANDO VELAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE EN LA CIUDAD . AMBAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MATERIALES PARA SUS NEGOCIOS Y AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION .

loans.use: Buy materials, so she can increase her production of handcrafted products

loans.name: Silvia Payano

texts.en:
Silvia chose the mini market as her business 8 years ago. She is a hard-working woman who has been able to maintain her business for a long time. Now it is time for her to make it grow; therefore, she wants to accept this loan to buy more inventory for her "colmado" or mini market. Every weekend the place becomes a night club for the people in her community to dance and have fun.

She is together with a man but not married to him, even though she has 7 children with him. Before she started her business, she used to stay at home and do house chores.

loans.use: To invest in drinks and food for her mini-market

loans.name: Yarisa Brea

texts.en: Yarisa sells jewelry to the people in her community, and she wants to take this loan to increase her supplies and variety. She buys the items in "Villa Consuelo," a nearby town. For her business to grow, she needs to make more sales; therefore, she needs more inventory. She is a married woman with one two-year-old daughter called Nicauris, and she used to work with her husband in a warehouse that he has.

loans.use: To buy more silver jewelry for her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina has always worked in the mini-market business, but she just started this new one two years ago. With help of her son, she manages this new business. She receives her supplies from a man who delivers them to her door. She started this new business because her old mini-market didn't work as she intended and lost money. In her business she sells rice, beans, and soup, amongst other things.

She lives in the small community of La Cola, is married, and is the proud mother of seven children, 3 girls and 4 boys.

loans.use: To buy food and more inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia wishes to take this loan because she wants to increase the inventory of her diner. She has been in this business for 5 years. She wants to invest in soft drinks because of the hot weather. She researches the things she needs in the local market and usually sells "frias" or cold beer because that is what refreshes people the most and sells the most. She is married and has 2 children, one boy and one girl.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: Geronima has dedicated her life to buying and selling for supermarkets, particularly the supermarket "Bravo." She goes 3 days a week and gets paid on Fridays or Saturdays. She is single and has three children, two daughters and one son. She lives in the community of Los Botados.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuff to a supermarket

loans.name: Marina Camila

texts.es:
Marina is a 55-year-old widowed mother of four. She makes candles and rents a post in the city to show off her products. She's part of a collective with Ofelia Perez, who runs a grocery store. With the loan, Marina plans to purchase raw materials like paraffin and dyes. Ofelia plans to purchase merchandise to increase her store's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARINA , TIENE 55 AÑOS , VIUDA , 4 HIJOS , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA FABRICACION DE VELAS Y RENTA UN LOCAL EN LA CIUDAD PARA LA EXHIBICION DE SUS PRODUCTOS. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO REMEDIOS 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA OFELIA PEREZ (TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) .CON EL PRESTAMO MARINA COMPRARA LAS MATERIAS PRIMAS , PARAFINA Y COLORANTES Y DOÑA OFELIA SURTIRA CON MAS MERCADERIA SU TIENDA.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a 36-year-old single mother of two. In order to survive, she put up a convenience store in her house, and on the weekends she prepares typical regional dishes and sells them in her neighborhood. Maria belongs to a collective with Mercedes Hernandez, who runs a cyber cafe, and Eligia L. Gomez, who makes and sells candles. With the loan, they plan to buy necessary materials so their sales can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA , TIENE 36 AÑOS , ES MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS , ELLA PARA SOBREVIVIR INSTALO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA PREPARA ALIMENTOS TIPICOS DE SU REGION PARA VENDERLOS ENTRE LOS HABITANTES DE SU COMUNIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO REMEDIOS 5 JUNTO CON MERCEDES HERNANDEZ HERNANDEZ ( CIBERT-CAFÉ ) Y DOÑA ELIGIA L. GOMEZ (CONFECCIONA Y VENDE VELAS ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN IMPLEMENTAR SUS NEGOCIOS CON MAS MATERIALES QUE AUMENTEN SUS INGRESOS.

loans.use: Purchase materials for convenience store, cyber cafe and candle-making.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a 24-year-old married mother of five. Her husband is a construction worker. She makes bracelets and belts with silky thread and sells them to tourists who visit San Cristobal at an outdoor market in the park. She belongs to a collective with Veronica L., an artisan. With the loan, both plan to purchase more silky thread to increase their decorative production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

ROSA TIENE 24 AÑOS , CASADA , 5 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA DE ALBAÑIL, ELLA HACE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES CON HILOS DE SEDA Y LOS VENDE A LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL COMO VENDEDOR AMBULANTE EN EL PARQUE . PERTENECE AL GRUPO SONORA 7 JUNTO CON VERONICA L. L. ( ARTESANA) CON EL PRESTAMO AMBAS INVERTIRAN EN COMPRAR MAS HILOS DE SEDA PARA TENER MAYOR PRODUCCION DE ARTESANIAS.

loans.use: Purchase thread

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is a 19-year-old single mother of one. She sells shoes by catalogue order in her neighborhood. She also has a tiny post in her house where she sends fruits and vegetables. She belongs to a collective with Juana Lopez Panela, who sells decorative bracelets and belts. With the loan, they plan to stock their business with more merchandise and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

VERONICA TIENE 19 AÑOS , MADRE SOLTERA CON UN HIJO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALZADOS POR CATALOGOS Y A PEDIDO LOS VENDE CON LOS VECINOS DE SU COMUNIDAD .TAMBIEN TIENE EN SU CASA UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DONDE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SONORA 7 JUNTO CON DOÑA JUANA LOPEZ PANELA ( VENDE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES DE ARTESANIA ) CON EL PRESTAMO AUMENTARAN SUS COMPRAS Y ASI TENDRAN SUS NEGOCIOS MAS ABASTECIDOS DE LAS MERCADERIAS QUE VENDEN .

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia is a 45-year-old married mother of six. Her husband works harvesting cane. She runs a convenience store out of her home to help with family expenses. She belongs to a collective with Maria Eugenia G. Lopez, who raises chickens, Berta Soliz G., who sells clothes, and Amalia V. Guillen, who raises pigs. With the loan, the animal breeders plan to purchase more livestock, while Ofelia and Berta plan to purchase more merchandise for their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

OFELIA TIENE 45 AÑOS , CASADA , 6 HIJOS , SU ESPOSOS SE DEDICA A LA COSECHA DE LA CAÑA .ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES CONTRIBUYENDO DE ESTA FORMA A LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LA PASADITA 4 . JUNTO CON MARIA EUGENIA G. LOPEZ ( CRIANZA DE POLLOS ) Y BERTA SOLIZ G. ( VENTA DE ROPA ) AMALIA V. GUILLEN ( CRIANZA DE PUERCOS ). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR MAS ANIMALES PARA TENER MAYOR PRODUCCION DE ELLOS Y OFELIA COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SU TIENDA .

loans.use: Purchase livestock and merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a 51-year-old married mother of two. Her husband works as a delivery man as a local business. She raises chickens and sells them to people in her neighborhood. She's part of a collective with Candelaria Guizar V., who raises chickens and pigs. With the loan, they plan to purchase food and medication for the animals, which help increase their reproduction numbers and thusly raise their sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA ELENA TIENE 51 AÑOS, CASADA, DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSOS TRABAJA COMO REPARTIDOR EN UNA EMPRESA DE SU COMUNIDAD. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y LO VENDE CON LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LA PASADITA 4 JUNTO CON CANDELARIA GUIZAR V. ( CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y PUERCOS ). CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARAN ALIMENTO, Y MEDICAMENTOS PARA EVITAR LAS PLAGAS ENTRE LOS ANIMALES, Y ASI AUMENTAR LA REPRODUCCION Y ASI MISMO LAS VENTAS Y LAS GANANCIAS.

loans.use: Purchase food and medicines for livestock

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
BERTA a 37-year-old married mother of four. Her husband works in the country harvesting cane. She runs a convenience store out of her home and also sells clothes. She belongs to a collective with Rosalba Jimenez R., Asuncion del Transito Hernandez, who sells perfume and cosmetics, and Bertha R. R., who sells clothing. With the loan, they plan to increase their merchandise and thusly grow their businesses and help cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

BERTA TIENE 37 AÑOS, CASADA, CUATRO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DE LA CAÑA. ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA EN DONDE TAMBIEN VENDE ROPA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SAN VICENTE 2 JUNTO CON: ROSALBA JIMENEZ R. (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS) Y ASUNCION DEL TRANSITO HERNANDEZ (VENTA DE ROPA). CON EL PRESTAMO AUMENTARAN SU MERCANCIA Y DE ESTA FORMA CRECERAN COMO COMERCIANTES Y PODRAN CONTRIBUIR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria M., a single mother of 5, works selling automobile accessories in the "July 16" market in the city of El Alto. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for approximately a year and a half. The injection of capital was essential in the establishment of Victoria's source of work and sustenance because of the size of her family.

During her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, Victoria applied for a loan of $200, which allowed her to stock her sales stall and collaborate with her eldest son. With the collaboration her son was able to enter the automobile motor and spare parts business. The loan was repaid in a period of 6 months, the maximum period for repayment.

Currently Victoria needs a loan to cover the costs of business trips through which she will import a wider variety of merchandise. The additional merchandise will allow her to increase her income, with the aim to establish a business buying and selling vehicles. She hopes to leave the business to her children as their means of supporting themselves.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Victoria M., madre de 5 hijos, soltera, trabaja como vendedora de artículos para automóviles en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Es socia de Pro Mujer aproximadamente un año y medio, la inyección de capital fue esencial para el establecimiento de su fuente de trabajo y sustento diario, tomando en cuenta lo numeroso de su descendencia.

En un primer ciclo, es decir, el primer desembolso aprobado, Victoria solicitó un crédito de 200 $us. que le permitió el abastecimiento de su puesto de venta y colaborar a su hijo mayor para que incursione en el comercio de motores y repuestos. Este monto fue repagado en un lapso de 6 meses que es el máximo para cada ciclo.

En la actualidad la señora victoria M. necesita un crédito que le permita realizar viajes para la importación de mayor variedad de mercadería y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, con el objetivo de establecer un negocio de compra y venta de vehículos, que podrá heredar posteriormente para el sustento de sus 5 hijos.

loans.use: Pay for trips in order to import a wider variety of merchandise. This will improve her income and help her establish a business buying and selling vehicles, which she will leave to her five children, as their means of supporting themselves.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz C. Beizaga, a married woman with 5 school-aged children, used to earn her living from a food stand precariously set up in her home.

Poor sales and competition made it impossible for her to realize her dreams of getting ahead and seeing her children well prepared for the difficulties of everyday life.

Beatriz began to partner with Pro Mujer almost 5 years ago, receiving a micro loan that allowed her to stock her tiny food stand, though without the success she'd hope for. Thanks to the guidance she received at Pro Mujer, she decided to change direction and began selling stuffed animals. This business has given her the opportunity to stay with the association for more than 8 years.

At the moment Beatriz needs to travel outside Bolivia to buy merchandise so that she can prepare her sales stall for the end-of-.year holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Un puesto de comida instalado precariamente en su domicilio, ubicado en el centro de la feria 16 de Julio de El Alto, era el medio de sustento de Beatriz C. Beizaga, casada, y con 5 hijos en edad escolar. La poca venta y la competencia, hacía ver imposible la realización de sus sueños de superación y el anhelo de ver a sus hijos preparados para las vicisitudes de la vida cotidiana.

Beatriz ingresa a Pro Mujer hace casi 5 años atrás, solicitando un micro crédito que le permitió abastecer su pequeño puesto de comida pero sin el éxito deseado. Es así que gracias a la orientación recibida en la organización decide el cambio de rubro y se dedica a la venta de peluches, negocio que le da la oportunidad de permanecer más de 8 años en la misma asociación.

Actualmente la señora Beatriz precisa realizar viajes al exterior para la compra de mercadería, de esta manera preparar su puesto de venta para las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Pay the costs of trips abroad, so she can buy merchandise with which to stock her stall well for the holidays at the end of the year

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina is 61 years old and has 18 children if whom only 2 still live with her and her husband. They others have already moved out. They have their own house in a rural area 120 km from the city of Encarnación where her husband works the land and rears animals. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays Saturnina goes to the market in the city with a group of neighbours to sell their products in the main market in the city. She mainly sells pork, turkey and duck meat as these are the main products that they produce. It is a very hard job as they have to spend 2 nights sleeping by their stalls where they sell, but despite her age she does it enthusiastically. The loan that she would like is to enlarge their pig sty as pork is the main product that they sell in the market and for this reason they would like to build a new pig sty of 2 x 2 metres to rear 4 more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Saturnina de 61 años de edad, es madre 18 hijos, de los cuales actualmente solo dos viven con ella y su marido, los demás ya se independizaron de la unidad familiar. Poseen su casa propia en una comunidad rural distante a 120 Km. de la ciudad de Encarnación, donde su marido se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales. Los días jueves, viernes y sábados, la Sra. Saturnina llega hasta el mercado de la ciudad junto con un grupo de vecinos para vender sus productos en la feria municipal de la ciudad de Encarnación. Ella en particular comercializa carne de cerdos, gallinas caceras y patos. Los productos que comercializa son la mayoría de su producción, y cuando es necesario compra de sus vecinos. Cabe destacar que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues vienen en grupo y se quedan a dormir dos noches en sus puestos de trabajos, y ella a pesar de su edad lo hace siempre con mucho entusiasmo. El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación de la infraestructura que posee para la cría de cerdos. Siendo este actualmente el producto que mayor demanda tienen en la feria y si compra de terceros su ganancia es menor que si los produce ella misma por lo que desea construir un galpón de 2 x 2 metros para criar 4 cerdos más.

loans.use: To build an extra pig sty/construcción de un galpón para cría de cerdos

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal is 45 years old and is married to Celsa. They have 2 children who both study in the national school of the area. They all live together in their own house in one of the towns in the city of Encarnación. Aníbal and his wife have a store in the central market of the city as it is the most commercial area of the zone. They sell basic products such as oil, flour, sugar, grain etc and they have done this for 6 years. They started in a very small stall but thanks to good business sense they now have a very large and well stocked store. Their main clients are those who make food in the central market who buy their raw ingredients from Don Aníbal. They would like to enlarge their business by buying a larger variety of products from Argentina (which borders Paraguay) the prices are lower and it is only a few hours from Encarnación. The products he would buy with the loan would be dairy products, coffee, powdered milk, wine, flour etc.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Aníbal tiene 45 años, está casado con la Sra. Celsa y tienen dos hijos, quienes estudian en un colegio nacional de la zona, viven todos juntos es una casa propia ubicada en uno de los barrios de la ciudad de Encarnación. Aníbal y su señora poseen un local comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad que es el mayor centro comercial de la zona. Venden artículos de primera necesidad como aceite, harina, azúcar, fideos, granos, etc. y ya llevan 6 años de antigüedad en el lugar. Comenzaron con un pequeño local y gracias a su buena administración, hoy día ya poseen una despensa bien surtida, sus principales clientes son comedores de la zona que adquieren su materia prima en el almacén de Don Aníbal. Ellos están deseosos de ampliar su negocio, por lo que desean comprar más variedad de productos para la venta, los mismos desean adquirirlos de Argentina (país que limita con Paraguay) pues allí los precios son más bajos y queda a pocas horas de Encarnación. Los productos a adquirir con el crédito son golosinas, productos enlatados, café, leche en polvo, vino, harina, etc.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, coffee, powdered milk, wine, flour etc/Compra de golosinas, productos enlatados, café, leche en polvo, vino, harina, etc.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina is 38 years old and is married to Andrés who is 44 years old. They have 2 children, a girl of 12 and a boy of 7 who both study in the national school of the area. Her husband sells wallets, handbags and belts and they all live together in their own house. She has a business selling underwear, socks and other similar items. She has been doing this in the central market of their city for 10 years. Her main clients are tourists from the border city of Posadas in Argentina as these products are cheap for them. As there is a lot of competition in this area and it is hard to raise ones prices to earn more, she would like to buy the cheapest products and for this is would like a loan to buy underwear in bulk so that she can obtain important discounts which will give her higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Evangelina es una señora D. 38 años está casada con el Sr. Andrés D. 44 años, tienen dos hijos, una nena D. 12 y un varón D. 7 años, quienes estudian en un colegio nacional D. la zona, su marido se dedica a la venta ambulante D. carteras, billeteras y cintos, ellos viven todos juntos en una casa propia. Ella posee un negocio D. ventas D. ropas interiores, remeras, calzas, buzos y otros artículos similares, con más D. 10 años D. antigüedad en el mercado municipal del a ciudad. Sus principales clientes son turistas D. la ciudad fronteriza D. Posadas (Argentina), para quienes los productos ofertados poseen precios muy atractivos. Considerando, que la competencia en la zona es bastante intensa y dificulta subir los precios para aumentar las ganancias, ella debe comprar sus productos al menor precio D. plaza; para ello solicita un crédito que lo invertirá a la compra al por mayor D. ropa interior, medias, calzas, remeras, buzos, camperas; con esto ella obtendrá descuentos importantes que le darán mayor margen D. ganancias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: underwear etc/ Compra de mercaderías: ropa interior, medias, calzas y remeras.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
Leoncia R. G. is 37 years old and is single and lives in Encarnación. She rents a house with her mother and a cousin in the lower zone of Encarnación. She opened her own business from home selling women’s clothing such as underwear, socks, sportswear etc. her good location and the fact that she has been doing this for 10 years means she has many clients. Her main clients are tourists from the border city Posadas (Argentina) as the products are cheap for them. She would like to enlarge her business and for this she would like a loan to buy larger quantities of underwear and socks as you get a better price and more discounts for buying them in bulk which means she could compete more in the market and at the same time increase her sales and therefore her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Leoncia R. G. tiene 37 años es soltera y es de Encarnación, ella vive en una casa alquilada junto con su madre y una prima y que está ubicada en la zona baja de la ciudad de Encarnación. Ella abrió su propio negocio en su casa donde se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas como remeras, ropa interior, medias, ropa deportiva, etc., su buena ubicación y una antigüedad de más de 10 años en el ramo hacen que ya cuente con una buena clientela formada. Sus principales clientes son turistas de la ciudad fronteriza de Posadas (Argentina), para quienes los productos ofertados son de precios muy atractivos. Ella desea ampliar el negocio por lo que pide un préstamo que lo destinará a la compra en cantidades mayores y al contado de ropas interiores, medias y remeras pues comprando de esa manera ofrecen mejores precios y descuentos, lo que hace que se pueda competir mejor en el mercado; esto a su vez aumentará sus ventas y podrá aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: underwear etc/Compra de mercaderías: ropa interior, medias y remeras.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 40 years old and is married to Victor, who is 44 years old. They have 1 daughter who is 15 years old and studies in the national school in their area. We are told that their daughter is one of the best pupils in the school and she always fills them with priD. and happiness. The family live in a rural area 45 km from the city of Encarnación. They produce fruits and salad vegetables. Their production system is manual and her husband has 3 helpers who care for the products like lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes, beans, mandioca (a popular Paraguayan root) and fruits such as oranges, mandarins, lemons and bananas. Margarita is the one who sells these products in the central market of Encarnación on Thursday, Friday and Saturday every week. They would like a loan to enlarge their production area so that they can meet the increase in demand for their products in the market. The money will be invested in seeds and products of the care of lettuces, onions and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Margarita tiene 40 años D. edad y está casada con el Sr. Víctor D. 44 años, tienen una hija D. 15 años, quien estudia en el colegio nacional D. la zona, ella nos cuenta que su hija es una D. las mejores alumnas D. su colegio y siempre les llena D. orgullo y alegría. La familia vive en un área rural distante a 45 km D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, se dedican a la producción D. frutas y hortalizas en general. Su sistema D. producción es manual, su esposo con tres ayudantes se encargan del cuidado D. los cultivos, como ser: lechugas, repollos, tomates, zapallos, choclos, locotes (morrones), porotos, mandioca (raíz muy consumida en el Paraguay), y frutas como: naranjas, mandarinas, limones y bananas. La Sra. Margarita es la encargada D. comercializar la producción en la feria municipal D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, los días jueves, viernes y sábados D. todas las semanas. Solicita el crédito para ampliación D. su área D. cultivo, debido al aumento D. las demandas D. sus productos en la feria, el dinero será invertido en la compra D. semillas e insumos para el cultivo D. D. lechugas, cebollas, papa y choclos.

loans.use: To buy seed and ingredients for planting lettuce, onions etc/Compra de semillas e insumos para plantación de lechugas, cebollas y choclos.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
