With a house under construction and all but finished, Yola Bertha M. de Quispe has a sales stall on John Paul II Avenue in the city of El Alto. She tends to her stall only on market days (Thursdays and Sundays). With her husband and 3 children, Yola is working to get ahead through the preparation and sales of typical Bolivian dishes. Her objective is to earn enough capital to be able to rent premises where she can establish a restaurant. She plans to serve lunches during the day and fast food in the evenings.

Yola has been a Pro Mujer partner for almost 2 years. During that time she has been able to invest in her food stand and substantially improve her menu, and with the improved menu, her clientele and profitability.

Yola needs capital with which to invest in improvements to her sales stand. With the rainy season upon her, she needs to improve the stand so that inclement weather will not prevent her from working. If she is able to work in all types of weather, she will be able to open her fast food restaurant sooner.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Con una casa en construcción, a punto de culminar la obra fina, la señora Yola Bertha M. de Quispe, tiene un puesto de venta de comida en la Avenida Juan Pablo II en la ciudad de El Alto, mismo que atiende solo los días de feria (jueves y domingo). En compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos, intenta progresar mediante la preparación y venta de platos típicos de la gastronomía nacional, con el firme objetivo de lograr reunir una cantidad de dinero que le permita tomar un alquiler y establecer un snack para la atención diaria de almuerzos, y por las noches la venta de comida rápida.

Son casi dos años que la señora Yola es socia de Pro Mujer, antigüedad que le permitió invertir en su puesto de comida y mejorar sustancialmente el menú ofertado y de forma inherente su clientela y rentabilidad.

Yola necesita de capital para realizar una nueva inversión en su puesto de comida, principalmente en la actual época de lluvia, para brindar la comodidad necesaria a sus comensales, de esta manera no perjudicar su trabajo por las inclemencias del tiempo, lo que le permitirá más prontamente la apertura de su restaurante de comida rápida.

loans.use: Yola needs capital in order to make a new investment in her sales stall. With the rainy season upon her, she needs to make improvements so that her work will not be threatened by bad weather. This will allow her to reach her objective and establish a fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
Valerio is 52 years old and is married with 3 children. After working for many years in highway construction and after seeing the need for more money in his family, he decided to open a stall in the central market in the city with his wife. With the help of his wife and his 2 sons he works very hard 6 days a week, come rain or shine. His main motivation is to give his children the opportunity to go to university as neither he nor his wife were lucky enough to do this. All of his children study and his eldest daughter is doing the entry exam to study Medicine in the UNA (National University of Asunción). Valerio does not only have this stall, but he also rears pigs in a sty that he inherited from his parents. Valerio wants to increase his earnings and would like to buy merchandise in larger quantities so that he can sell more in his stall and sell to other stalls. He is asking for a loan of $675 with which he will buy sugar, flour, oil, grain and dairy products etc.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Valerio tiene 52 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Luego de Trabajar varios años en una empresa de construcciones viales, y viendo la necesidad de generar más ingresos en la familia, decidió junto con su esposa habilitar una despensa en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Ayudado de su esposa y dos de sus hijos, él trabaja arduamente seis días a la semana haga frío o calor. Su principal motivación es la de dar la oportunidad a su hijos de culminar sus estudios universitarios, ya que él y su esposa no corrieron con esa suerte. Todos sus hijos estudian, y su hija mayor está cursando el probatorio para la Carrera de Medicina en la U.N.A (Universidad Nacional de Asunción). Valerio no solo tiene la despensa, sino que también se dedica a la cría de cerdos en un inmueble que heredo de sus padres. Valerio desea aumentar sus ingresos, por lo que desea comprar en grandes cantidades mercaderías para vender al por mayor en su despensa y ser proveedor de las demás despensas del lugar. Solicita la suma de $ 675 con los que adquirirá azúcar, harina, aceite, granos, productos enlatados, etc.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, oil, grain, dairy products/Para comprar al por mayor azúcar, harina, aceite, granos, productos enlatados, etc.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
At the age of 56, Mrs. Dao Thi S. and her husband Nguyen Ngoc Ngon, 60 years old could have retired from work and felt content with taking care of their grandchildren. Their four children are grown up; each has his own family. Unlike a lot of women at this age, Mrs. S. believes that working helps people stay healthier. Her main job now is to take care of her chickens. Her chicken-house is divided into three parts: chickens raised for meat, for eggs, and for breeding. Having a systematic and scientific farming categorization, Mrs. S. is confident at investing on Egyptain high-yield chickens. This is a bold decision because this is a new breed in Vietnam. Most of the villagers are still afraid of investing on this breed because they do not know if it will work. With determination, S. believes in the success of the project. She plans to borrow $450 to buy food for her more- than- 100 chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ở tuổi 56, chị Đào Thị S. và chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Ngọc Ngôn, 60 tuổi có thể yên tâm nghỉ ngơi và vui vẻ với việc trông cháu. 4 người con của anh chị đều đã trưởng thành và có gia đình riêng. Nhưng khác với suy nghĩ của một số phụ nữ cùng độ tuổi này, chị S. quan niệm công việc lao động giúp cho con người năng động và nhanh nhẹn hơn. Công việc chủ yếu của chị hiện nay là chăm lo cho đàn gà. Chuồng gà nhà chị chia làm 3 ngăn: gà thịt, gà đẻ và gà giống. Phân chia việc chăn nuôi một cách khoa học, chị S. còn mạnh dạn đầu tư vào giống gà Ai Cập siêu đẻ. Đây là một quyết định táo bạo vì đây là giống gà mới, phần lớn người dân còn ngại đầu tư vào giống gà này vì chưa rõ hiệu quả nhưng chị S. với quyết tâm của mình tin tưởng vào sự thành công của dự án. Chị dự định vay vốn 450 USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn gà Ai Cập hơn 100 con của mình.

loans.use: buy chicken-feed

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi X., 56 years old, and her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Bich, have 2 perches of rice-field, 22 pigs, 100 chickens, 20 wild geese and a fish pond. Their children all work away from home. X. and Bich spend all of their time on their farm. Nights are the only time when they can take care of their 2 grandchildren. Although having to work hard, X. always believes that their efforts will bring good things to their lives. Now she is looking forward to borrow $450 to buy young fishes and food for her pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Làm 2 sào ruộng, nuôi 22 con lợn, 100 con gà, 20 con ngan cùng một ao cá là toàn bộ công việc mà chị Nguyễn Thị Xuể, 56 tuổi và chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Bích đang đảm nhận. Các con đi làm ăn xa, hai anh chị đầu tư tất cả thời gian cho trang trại của gia đình. Chỉ buổi tối mới là lúc hai anh chị kết thúc công việc để chăm sóc cho 2 cháu nội. Tuy làm việc vất vả nhưng chị Xuể luôn tin những công sức mà hai anh chị bỏ ra sẽ mang lại kết quả tương xứng. Hiện tại chị đang làm đơn xin vay 450 USD để mua cá giống cho ao cá của mình.

loans.use: buy young fishes and food for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Hoa Thi

texts.vi:
The recent outbreak of bird flu in the northern province of Vinh Phu in Vietnam almost left the C. family in financial ruins after the majority of their chickens were destroyed because of the epidemic. Mrs. Hoa Thị C. is passionate about her entrepreneurial skills and she has reinvested what money she has into a new flock. Mr. & Mrs. C. have also decided to use twenty years of furniture building experience to start a new sustainable business. The furniture will be made of bamboo and the bamboo poles will have to be soaked in water for over three months, so the family will need a large amount of raw materials for this ongoing endeavor. To start this new venture, Mrs. C. is asking Kiva for assistance with the investment capital of $325 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Jean-Claude Thanh Lương, Kiva Volunteer.

Dịch cúm gà gây hậu quả lớn đến kinh tế gia đình chị C. Thị Hoa, xã Tân Hồng, huyện Yên Lạc, tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Cả đàn gà nhà chị Hoa hầu như bị mất trắng. Nhưng là một phụ nữ vững vàng, chị Hoa quyết tâm xây dựng lại tất cả. Đầu tư vào đàn gà mới hơn 100 con, chị Hoa đồng thời tập trung vào việc đan dát dường. Đây là công việc mà chị Hoa và chồng đã có hơn 20 năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề. Mua tre về đem ngâm xuống ao trong 3 tháng sau đó mới vớt lên đem phơi khô rồi đưa vào sử dụng trong khi việc đan lát phải diễn ra liên tục mới có thể mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên. Điều này đòi hỏi phải có một lượng vốn đủ lớn để mua tre về khi cần thiết. Chị Hoa đang xin vay của Quỹ Tình thương 325 USD để mua tre phát triển sản xuất.

loans.use: Purchase bamboo to make bamboo screens

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
With most of her children in school age and a swineherd sold off to avoid destruction by epidemy, Duong thi L. has to shoulder the heavy burden of family economy. Her husband, Duong van Hai, a vetenarian, has lost an arm in a work-related accident. Nevertheless he remains productive. Apart from tilling a acre of land, L.'s main concern is her feed store. Being trustworthy and honest, she has built up a stream of clientele who visits her store frequently. She projects to take a loan of US$575 to stock up bran, expand her business and finally raise a new swineherd.

Translated from Vietnamese by Doan Mai, Kiva volunteer.

¾ con đang trong độ tuổi đi học, cả đàn lợn được bán đi sau khi có dịch, gánh nặng kinh tế trong gia đình càng đè nặng lên hai vai chị Dương Thị Luyến, 45 tuổi, xã Bá Hiến, Bình Xuyên. Chồng chị, anh Dương Văn Hải, một y sỹ thú y bị tai nạn lao động mất một cánh tay, vẫn tích cực tham gia lao động sản xuất. Ngoài việc làm 1 mẫu ruộng, công việc chủ yếu của chị Luyến là tập trung vào cửa hàng thức ăn gia súc. Làm ăn có uy tín, cửa hàng của chị Luyến luôn có khách đến mua thường xuyên. Dự định của chị Luyến là vay 575 USD để mua thêm cám, tăng lượng hàng bán ra, sau khi hết dịch chị sẽ gây dựng một đàn lợn mới.

loans.use: buy bran

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
After her husband's recent death, two daughters having moved out and two sons away from maternal home for employment, Pham thi T. becomes the sole manual labor in the household. Supported by a daughter and son-in-law T. devotes all her time to raising a flock of more than 100 chickens. In return they provide her with an income of US$62.00 a month. In addition, she tills a piece of land of more than one acre. The labor is backbreaking, but T. always remains hopeful that one day it will pay off. She's considering taking a loan of UD$325.00 to buy 200 chicks to add to her existing flock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Mai Doan, Kiva volunteer.

Chồng vừa mất, hai con gái đều ra ở riêng, hai con trai đi làm ăn xa, chị Phạm Thị Thuận trở thành lao động duy nhất trong gia đình. Được con gái và con rể thường xuyên hỗ trợ, chị Thuận đầu tư tất cả thời gian vào việc chăn nuôi đàn gà hơn 100 con. Đàn gà này mang lại cho chị mức thu nhập 62 USD / tháng. Ngoài ra chị còn làm hơn một mẫu ruộng. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng chị Thuận luôn tin tưởng vào những thành quả mình sẽ đạt được. Chị đang định vay 325 USD để mua thêm 200 con gà nữa để mở rộng việc chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy 200 young chicks

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina N. is a single Muganda lady by tribe and an artist by profession. She joined Life in Africa in 2004 together with other artists. When she joined, life was hard, and she did not have a job. She is very active in doing things and is a good leader. During her reign as Talent Discovery Team Leader, everybody was pleased. Serina is fond of children and of saving. She even was a champion of the Life in Africa member saving program. As a contribution to the community, she spent some of her own money to help get musical instruments like long drums, etc.

Being good at crafts and even more so at knitting, Serina has opened a boutique in Kiwatule where she sells her products alongside soda and beer for wholesale. This business is doing well. For her boutique, she now needs more materials as she has received a bulk order to be finished by August 4, 2007. She is requesting a loan of US$ 150 (250,000 Uganda shillings) and is sure she can repay it in a timely fashion.

Below is Serina's budget:

12 pieces of cloth @ 20,000/=………………240,000/=

Transport ………… …………………………10,000/=

Total ………………………………………….250,000/=

loans.use: Buying cloth for her little boutique

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. is a single mother nurturing two children. She comes from Gulu district in the northern part of Uganda. Currently she is living in one of the residential areas located in Kampala known as Nakawa Quarters. She is 30 years old, and she currently is totally responsible for her children without any assistance.

Helen left Gulu because she felt the North was unsafe due to the war, and she also needed to search for some kind of work so that her family could survive. It was not easy finding work in Kampala, so Helen started a small business. She would cook food and then take it to busy places and sell it. That was how she found Life in Africa: she came to us to sell her meals. She soon became a member and is now employed in the bracelet-making project. She has proved herself to be an understanding and patient person with great interpersonal skills.

Helen is very active and committed to the activities that LIA offers at our center. Over time, through Helen’s job at LIA, she was able to save some money that enabled her to start a small charcoal business in her effort to set up a side income to sustain herself and her family. She has proved to have a good head for business and has developed a solid customer base. She now plans to expand this business.

Currently Helen’s charcoal stall is located in her residential area and it’s being managed by one of her family members. They share the stall, each selling their own goods, and they take turns at working the stall.

Helen has now entered into a partnership with another dealer to travel up-country to buy charcoal at a lower price. They will split the transport costs which will allow each to make a greater profit. She has managed to save 150,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 90) and she is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 Uganda shillings to finance the expansion. Helen plans to reinvest the profits so that her business can continue to grow. With her good reputation and solid customer base she is very confident that her business will succeed and her family will benefit greatly. She feels sure she can repay this loan in a timely fashion.

Below is her budget:

1.Buying charcoal ( 40 bags) at 6000/= ..240,0000/=

2.Loading and off loading.........30,000/=

3.Transport....................48,000/=

35 empty bags @ 500….......17500/=

Emergency…………………14500/=

Total………………………………350,000/=

loans.use: Buying charcoal for resale

loans.name: Enahon

texts.en: Enahon is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is married, but her husband does not work and does not pay any attention to the family. Enahon carries all of the responsibility for the well-being of her family. Recently, Enahon's youngest daughter was really ill. After diagnosis, it was found out that she has serious heart disease. She had an operation, and now Enahon looks after her at home. In the central market she rented a place where she trades women's and children's clothes. Her elder daughter (in the photo) helps her to trade. In the morning, she displays the goods on a counter and trades until the evening. Enahon has been with Microinvest for 2 years, and during this time her business has increased several times. She plans to use her new loan to increase the assortment of summer clothes.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of summer clothes

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam has a family business. He is 48 years old and has 3 children. He works in the state service. In the morning, he and his wife Gulbahor go to their trading place and sell their goods. Then his wife (in the photo) stays to trade and he goes to work. To buy the goods, he goes to Istaravshan town, 170 km away from Isfara. He came to Microinvest two and a half years ago to get a loan. The loan helped to increase the assortment of goods, and now he has more regular customers. He plans to further expand his business and is asking for a $1000 loan for 12 months for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en: Shohida is a young specialist who sews national dresses. She has a high education as a designer of women's garments. She has been a client of Micro Invest since 2003. Her business is to buy beautiful fabrics and sew dresses for the market. She has an agreement with several shops to sell her dresses in their shops. Shohida also takes orders from individuals for sewing modern garments for them. She is always trying her best to satisfy her clients. Today she has many constant clients. In the future, Shohida would like to hire one assistant to help her, and she needs extra capital to buy a sewing machine for this purpose. She is requesting 1200USD.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine

loans.name: Gulshodahon

texts.en: Gulshodahon and her husband are busy with small entrepreneurship - they sell menswear and haberdashery. She is 35 years old and has 3 children. Trading became the only source of income for their family, as there is no regular work. To buy the goods she travels to Istaravshan to the wholesale market.  Recently, Gulshodahon received a loan from Microinvest, and by also adding her own money, increased the quantity of goods. Gulshodahon and her husband are planning further expansion of their business. She wants to receive her next loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Further expansion of business

loans.name: Mehrihon

texts.en: Mehrihon has been engaged in trade for 9 years. She is 52 years old and she has 3 children. She is divorced from her husband. She began her business with a small counter and has gradually expanded it. Now she rents a trading place in a big shop. The expansion of business demanded additional money and one and a half years ago she came to Microinvest and received her first loan. In her business, there were important changes as she previously only sold children's clothes, but now she sells children's footwear as well. Soon it will be school season and Mehrihon plans to use a new loan for the purchase of school uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.en: Muyasar started her business over 4 years ago. She rents a place in an open-air market in Panjshanbe in Khujand. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a disabled person, and her elder son is in the army. So Muyasar is the one person in her family who can earn money for the family's needs. She has to trade in the open market, but because she was a housewife and did not work regularly, she was in a difficult situation. Two of her friends gave her money to rent a place in the open-air market for the first 2 months. They were clients of Micro Invest and involved Muyasar in this organization. She received her first loan of 100USD to buy the first batch of fruits and vegetables. Step by step Muyasar was able to increase the turnover of her business. Her last loan was for 600USD, and she bought grapes and tomatoes. In August she would like to buy different kinds of fruit and vegetables, because it will be the time of making fruit compotes and bottling vegetables for wintertime. She wishes to get more profit this month. She is requesting 800USD for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of next batch of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to further expand farmers' milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang's  family now consists of two persons: her husband ( 72 ) cultivates 100 "green dragon" (fruit) plants. Thang (63) sells candies at their home. Sometimes their
children (who are now married and live far from them) give them some gifts. Their average income per month per person is $13, but life is hard for these two elderly people. Thang wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her capital. She will be sure to repay this loan.

loans.use: expand her inventory of candies for sale in her house

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en:
Seven members of Hoi's family live together in the same house. The grandmother is old (73) and gets social security. The father works as a farmer cultivating 150 "green dragon" (fruit) plants, but because of insect pests, his returns are low. The mother sells food at the market near their house.

Their oldest daughter works for a shoe company and contributes money to her parents monthly. Their second daughter helps her parents with their work, and the two youngest children are in school. They borrowed $625 from a bank to dig a well to water the "green dragon" plants. Their average income is $13 per month per person.

Hoi wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her capital for her little grocery business. She is sure they can repay this loan.

loans.use: have more capital so she can expand her business

loans.name: Trung

texts.en:
Trung's husband died in an accident in May 2006 and left the family owing $821.50 in hospital bills. Trung had to sell their house to pay her debts. Now she and her children live in a rented house with 300 "green dragon" (fruit) plants. They must pay $187.50 per year.

Trung also works as a day laborer and sells something out of their home to pay her children’s school fees; they are in 8th and 5th class. She wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in the "green dragon" plants so that she will get more profit from them. She is sure she can repay this loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: improve her yield from her "Green Dragon" fruit plants

loans.name: Sarya

texts.en: Sarya lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, and she lives with all the members of her family. She is a tailor. She wants to expand her business to support her family. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and bought new sewing machines and did good business. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials to attract more clients and make a good income to help her husband and make a better economic situation for her family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: There are 5 people in Canh's family. Their youngest child is in the 8th class. Canh is a worker for the "green dragon" company and her husband cultivates rice and "green dragon" (fruit) plants. Last year his income was very low because of insect damage. They still owe $ 625 to the bank from when they bought land for cultivation. Their average income is $13 per month per person. Now Canh wants to borrow $75 to invest in their "green dragon" plants. She is sure they can repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: improving their "green dragon" fruit harvest

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh lives with all of her family members. The grandmother is 65 years old. The father is a carpenter and Hanh works as a day laborer. Their two older children (14 and 10 years old) quit school because their marks were poor and it is very expensive. Their youngest daughter is in the 1st class. Their average income is $13 per month per person. Hanh wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their 100  "green dragon" (fruit) plants. She is sure they can repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: invest in their "green dragon" fruit plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost the inventory of his little store

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Tuong, the mother of this family (56 years old)  lives in the same house with her children and grandchildren. She sells charcoal, her daughter sells cakes and candies at their home, and her son-in-law goes out to work. Her two grandchildren are still young. Their average income is $13 per month per person. Tuong wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her capital for her charcoal-selling business. She feels sure they can repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: additional capital for her charcoal business

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung and her husband live with their four children: 22, 19,12, and 9 years old. The two youngest children are in school (6th and 3rd class). The others work as day laborers. Dung's husband has a liver complaint and their oldest daughter has nephritis.

They have 2000 square meters of land for cultivating rice, and Dung sells fruit at the market. All told, their average income is $11 per month per person. Dung wants to borrow $50 to increase her capital for her fruit-selling business. They will pay back $10 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: increase her capital for her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, the mother ( 56 years old ), sells cakes and candies at home. Her son works as a day laborer which means that his income is uncertain. They cultivate 60 "green dragon" (fruit) plants. Their average income is $15 per month per person. Hai wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in their garden, and they will pay back  the loan over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: invest in their "green dragon" fruit plants

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang's husband was in a serious accident on a motor bike and now his mental state isn’t good. He often complains to his wife and children. Hang works as a day laborer; she owed money to pay her husband’s hospital bills. They have no land. Their oldest daughter quit school, the second is in the 6th class, and the youngest is still too young to be in school.

Hang wants to borrow $ 50 for her fried banana sales business to get more profit to support her family. She will pay back $ 10 per month over a 5 month period.

loans.use: invest in her fried banana business

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Since Linh's husband died, Linh, 34 years old, supports her 4 children. Her oldest son had to quit school to take care his youngest brother who has cerebral-palsy. The other two children are in school.

Linh sells cakes and candies at home. They haven’t any land to farm. Their average income is $ 10 per month per person. Linh wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her capital for her little business. She will pay back $10 per month over a 5 month period.

loans.use: increase her small business capital

loans.name: Gul Bahar

texts.en: Gul Bahar lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow, and she lives with her children. Her craft is traditional weaving. She is working with her children in her home. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and bought new weaving machines. She made a good income and enrolled her children in better education centers. Now she wants to take anther loan to complete the purchase of her necessary materials and continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Akossiwa D. is the fourth wife in her household, and mother of six children. Abandoned by her husband three years ago, Mrs. D. has sole responsibility for providing for her children from the profit she makes in her small business. In spite of her situation, she struggles on and does everything possible to make her children happy.

Dynamic, hardworking and honest, she has been able to pay off her first loan in a timely fashion. To strengthen her business and enlarge her display of goods, she is now requesting a loan of $900. This will allow her to increase her profit margin and thus cater more efficiently to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame D. Akossiwa est la quatrième femme de son foyer et est mère de six (06) enfants. Abandonnée par son mari, il y a trois ans, Madame D. Akossiwa s’occupe seule de ses enfants avec le bénéfice qu’elle tire de son petit commerce. Malgré la situation dans laquelle elle vit, elle se bat et met toujours tout en œuvre pour rendre ses enfants heureux.

Dynamique, active et honnête, elle a pu rembourser au temps opportun le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu. Pour renforcer son activité et augmenter son étalage, elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $900. Ceci lui permettra de dégager une marge bénéficiaire élevée pour répondre efficacement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of vital commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Aged about 37, Mrs. Afi A. is her husband’s second wife. She is responsible for three people and her main business is catering. She sells rice, beans and pasta. With limited means, she has to use credit to purchase her supplies from retailers, thus reducing her profit margin.

To avoid this unnecessary loss of profit, Mrs. A. is asking for a loan of $800. She will use these funds to purchase her supplies wholesale, allowing her to improve her turnover.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans environ, Madame A. Afi est la 2ème femme de son mari. Elle a à sa charge 3 personnes et son activité principale et la restauration. Elle vend du riz, du haricot et de la pâte alimentaire. N’ayant pas de moyens suffisants, elle achète à crédit chez les détaillants réduisant sa marge bénéficiaire.

Pour éviter ces pertes inutiles, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce afin d’acheter en chez les grossistes. Ceci lui permettra de faire un bon chiffre d’affaire.

loans.use: To stock up on sacks of rice, beans and so on

loans.name: Lébéné

texts.fr:
Mrs. Lébéné K. is a 35 year-old woman, born in Tsévié. A married mother of four (04) children, her husband is a teacher who is unemployed most of the time. Because of this situation, he cannot take care of the family, and thus the responsibility of taking care of the household belogs to Mrs. Lébéné K.. Illiterate, she was a housewife in Lomé for five years before becoming a smoked fish saleswoman at the Gapé Central market.

Despite her difficult life, she has never ceased to fight for the happiness of her children. A moral and conciencous woman, she successfully refunded the first loan. Currently, she is asking for a second credit of $800 to build her smoked fish business. She thus hopes to be able to reduce her and her family's sufferings.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame K. Lébéné est née à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, son mari enseignant de profession est toujours sans emploi. Face à cette situation, il n’arrive plus à s’occuper de la famille, et donc il revient à Madame K. Lébéné d’assurer la responsabilité de chef de famille. Analphabète, elle fut domestique à Lomé pendant cinq ans avant d’être aujourd’hui revendeuse de poissons fumés au marché de Gapé Centre. Malgré cette vie de misère, elle n’a jamais cessé d’œuvrer et de se battre pour le bonheur de ses enfants à la maison. Présentant, une bonne moralité, elle a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a reçu. Actuellement, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit de $800 pour renforcer son commerce de poissons fumés. Ainsi, elle pourra alléger ses souffrances et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling smoked fish

loans.name: Ayaovi Séna

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayaovi Séna A. is 25 years old and married. She takes care of her parents and one of her younger sisters. She has a successful hair salon. However, she has to buy cosmetic products for the business on a regular basis. Without the sufficient means, she often ends up being out-of-stock and is obliged to purchase the products on credit. To resolve this problem, she is asking for a loan of $600 to stock up her business with cosmetic products in order to be able to reap all of the profits and build a loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayaovi Séna a 25 ans, elle est mariée et a ses parents et une de ses petites sœurs en charge. Elle a comme activité la coiffure qui lui réussit bien. Toutefois, elle est confrontée à l’achat des produits cosmétique. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyens, elle se voit très souvent face à la rupture de stock où elle est obligée de faire des achats à crédit. Pour mettre fin à cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour faire un stock de produit cosmétique afin de posséder la totalité de sa marge bénéficiaire, et fidéliser sa clientèle.

loans.use: Buying cosmetic products

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kossiwa A.,a 35-year-old woman, and her husband are farmers. They have had four (04) children together. Thanks to the income from their pineapple farm, they manage to provide for the needs of their family. With this small income, Mrs. A. also takes care of her very old parents. Hard working and honest, she refunded without difficulty the first loan from which she benefited. To help her with her living situation, she is asking for a loan of $700 to grow her pineapple field. This opportunity would enable her to more effectively provide for the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Kossiwa, 35 ans et son mari sont tous cultivateurs. Ils ont eu ensemble quatre (04) enfants. C’est grâce au revenu de la culture d’ananas qu’ils arrivent à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Et aussi Madame A. doit s’occuper de ses parents très âgés avec ce maigre revenu. Travailleuse et honnête, elle a remboursé sans difficulté le premier crédit dont elle avait bénéficié. Pour alléger cette situation très précaire, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour agrandir son champ d’ananas. Cette possibilité lui permettra de faire face efficacement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Grow her pineapple field

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ama A., 34, is mother to eight children who have never been to school because the family lacks the necessary money to send them. Her husband who had been working as a guard at a school has been let go, so she is the sole breadwinner for the family. Mrs. A. was a servant in the family of a close relative for a year before learning how to make ointments (pommades). In spite of the their poverty, the family manages to function normally.

Preparing the ointments demands a good deal of financial input and for this reason, Mrs. A. took out a first loan which she managed to repay in a timely fashion. Now she is asking for another loan, this time $700, so that she can purchase all that is necessary for her purpose (camphor, candles, etc.). This little endeavor is the family's only hope of rising above their miserable situation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 34 ans, Madame A. Ama est mère de huit (08) enfants qui n’ont pas été scolarisés par manque de moyens. Son mari Gardien au CEG Gapé Centre a été licencié ; ce qui fait qu’elle subvient seule aux besoins de la famille. Elle fut domestique chez un proche parent pendant un an, avant d’être initié à la préparation de pommade salcylées. Malgré la pauvreté de cette famille, l’ambiance y règne normalement.

Cette préparation nécessitant beaucoup de moyens financiers avait poussé Madame A. Ama a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’elle a remboursé avant l’échéance. Encore une deuxième fois, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour s’approvisionner de tous les nécessaires (Kanfor, bougies…) pour la préparation ; seul moyen de sortir de la misère.

loans.use: stock up on raw materials for preparing ointments

loans.name: Damla Marie

texts.fr:
Miss Damla Marie L., 24, had to leave school and began to support herself by running a little general store. A hard worker, she manages her little store competently, earning in a small income from it.

She does not have enough money to expand her shelves, so she is asking for a loan of $300 that will allow her to maintain a more consistent inventory and thus satisfy the needs of her customers. This will permit her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, Mlle L. Damla Marie a abandonnée ses études et s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de premières nécessités afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Très dévouée elle arrive à bien gérer son commerce ce qui lui procure le minimum de revenu.

Ses moyens sont insuffisants pour augmenter la taille de son étalage, elle sollicite un appui financier de $300 pour s’approvisionner et avoir un stock plus consistant afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: increase her inventory for her general store

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Pauline A., age 50, is her husband's second wife. She is the mother of four and also takes care of three children from her deceased older sister. Using income from her grocery business (rice, beans, etc.), she manages to support her family. Lacking funds, she is obliged to buy on credit, which is costly for her.

To put an end to this situation, she is requesting a loan of $400 to create a major stock of goods in order to run her business well and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Femme de 50 ans, Madame A. Pauline est la 2ème femme de son mari. Elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants et a 3 enfants de sa grande sœur décédée à charge. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce de denrée alimentaire (riz, haricot, et autres) qu’elle arrive à supporter les charges de sa famille. Faute de moyens, elle est obligée d’acheter les choses à crédit ce qui lui revient cher.

Pour mettre fin à cette situation, Madame A. Pauline sollicite un appui financier de $400 pour s’approvisionner et avoir un stock consistant en vue de bien gérer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock rice, beans, and other goods.

loans.name: Dénaka

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dénaka B., 53, is married and mother of two children. Her husband is polygamous and chooses to live with whichever of his wives has the most income, so he is not living with Mrs. B. at present. Mrs. B. earns her living selling cereals and various grocery items. Her business is flourishing, however, she frequently runs out of things because of lack of capital to keep up her inventory.

Mrs. B. is asking for a loan of $1000 which she plans to use to stock up so as to keep her inventory stable and thus improve her little general store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 53 ans, Madame B. Dénaka est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Son mari est totalement absent car il a plusieurs femmes et c’est chez celle qui a plus de moyens qu’il vit. Le stockage et la vente des céréales et l’alimentation générale sont les activités principales de Madame B. Dénaka. C’est un commerce très florissant mais faute de moyens, elle n’arrive pas à s’en sortir car elle est souvent confrontée par la rupture de stock.

Afin d’être à la hauteur, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’approvisionner et avoir un stock plus consistant et relever ainsi son commerce d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: purchasing cereals and other merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
Abravi N., age 36, is married and the mother of five. Her invalid husband is helpless in face of his responsibilities. Being illiterate, she contents herself with her small field of taro to feed her family. Her children do not go to school due to a lack of funds. She tries to meet their needs with the little that she has, so that they may be happy.

A hard-working, devoted, and honest woman, she had benefited from an initial loan that she was able to repay in the shortest time. Today, wishing to enlarge her field, she is requesting once again a loan of $600. This loan will allow her to produce a great profit in order to send her children to school and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 36 ans, Madame N. Abravi est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari infirme, est incapable devant ses responsabilités. Analphabète, elle se contente de son petit champ de taro pour nourrir sa famille. Faute de moyens, les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Pour ne pas rendre malheureux, les enfants, elle essaie de les satisfaire avec le peu qu’elle a.

Travailleuse, dévouée et honnête, elle avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit qu’elle a su rembourser dans les meilleurs délais. Aujourd’hui, dans le souci d’aggrandir son champ, elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $600. Ce crédit lui permettra de réaliser un profit maximum afin de scolariser les enfants et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To enlarge her field and to diversify her crops

loans.name: Akouv

texts.fr:
At the age of 31, Akouvi A. is married and the mother of two. She is a hairdresser and has opened her salon with her meager funds. Her salon is not well-equipped, leading to lost customers and making her business unprofitable.

Very determined to realize her dreams, Ms. A. is asking for $500 of financial support to acquire a new hair dryer and beauty supplies. This will build up her level of business and make it most worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

A 31 ans, Madame A. Akouvi est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est coiffeuse et a ouvert son salon de coiffure avec ses maigres moyens. Son salon n’est pas bien équipé ce qui fait qu’elle perd les clientes et n’arrive pas à rentabiliser son activité.

Très déterminée à réaliser ses rêves, Madame A. Akouvi sollicite un appui financier de $500 pour s’acheter un nouvel séchoir et des produits cosmétiques afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et en profiter au maximum.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and beauty supplies

loans.name: Anty

texts.fr:
Anty K., age 36, is married and the mother of three. Her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, has trouble feeding his family. This leads Ms. K. to assume most of the household expenses. Having a primary school education, she was a domestic for two years in Kpalimé before enter an apprenticeship.

An energetic and honest woman, she had gotten an initial loan that she was able to manage as expected upon accepting it. Today, she is requesting a second loan in order to sell "pagnes" (colorful traditional cloths commonly worn as sarongs). This will allow her to clear a big profit to participate in improving the living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 36 ans, Madame K. Anty est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari conducteur de taxi moto arrive difficilement à nourrir la famille. Ce qui fait que Madame K. Anty assume la grande partie des charges du foyer. De niveau primaire, elle fut domestique pendant deux ans à Kpalimé avant d’aller en apprentissage.

Dynamique et honnête, elle avait reçu un premier crédit qu’elle a su gérer normalement suivant l’engagement pris. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite encore un second crédit pour la vente de pagne. Ce qui lui permettra de dégager un grand bénéfice pour participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Commerce in traditional cloths

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Born on May 25th, 1983 in Vogan in the prefecture of Vo, Miss Adjovi T. abandoned her studies due to lack of means and came to Lomé to learn how to sew. She has now gained her diploma but her brother does not have the means to open a workroom for her. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a sewing machine and put her expertise into practice. This will lead her towards financial autonomy and allow her to become independent.

Née le 25 mai 1983 à Vogan dans la préfecture de Vo, Mlle T. Adjovi a abandonné ses études fautes de moyens elle est venue à Lomé pour apprendre la couture. Aujourd’hui, elle est sortie avec son diplôme mais son frère n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour lui ouvrir son atelier. Elle sollicite cet apport financier de $600 pour s’acheter une machine et mettre en pratique son savoir-faire. Ceci l’amènera a avoir une autonomie financière en vue de se prendre en charge.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and open a tailoring workroom

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en: Anjelika owns a prosperous little business - she sells socks and women’s hosiery at the Central Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Anjelika's husband Vitalyi is an entrepreneur, too. Together, they support themselves and their two daughters. Anjelika and Vitalyi also have a dream of owning their own home, and have been saving money for that purpose. Anjelika is hoping that an increase in income from her business will help them fulfill their dream. She is a Christian and thanks God for the success of her business. Anjelika is now asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase inventory in bulk and help keep up with sales.

loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ten years ago, Ludmila started her women's clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Ludmila has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of four as well as her aging parents and brother. Throughout the last ten years, Nadiya Ukraine has provided ongoing assistance to Ludmila’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Ludmila has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, Ludmila is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to replace the depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Xewoe

texts.fr:
Aged 44, Mrs. Xewoe A. has been a widow for seven years and has six children at home. She is therefore alone in taking care of their schooling and other family expenses. Illiterate, she tries to manage by having a small business selling palm oil. As the business makes very little money, she cannot make ends meet. Having mastered her work very well, she has a good sense of management that would allow her to handle a loan and make the repayments. She is once again asking for a loan of $800 to stock up on palm nuts from the production zones with a view to making a maximum profit that would meet the needs of her family. Let us help her realize this dream, since sending her children to school is very important to her.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame A. Xewoe est veuve depuis sept ans avec six (06) enfants en charge. Ce qui montre qu’elle est seule face à la scolarité de ses enfants et les autres charges de la famille. Analphabète, elle se débrouille avec son petit commerce de l’huile de palme. Le revenu de son commerce étant très faible, elle n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. Ayant bien maîtriser son activité, elle a l’esprit de bonne gestion qui lui permet gérer les crédit et de bien les rembourser. Elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $800 pour s’approvisionner en noix de palme dans les zones de production en vue de réaliser un profit maximum pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Aidons-la à réaliser ce rêve car la scolarisation de ses enfants, lui est très importante.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Preparation and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Aged 22, Miss Akouvi A. had to abandon the classroom to learn to sew. Her parents left to live on a farm and she has to live in the village with one of her brothers, a master tapestry-maker, in order to pursue her apprenticeship. She has just finished but does not have the means to buy sewing machines and open her own workroom. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a sewing machine and rent somewhere to use as a workroom. This will allow her to take advantage of her craft and help her parents.

Agée de 22 ans, Mlle A. Akouvi a du abandonné les bancs pour apprendre la couture. Ses parents sont partis rester dans la ferme pour l’agriculture elle est obligée de rester chez l’un de ses frères de village un maître tapissier afin de poursuivre son apprentissage. Elle vient de terminer et les moyens lui manquent pour s’acheter des machines et ouvrir son atelier. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour acheter une machine, louer un local qui va lui servir d’atelier. Ceci lui permettra de profiter de son métier et en faire profiter ses parents.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and open a workroom

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya supports herself and her 13-year-old daughter, Anastasia, with her small business. She sells hats at a small shop at the busy Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. The business, which she started 15 years ago, is her sole source of income. In a typical month, Nataliya sells around $1,000 worth of hats, making a profit of about $240. Though her circumstances are difficult, Nataliya maintains an optimistic, joyful attitude. Her goal is to continue developing and supporting herself with her business. Nataliya has requested a loan of $500 to purchase a new supply of hats to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Born in 1960 in Kouve in the prefecture of Yoto, Mrs. Marie K. is married and the mother of two children. She also looks after one other person. She has a job selling general groceries that enables her to contribute to the household expenses, as her husband’s spare parts business is facing competition and poor sales. To meet customer demand, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan of $600 to build up a solid stock of merchandise so that she no longer runs out of anything and can increase her turnover.

Née en 1960 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto, Madame K. Marie est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants et une (1) personne à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage car son mari est confronté à la concurrence et à la mévente de ses pièces détachées. Pour être à la hauteur du marché, Madame K. Marie sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour faire un stock consistant de ses marchandises afin de mettre fin à la rupture de stock et accroître son chiffre d’affaire.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Stocking up on merchandise

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: With the hope of improving her family’s standard of living, Raisa entered the sphere of commerce seven years ago. During the last seven years as an entrepreneur, Raisa has been a client in good standing with Nadiya Ukraine. Nadiya’s loans have provided consistent support to Raisa as she has expanded her business. Currently, Raisa sells women’s garments at a kiosk in the local market of Melitopol, Ukraine. With the profits of her business, Raisa not only supports her family of four, but also her retired parents. She is lively and cheerful, hard-working and committed to the success of her business and the welfare of her family. Currently, Raisa is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase inventory for the summer season. Raisa hopes to thereby continue developing her business and successfully supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi G. was born in 1981 in Tchekpo (a prefecture of Yoto). She is married to Dewou and they have one child. Her daily activity is selling cereal. It is a flourishing business but requires a lot of money, something Mrs. G. does not have. Running out of stock so frequently puts her at a disadvantage, and her customers complain. She is asking for a loan of $600 to build up a more solid stock, which will satisfy all her customers and help her family.

Madame G. Ablavi épouse DEWOU est née en 1981 à Tchékpo (P/Yoto). Elle est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant. Son activité quotidienne est la vente des céréales. C’est un commerce très florissant mais qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens ; ce que Madame G. Ablavi ne possède pas. La fréquence de rupture de stock ne l’avantage pas et ses clients se plaignent. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour constituer un stock plus consistant afin de satisfaire toute sa clientèle et en faire profiter sa famille.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Cereal Stock

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo A. is 41 years. He has three wives and eleven children. His wives all work in agriculture but they don't earn much. He is a woodworker by trade and currently rents shop space, but high rent leaves him little income to meet his family's needs. Nonetheless, the family is happy. In order to provide for them better, Kodjo would like to outfit a shop of his own and to do so he is asking for a loan of $800 in hopes of saving on rent so his business and family can prosper.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 41 ans, Monsieur A. Kodjo est marié à trois femmes et est père de onze (11) enfants. Les femmes sont toutes cultivatrices à faible revenu. Menuisier de profession les frais de loyer de l’atelier lui reviennent très chers. Ce qui fait qu’après le paiement du loyer le reste de son revenu ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Mais cette situation n’empêche pas l’ambiance dans la famille. Pour remédier à sa désastreuse situation économique, il a décidé de construire son propre atelier. Faute de moyens, Il vient solliciter un crédit de $800. Ce qui lui permettra d’éviter les frais de loyer et de faire face aux besoins de la famille pour son épanouissement.

loans.use: To set up a woodworking shop.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Nine years ago, Tatyana opened a small footwear kiosk at one of the local markets in Melitopol, Ukraine. Married and a mother of two children, Tatyana hoped to increase her family’s standard of living and provide stable financial support to her children. During the past nine years, Tatyana has proven herself as a successful and hard-working entrepreneur. She is also a source of counsel and advice for new entrepreneurs in the market and is known widely for her decisive and determined nature. A veteran client of Nadezhda Ukraine, Tatyana has used her past loans wisely to expand her business, and has established a perfect credit history. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan of $500 to purchase more inventory. With the increased profits, Tatyana hopes to further expand her business and, eventually, assist her daughter in purchasing an apartment.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en: Nine years ago, Zinaida began her work as an entrepreneur in the markets of Melitopol, Ukraine. Her hope was to improve the standard of living for her family and to provide education to her two daughters. Over the past decade, Zinaida has successfully developed her own clothing business with the support of microfinance loans through Nadiya Ukraine. A committed and hardworking business woman, Zinaida has successfully repaid each loan. With the profits of her business, Zinaida has supported not only the education of her daughters, but also her aging parents. Currently, Zinaida is seeking a loan of US$400 to expand her inventory and increase the variety of products for sale. With the additional profits, Zinaida plans to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Vincent K. is 43 years old. He has four wives and thirteen children to care for. The wives all work alongside him in the fields, but without enough land the family has difficulty meeting it's needs, especially the cost of educating the children, so sadly, they live in poverty. In order to expand his arable land Vincent is seeking a loan of $700. He is a hard-working, dovoted and honest man who repaid his one previous loan promptly. This, his second loan, will help him improve his family's standard of living and provide for the children's education so they can get ahead in life.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 43 ans, Monsieur K. Vincent a quatre (04) femmes et treize (13) enfants à charge. Toutes les femmes l’aident dans les travaux champêtres. La superficie cultivable n’étant pas grande ne permet pas à Monsieur K. de satisfaire les besoins de la famille surtout la scolarisation de tous les enfants. Cette situation plonge la famille dans une misère totale. Pour remédier à cette situation, il a voulu augmenter la superficie de son espace cultivable. Faute de moyen, il sollicite un crédit de $700. Actif, dévoué et honnête, il avait reçu un premier qu’il a remboursé dans les meilleurs délais. Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et bien s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants afin de les voir un jour devenir des grands cadres.

loans.use: To expand his arable land.

loans.name: Komlavi Jacques

texts.fr:
Komlavi Jacques H. was born on December 1st, 1975 in Lomé (Golfe prefecture). He is trained in electronics repair but has trouble working because he does not have the means to rent a workshop. He works at home and his room is so small that he can’t keep his customer’s electronics in his house: this makes his customers wary of taking their appliances to him.

Komlavi Jacques H. is asking for a loan of $1000 to rent a suitable workshop and buy work tools. This loan will improve his quality of life.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer>

Monsieur H. Komlavi Jacques est né le 1er décembre 1975 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Electronicien de formation, il arrive difficilement à exercer parce qu’il n’a pas les moyens pour s’offrir un atelier. Il travaille à la maison et sa chambre est très restreinte qu’il n’arrive même pas à garder les appareils apportés par les clients pour réparation ; ce qui provoque une méfiance chez eux à amener leurs appareils.

Monsieur H. Komlavi Jacques sollicite alors un financement d’un montant de $1000 afin de pouvoir loyer un local convenable et acheter des outils de travail. Ceci améliorera sa condition de vie.

loans.use: To rent a workshop and buy new work tools

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan S. is 50 years old with six (6) children and supports two (2) other children. Her husband is retired and has a hard time meeting his family’s needs because his pension is small and he doesn’t receive it regularly. Thanks to her business selling kitchenware, she is able to support her family.

She is asking for a loan of $800 to expand her business because new kitchenware comes out every day and her business has to be up to date to attract customers.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans Madame S. Massan épse ADJADJIHOUE est mère de six (06) enfants et deux (2) enfants à sa charge. Son mari, un retraité arrive difficilement à honorer ses engagements familiaux car sa pension bien que maigre est très rare. Grâce à son commerce des ustensiles de cuisine et en plastique, Madame S. Massan arrive à supporter la famille.

Elle sollicite un financement d’une valeur de $800 pour augmenter la taille de son activité car tous les jours les nouveautés sortent et il faut être à la page pour attirer plus de clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina helps to support her family with a small business - she sells socks and women’s hosiery at a busy market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She and her husband, Michail, have two sons. Irina started her business ten years ago, about a year after her second son was born. The business has been an important source of income for the family. Currently, Irina makes around US$340 in net profit per month. Irina has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine and has been able to take out several loans that have helped with the development of her business. Her future plans include opening an additional sales location which would boost her income. Irina has requested a short-term loan of US$450 to help purchase additional inventory for her clothing retail business.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov’s small clothing sales business does more than just help provide for her and her husband Nicolai’s basic needs. It is helping Nicolai fight for his health in a battle with cancer. Much of the income that Lubov earns through her business is going to help pay for cancer treatment for Nicolai. Lubov is grateful for the success she has had in her business and for the money she is able to earn. She has been in the clothing business for ten years and currently maintains around US$1,600 worth of inventory. She makes about US$300 profit each month. Lubov has requested a loan of US$500 that will allow her to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Egnovi

texts.fr:
Egnovi A. was born in 1988 in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. She is an orphan and her husband is a young student who hasn’t finished his studies. She has almost finished her training as a seamstress and hopes to open a shop as soon as possible.

She doesn’t have the means to open a shop, so she is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a sewing machine and open a modern shop to attract more customers. This loan will improve her and her husband’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Egnovi est née en 1988 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Orpheline de père et de mère, son mari est un jeune étudiant qui n’a pas encore fin ses études. Madame A. Egnovi est presque à la fin de sa formation de couture et pense à ouvrir un atelier dans les plus bref délai.

N’ayant pas de moyens nécessaires, elle sollicite un financement de $600 pour s’acheter une machine à coudre et ouvrir un atelier très moderne afin d’attirer plus de clientèle. Ceci améliorera leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and open a sewing shop.

loans.name: Amos

texts.fr:
31 years old, Amos AGAWA is married to two women and father of five (05) children. His wives are both farmers with small incomes. As a mechanic, he is unable to repair all of the broken-down bikes his customers bring him because he doesn’t have the necessary tools to do his work. He is passionate about his work and very dedicated and has already received one loan that he paid back on time. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $400 to buy the necessary tools to expand his business. Once he has fulfilled this dream, he’ll be able to fix all sorts of motorcycle breakdowns and acquire more customers.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 31 ans, Monsieur A. Amos est marié à deux femmes et est père de cinq (05) enfants. Ses femmes sont toutes cultivatrices avec un maigre revenu. Mécanicien de profession, il n’arrive pas à réparer toutes les pannes sollicitées par ses clients car il n’a pas tous les outils nécessaires pour exercer son métier. Passionné par son métier et très dévoué, il avait reçu un premier crédit qu’il a su rembourser à temps. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de $400 pour l’achat des outils indispensables à l’évolution de son travail. Une fois ce rêve réalisé, il serait capable devant toutes sortes de pannes de motos ; ceci lui permettrait d’avoir plus de clients.

loans.use: Purchase of work tools

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya owns a profitable women’s clothing sales business at the busy Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having successfully run her business for the past ten years. Nataliya would like to expand her business and appreciates the financial assistance she has received from Nadiya Ukraine so far. One of her other business goals is to be able to generate sufficient income so that she can help her 23-year-old daughter pay her college tuition. Nataliya has therefore requested a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hrivna or US$1,000 to use as working capital to purchase additional clothing inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Tina Abla

texts.fr:
Born on April 10, 1959 in Ahépé in the Yoto prefecture, Tina Abla T. is married and the mother of four (4) children. She makes a living selling tomatoes and other condiments, but can't expand her business because of a lack of funds.

She has the mind of an entrepreneur and manages her business well. She is asking for a loan of $800 to enlarge her business and increase her income.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 10 avril 1959 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto, Madame T. Tina Abla est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Commerçante de tomate et autres condiments, elle n’avance toujours pas dans son activité par manque de fonds de commerce.

Elle a un esprit d’entreprenariat et douée d’une bonne gestion de ses activités. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter la taille de son activité en vue d’en tirer plus de revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of tomatoes and other condiments

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
Kodjovi A. is 41 years old, married, and father of seven children. His three wives are all farmers and are not able to help him support the family financially. Obliged to drop out of school after the eighth grade, he worked for many years making palm wine. Nowadays, he has opened a little store at Gapé Nyassivé. Since he is the single provider for his family, it is hard for him to make ends meet.

A dynamic and honest man, Mr. A. has already taken one loan which he used wisely and repaid in a timely fashion. He is now asking for a loan of $1200 to expand his inventory so that he can better satisfy his customers' needs. Given this loan, Mr. A. will be able to improve living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 41 ans, Monsieur A. Kodjovi est marié et est père de sept (07) enfants. Ses trois femmes sont toutes cultivatrices et n’arrivent pas à l’aider dans les charges de la famille. Abandonnant les études en quatrième, il a longtemps fait les travaux de distillation de vin de palme. De nos jours, il a lui-même installé une boutique à Gapé Nyassivé. Faisant tout seul face aux besoins de la famille, c’est difficilement qu’il arrive à joindre les deux bouts.

Dynamique et honnête, il a reçu un premier crédit qu’il a bien géré et a bien remboursé. Il sollicite à présent un nouveau crédit de $1200 pour l’achat d’autres articles divers afin de satisfaire tous les besoins de la clientèle. Ainsi Monsieur A. pourra améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de la famille.

loans.use: expand the inventory of his general store

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
As she was unable to afford school fees, Miss Afi G., 23, had to abandon her studies and learned sewing instead. Her mother's income does not permit her to purchase a sewing machine. Her father is an unemployed cook who also cannot help his daughter financially.

Having now reached the end of her training, Miss G. is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine and set herself up in business. This will allow her to earn her own living and be financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 23 ans, Mlle G. Afi a du abandonner ses études fautes de moyens financiers pour apprendre la couture. Les revenus de l’activité de sa mère ne lui permet pas d’acheter une machine et son père un cuisiner sans emploi n’a pas les moyens nécessaires.

A la fin de sa formation, Mlle G. Afi sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour s’acheter une machine à coudre afin de s’installer. Ceci lui permettra de faire face à ses dépenses et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and opening of a tailor shop

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou S., 34, is married and mother of 8 children. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi and can barely support the family, so she is obliged to help him earn a large part of their living expenses. After primary school, she was a servant for two years in a close relative's household. Now she has started a business making palm oil, an undertaking that demands lots of courage, patience, and also capital.

A generous and trustworthy woman, Mrs. S. has already received a first loan which she was able to repay without difficulty. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 so that she can buy palm nuts where they are grown at a lower cost and thus greatly improve her profit margin. This will allow her to meet the financial needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 34 ans, Madame S. Akou est mariée et est mère de huit (08) enfants. Son mari conducteur de taxi moto arrive péniblement à supporter les charges de la famille. Donc, elle est obligée d’en contribuer en grande partie. Niveau primaire, elle fut domestique pendant deux ans chez un proche parent. Et aujourd’hui elle s’est initiée à la préparation de l’huile de palme qui nécessite beaucoup de courage, de patience et de moyens.

Femme généreuse et de bonne foi, elle avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit, qu’elle a remboursé sans difficulté. Encore une fois, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner des noix de palme dans les zones de production à moindre coût afin d’en tirer d’énormes profits. Ainsi elle pourra s’occuper financièrement de sa famille.

loans.use: manufacture and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Eya T., 37, is married and mother of 6 children. Her husband does not earn much income, which means that she is heavily burdened with responsibility for her family and has a hard time managing. Mrs. T. has specialized in the production of palm oil, but she has a very hard time because this work requires a lot of physical effort. In order to make her work easier and also earn more income from it, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a machine. Her difficult life does not prevent her from making her family happy since that atmosphere is necessary for her children to thrive.

Serious and good at managing her business, Mrs. T. has already received one loan which she was able to repay without difficulty. Once she has been able to purchase this machine, she will be able to produce more oil and thus maximize her profit. This in turn will improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 37 ans, Madame T. Eya est mariée et est mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari malafoutier a un maigre revenu. Ce qui fait qu’elle a une lourde responsabilité et n’arrive pas à s’en sortir. Spécialisée dans la préparation de l’huile de palme, elle éprouve d’énormes difficultés car le travail nécessite beaucoup d’efforts physiques. Pour exercer moins d’effort mais avoir un meilleur rendement, elle sollicite un crédit $1000 pour l’achat d’une machine. Cette misère ne l’empêche pas de rendre sa famille heureuse car les enfants en ont besoin pour leur épanouissement.

Dotée d’une bonne moralité et ayant la capacité d’une bonne gérance, elle avait obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a su remboursé sans difficulté. Cette machine une fois achetée lui permettra d’avoir un rendement meilleur qui maximisera son profit. Ce qui améliorera les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: purchase of a machine for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Jacqueline K. was born on Feb. 2, 1982 in Lomé (Togo). She is married and mother of one child. Her husband is a carpenter who does not have the financial means to make his business prosper. Mrs. K. is an apprentice dressmaker and has almost reached the end of her training period.

In order to set herself up in business as quickly as possible, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine and other necessities for a dressmaking shop. This will permit her to be financially independent and also contribute to household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Jacqueline est née le 02 février 1982 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Elle est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant. Son mari, un menuisier n’a pas les moyens suffisants pour faire prospérer son métier. Madame K. Jacqueline est apprentie couturière et est presque à la fin de sa formation.

Afin d’ouvrir un atelier très vite, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter une machine à coudre, et les nécessaires pour un atelier de couture. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière et contribuer aussi aux dépenses du foyer.

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and opening of a dressmaker's shop

loans.name: Dodo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dodo K. was born in 1968 in Lomé, in the Gulf prefecture of Togo. She is married and mother of one child; she is also responsible for two other people. She sells used refrigerators and freezers, etc. to people in her part of town. Her husband is abroad, leaving her financially responsible for the family.

Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of $1000 so that she can buy her products directly at the port and satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Dodo est née en 1968 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant et deux (2) personnes à sa charge. Elle fait le commerce des réfrigérateurs et des congélateurs d’occasion dans son quartier. Son mari qui est à l’étranger ce qui fait que toutes les charges se reposent sur elle.

Elle sollicite un apport financier de $1000 pour s’approvisionner elle-même au port et satisfaire les demandes du marché.

loans.use: selling appliances

loans.name: Sowassin

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sowassin G., 41, is married and mother of 3 children. Her husband used to be a civil servant but is presently unemployed. For this reason, Mrs. G. has become the sole breadwinner of the family. It is hard for her to manage this from the proceeds of her little cloth shop. Although she finds herself in a precarious financial situation, she does all she can to guarantee the happiness of her family.

A serious and responsible woman, Mrs. G. has already reimbursed one loan without problem. Now, in order to be able to buy from wholesalers, she is asking for a loan of $800. Buying at wholesale prices will allow her to greatly increase the profit she makes from her business, thus improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 41 ans, Madame G. Sowassin est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari fut dans le temps fonctionnaire d’Etat mais est actuellement en chômage. Toutes les charges du ménage incombent automatiquement la responsabilité de Madame G. Sowassin. Cette responsabilité qu’elle arrive difficilement à assumer avec son petit commerce de tissu. Malgré qu’elle soit dans une situation financièrement précaire, elle met tout en œuvre pour que sa famille soit heureuse.

Femme sérieuse et responsable, elle a obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a remboursé sans inquiétude. Aujourd’hui pour développer son commerce en achetant en gros chez les grossistes, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Ce politique d’achat va lui permettre de réaliser un profit énorme ; source de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: purchase of cloth for her inventory at wholesale prices

loans.name: Anassi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Anassi N. was born in 1969 in Lomé (Togo). She is married and mother of 5 children. Her palm oil and smoked fish business allows her to contribute to the family's living expenses. Her business is flourishing but it does require a certain amount of capital.

In view of the demands of her clientele, she is asking for a loan of $600 with which she will procure larger quantities of oil and fish and also add condiments to her inventory. This will permit her to increase her profit and better cater for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame N. Anassi est née en 1969 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son commerce d’huile de palme et de poissons fumés l’aide à contribuer aux charges du ménage. C’est une activité florissante mais qui nécessite assez de moyen.

Devant l’exigence de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour s’approvisionner en quantité d’huile et de poissons et ajouter d’autres condiments nécessaires à la cuisine. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling palm oil and smoked fish

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
At 23, Mr. Gilbert G. is a bachelor and has no children. Having left formal schooling after the eighth grade, he began selling hardware and cement at an early age. He is responsible for two of his older brother's children who help him in his business.

Mr. G. has always been trustworthy in reimbursing each loan he has taken out. Very ambitious and hard-working, he now intends to expand his business by selling wholesale to smaller retailers. This necessitates a certain amount of capital, of course, so he is again requesting a loan, this time of $1200. This will allow him to get a maximum of profit from his enterprise and increase his sense of satisfaction.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 23 ans, Monsieur G. Gilbert est célibataire sans enfant. Avec un niveau d'instruction du cours secondaire (4ème), il s’est très tôt lancé dans le commerce de quincaillerie et de ciment. Il a à sa charge, deux enfants de son grand frère qui l’aide dans ses activités.

Monsieur G. a toujours fait preuve de bonne fidélité dans les remboursements des crédits antérieurs qu’il avait bénéficiés. Très ambitieux et dévoué il a l’intention d’agrandir son commerce en vendant en gros aux petits détaillants. Ce qui nécessite des moyens financiers. Il vient encore une fois solliciter un crédit de $1200. Ceci lui permettra de dégager un profit maximum pour son plein épanouissement.

loans.use: expand his hardware business by selling wholesale to smaller retailers

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agossi A., age 37, is married to a farmer with whom she had seven (07) children. Their very limited earnings do not meet the needs of the family. Her meager income is due to the sale of only one type of fish. The family's precarious situation prevents the schooling of the children.

To improve her commercial situation, she had obtained a loan which she was able to pay back in time. At present, in order to go herself to Ghana to buy different types of fish, she requests once again a loan of $400. The profit drawn will be used for schooling the children which is her major concern.

Translated from French by Stephane Mortier , Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 37 ans, Madame A. Agossi est mariée à un cultivateur avec qui elle a eu sept (07) enfants. Leurs revenus très insuffisants ne couvrent pas les besoins de la famille. La vente d’un seul type de poisson justifie la faiblesse de son revenu. Cette situation très précaire de la famille empêche la scolarisation des enfants.

Pour améliorer sa situation commerciale, elle avait obtenu un crédit qu’elle a su remboursé à temps. A présent, pour aller elle-même au Ghana acheter les différents types de poissons, elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $400.
