Le profit tiré servira à la scolarisation des enfants qui est son souci majeur.

loans.use: Commerce in fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of her clothing business

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A. is 35 years old and married with nine children. Her husband is a farmer and she sells medicinal ointments but their meager income can't meet the needs of the family. She has a long track record as a reliable borrower. At this time she hopes to boost sales and seeks a loan of $800 to go to Loma and purchase in bulk the materials she uses to concoct her ointments--camphor, wax, oils, etc--saving money and increasing her profit. Abra's dream is to free the family of budget worries and provide for the children's education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 35 ans Madame A. Abra est mariée et est mère de neuf (09) enfants. Vendeuse de pommade salcylées, son mari est un agriculteur. Leurs revenus très maigres ne couvrent pas les besoins de la famille. Très ancienne dans l’obtention de crédit, elle a toujours fait preuve de bonne fidélité. Dans le souci de développer son commerce, elle sollicite encore, un crédit de $800 pour l’achat des produits de fabrication (kanfor, bougies, huile de brésite) en gros à Lomé afin de dégager un profit maximum. Elle a voulu par cette idée épargner la famille des soucis financiers tout en s’occupant mieux de la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To buy bulk materials for mixing ointments.

loans.name: Martina

texts.fr:
Martina S. is a 42-year-old widow with four children to care for. Life has been very hard since the loss of her husband. A taro farmer, she has difficulty making ends meet for the family. Though illiterate, she is ambitious and has good business sense, caring for her crops with an eye for profit in order to meet the family's needs. Without other resources, Martina is asking for a loan of $800 in order to improve her fields. If she can, it will have a great impact on the family's socio-economic status.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 42 ans Madame S. Martina est veuve avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. Cette disparition du mari cause des problèmes dans la famille et elle en souffre énormément. Cultivatrice de taro, elle arrive difficilement à satisfaire les besoins des quatre enfants que lui a laissés le mari. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle entretient très bien ses cultures pour un meilleur rendement afin de dégager un profit maximum. Ce profit maximisé lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Très ambitieuse, elle a l’idée de moderniser son champ. Mais faute de moyen, elle vient solliciter un crédit de $800. Cette idée réalisée, changera favorablement le niveau de vie socio-économique de la famille.

loans.use: To expand and improve an arable plot.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A. is 39, married and the mother of six. The whole family works in the fields, but their land yields little on account of it's low fertility. As a result, the family is suffering economic hardship and the children have had to drop out of school. Abra needs to fertilize her land, but she lacks funds to purchase fertilizer or manure. She is a hard-working, honest and devoted woman who promptly repaid her one previous loan. At this time she is asking for a loan of $750 to purchase fertilizer so her family can escape poverty and the children can return to school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 39 ans, Madame A. Abra est mariée et est mère de six (06) enfants. Tous cultivateurs, leurs rendements sont de nos jours très faibles à cause de l’infertilité du sol. La situation devenant difficile pour la famille, les enfants ont du abandonner les études. Madame A. Abra décide de fertiliser le sol en achetant des engrais mais ses moyens sont très limités pour cette réalisation. Travailleuse, dévouée et honnête, elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Elle vient solliciter un crédit de $750 pour l’achat des engrais. Ceci lui permettra de sortir la famille de la misère et les enfants pourront reprendre leurs études.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina is 24 years old. After graduating from school she started sewing and selling national Tajik robes. Her mother helped her in this business. Two and a half years ago she came to Microinvest and received her first loan, which allowed her to develop the business. Gradually, she moved to another type of business, and began selling men's clothes. She rented a small store for this purpose. Now her mother regularly sells in her place (in the photo). Zarrina brings the goods and then goes to work in a sewing shop, where she still sews men's robes and national Tajik dresses. She wants to get a loan for the development of her business.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Mr Cesar is 45 years old. He is married and lives in a small house with his wife and two children, the oldest is 10 and the youngest 7. His children attend school, and Cesar is proud of them for enjoying it. He hopes that his children can continue studying, especially since he did not have this opportunity.

Cesar produces and sells milk. For 15 years, he has owned cows. At this time, he raises four with the help of his wife. Previously, he worked in Argentina as a construction worker, and after several years of saving he managed to return home. At first, he purchased 2 dairy cows, but once business began to grow, due largely to production, he purchased two more cows.

Right now, Cesar owns four cows, and business is doing well. He supplies various businesses in the city. About a month ago he started working as a supplier to an important business that demands a large amount of milk every day. In order to provide to all his clients he is aksing a loan to purchase one more cow. The 600 dollar loan would allow him to acquire a cow and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. César tiene 45 años; es casado, vive en una pequeña casa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el mayor de 10 años y el menor de 7 años. Sus hijos van a una pequeña escuela en el campo, César nos cuenta de que esta muy orgulloso de sus hijos pues les gusta estudiar, el desea que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad en la vida.

César se dedica a la producción y venta de leche; tiene cuatro vacas que ordeña con la ayuda de su esposa desde hace 15 años; anteriormente estuvo trabajando en la Argentina como empleado en una construcción y tras varios años de ahorro pudo volver a su país; en principio compro 2 vacas lecheras y a medida que el negocio fue ampliándose y gracias a su buena producción adquirió 2 vacas más.

Hoy día César cuenta con 4 vacas, y el negocio marcha muy bien; es proveedor de varios negocios de la ciudad; hace un mes empezó a trabajar como proveedor de una importante empresa que le demanda una buena cantidad de leche todos los días, para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes el está pensando en adquirir una vaca más, para ello necesita un préstamo de $ 600 con los que adquirirá la vaca y aumentará su producción.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en: Musharaf is 47 years old, and is married with three children. She and her husband work on a kol-hoz (farm) as simple farmers. The money they earn is not enough for a normal life and they have to raise and sell livestock as well. Her husband buys the livestock, and Musharaf and the children look after them at home. A year ago, Musharaf came to Microinvest and got her first loan, and she added her own money to buy goby and provender. The profit she received she put into the purchase of new gobies. The income from raising livestock allows her family to buy better food, and buy necessary things for home. Now Musharaf is asking for $1000 to increase the amount of livestock.

loans.use: To increase the amount of livestock

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Born in 1955, Afi S. is the mother of eight. She has run a small shop since she was young and knows the grocery business well. She works hard to satisfy her many customers' demands. Her village is growing and with it, her customer base. As a result, she is stretched to meet demand and so she is asking for a loan of $800 to stock up on merchandise. In doing so she will be able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1955, Madame S. Afi est mère d'une famille de hui (08) enfants. La vente des produits divers est son activité. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis son jeune âge. Avec cette expérience, elle métrise bien l'activité. Sollicitée par de nombreux consommateurs locaux, Madame S. Afi réussit toujours à satisfaire les demandes grâce à son savoir faire et à son dynamisme. Aujoud'hui, son village s'étend et les consommateurs augmentent en nombre. Par conséquent, la demande actuelle dépasse ses capacité. A cet effet, elle saisit cette opportunité pour renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui permettra de s'approvisionner en nécessaires consommables afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d'assurer les besoins de sa famille surtout ceux d'ordre vital.

loans.use: To purchase various groceries for resale.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Ms Graciela is 42 years old and married. She lives with her 39-year-old husband who works at an agency called Paraguay Turismo, both contributing to the family's income. They have two children, one 8 years old and the other 12, who attend a public elementary school in the city.

For more than 10 years Graciela has owned a bakery. She inherited the business from her parents and maintained the excellent quality for many years. Because of this, she can compete with the market, which is every day more competitive in this area. The demand for her bakery items has increased, and to keep up with production demands, Graciela asks for a loan of 600 dollars to purchase an electric mixer.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Graciela tiene 42 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo de 39 años quien trabaja como empleado de una Empresa llamada Paraguay Turismo y ambos aportan con los ingresos familiares. Tienen dos hijos, uno de 8 años y el otro de 12 años, ambos en la cursan la primaria en una escuela pública de la ciudad.

Graciela es dueña de una panadería hace más de 10 años, el negocio lo heredó de sus padres, comenta que el producto mantiene una excelente calidad desde hace varios años, gracias a eso puede competir en el mercado, que cada vez es más competitivo en este rubro. La demanda de sus panificados han aumentado y para mantener un ritmo adecuado de producción, Graciela necesita adquirir una amasadora eléctrica cuyo costo es de $ 600 y por lo cual ella hoy está solicitando el crédito.

loans.use: To purchase an electric mixer

loans.name: Tursunboy

texts.en: Tursunboy is 57 years and has 2 children. His son left to earn money for Russia and his wife with child live with Tursunboy. His son sends some money, but it is so few and that's why they live on Tursunboy's provision. Tursunboy's wife has invalid and is constantly ill. But, in spite of it Tursunboy and his wife regularly go to the market and trade. They have two trading points in the market. Profit from theur business is enough for life, also they both receive a pension, but not big. 1,5 years ago Tursunboy received his first loan and  significantly expanded his business. Gradually by getting new loans he expanded the assortment and quantity of goods. Now he wants to get next loan for the further expansion of his business.

loans.use: for the further expansion of his business

loans.name: Sowlamélé

texts.fr:
Sowlamélé S. was born in 1960 and is the mother of nine. Despite her age, she still works making coconut oil, a trade she learned from her mother at a young age. With her thirty years of experience, she has earned a reputation for the special way she makes oil and customers seek out her oil especially. Faced with such demand, she needs money to purchase more coconuts and so she is asking for a loan of $800. In boosting production, she will keep her customers satisfied and provide for the needs of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madame S. Sowlamélé est née en 1960. Aujourd'hui, elle est mère de neuf (9) enfants. Bien que âgée, la production de l'huile de coco reste son activité. Ce métier, elle l'a hérité de sa mère depuis son jeune âge. Plus de 30 ans déjà, elle possède une expérience qui lui permet de préparer autrement son huile et attirer plus de clientèle. Très compétitive sur le marché, l'huile de coco de Madame S. est très sollicitée par les consommateurs. Vu le niveau toujours croissante de la demande, elle nécessite des fonds pour acheter assez de coco. Pour cela, Madame S. sollicite un fonds de $800 produire plus d'huile afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi, parviendra elle à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy coconuts used to make oil.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Yaovi S. was born in 1967 in Tannou (Togo), where he presently lives. He is married and father of six children. Yaovi has been given the nickname Agbléga because he is passionate about farming. He specializes in growing grains such as corn (maize) and millet. His devotion and serious work make him an exemplary farmer whose yields are often good. Because the nutrients in his soil are slowly becoming expended, however, his yields have been dropping although the demand for his crops continues to rise.

In order to revitalize his land and grow more plentiful crops, Yaovi S. is requesting a loan of $ 800. With that sum, he intends to buy fertilizer. His success in this endeavor will help him to cater for the day-to-day needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur S. Yaovi est né en 1967 à Tannou où il vit actuellement. Il est marié et père de six (6) enfants. Surnomé « Agbléga » à cause de sa passion pour l'agriculture, il est spécialiste dans la production des céréales comme le maïs et le mil. Son dévouément et le sérieux qu'il met dans son travail font de lui un agriculteur exemplaire qui a souvent de bons rendements. Ces rendements commencent par diminuer d'année en année à cause de l'épuisement du sol cultivable alors que les besoins alimentaires ne cessent de s'accroître.

Pour redynamiser son agriculture à travers le renforcement de la capacité de ses terres à produire, Monsieur S. Yaovi sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des fertilisants. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra de bien subvenir aux besoins vitaux de sa famille.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase his yield

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi A., 47 years old, is married and mother of 10 children. Her principle business venture is the production and sale of manioc flour. Thanks to the income from this business, she is able to pay her children's school fees as well as providing other financial support for her family. A dynamic woman, Afi never rests on her laurels and is always concerned about growing her business.

Afi is presently low on capital and so is asking for a loan of $ 400. With this money she intends to buy lots of manioc roots that she can make into products such as flour and tapioca. The sale of these products will enable her to get more profit from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 47 ans, Madame A. Afi est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Son activité principale est la production et la vente de farine de manioc. C'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle arrive à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et à participer aux charges de son ménage. Pleine de dynamisme, elle ne dort jamais sous ses lauriers et est toujours soucieuse de l'évolution de son activité.

Ajourd'hui, elle est en déficit financier et sollicite un crédit de $400 afin de pouvoir acheter beaucoup de maniocs qu'elle aura à transformer en divers produits comme garie et tapioca. La vente de ces produits lui permettra d'améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of manioc roots to process into flour

loans.name: Akouéba Amono

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akouéba Amono D. is 57 years old, married and mother of eight children. For the past 20 years, she has been making her living raising sheep. The sale of these sheep for special occasions, especially for Muslim feast days, brings in the income she needs to help support her family. She is aware, however, that soon her business will not provide enough income to cater for their most basic needs. Blessed with an entrepreneurial spirit, she would like to enlarge her flock by purchasing some carefully selected lambs. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $ 600.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 57 ans, Madame D. Akouéba Amono est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants. Elle survit grâce à son élevage de moutons, activité qu'elle exerce depuis 20 ans. La vente de ces moutons en période de fêtes surtout musulmanes lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de participer aux charges de son foyer. Mais au vu de ses prévisions et de l'augmentation de ses besoins, elle se rend à l'évidence que d'ici peu, son activité ne suffira plus pour satisfaire les besoins les plus fondamentaux. Très entreprenante, elle compte élargir son troupeau avec l'achat des agneaux sélectionnés. Pour cela, elle demande un apport financier de $600.

loans.use: expand her flock of sheep

loans.name: Sédalo

texts.fr:
Born in 1966, Mr. Sédalo A. is married and father of five children. He makes his living farming and raising animals. Where he lives, raising pigs is very profitable since pork is much in demand. It is this animal husbandry that provides Mr. A.'s family's living. Until now, he has been engaging in traditional methods, that is, allowing his pigs free range although some of them run away. He would like to modernize his undertaking by constructing a fenced enclosure and also purchase additional pigs. For that reason, he is asking for a loan of $1000. The success of this endeavor will bring him a considerable increase in income, likely to improve the living conditions for his whole family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1966, Monsieur A. Sédalo est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il vit à l'aide de l'agriculture et de l'élevage. Il faut noter que dans cette zone, l'élevage de porcs est très rentable de par la consommation accrue de la population. C'est cet élevage qui soutient l'économie familiale de Monsieur A.. Jusqu'ici, c'est une activité qu'il exerce de façon traditionnelle avec la fuite de certains porcs par moment. Pour palier à ce problème, il a un projet de modernisation de son activité en construisant un cadre acceptable pour ses porcs et en multipliant le nombre. C'est ainsi qu'il fait une demande de crédit de $1000. La réalisation de ce projet lui procurera un revenu considérable susceptible de relever le niveau de vie de toute la famille.

loans.use: building a new fenced enclosure for his animals

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Mr Teodoro is 51 years old and widowed. He has two daughters, one is a teacher and the other a nurse. Both his daughters are single and live in their own house adjoined to their father's. They contribute to the family's income and help their father. He has always been their greatest supporter, and his efforts have allowed them to complete their studies.

For more than 20 years Mr Teodora has worked at a body shop, painting and repairing vehicles. He owns his own body shop, which he inherited from his father and is located 12 kilometers from the city of Paraguari, Escobar. He travels every day from his shop, where his great work has attracted many clients. Some weeks ago his electric solder stopped working. He needs to acquire a new one so that he can resume his work. A new electric soldering machine costs 200 dollars, and for this reason he asks for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Teodoro tiene 51 años, es viudo, tienen dos hijas una es docente y la otra es enfermera, ambas aún solteras, viven en una casa propia junto con su padre; ellas aportan con los ingresos de la familia y ayudan a su padre, pues el siempre fue el mayor apoyo de ellas y gracias al trabajo de su padre pudieron culminar sus estudios

El Sr. Teodoro se dedica hace ya más de 20 años a la pintura y chapería de vehículos, tiene un taller propio que heredo de su padre y que queda a 12 Km de la ciudad de Paraguarí, en una ciudad llamada Escobar. Viaja todos los días hasta su taller, donde gracias a su buen trabajo posee muchos clientes; hace unas semanas su soldador eléctrico se descompuso y no tiene solución, por ello necesita adquirir uno nuevo, que le permita reanudar sus trabajos que quedaron pendientes a causa de esto; un soldador nuevo cuesta $ 200, por ello el solicita un crédito que se compromete a devolverlo mensualmente.

loans.use: To purchase an electric soldering machine

loans.name: Agbo-Komi

texts.fr:
Born in 1978 in Amégnran (VO Prefecture, Togo), Mr. Agbo-Komi B. still lives in that same village and does motorcycle repair there. He is married and father of two, as well as being responsible for nephews, cousins, and nieces. It is the income from his motorcycle repair work that supports him and his extended family. The quality of this dynamic gentleman's work had earned him a large clientele, however, when his repair shop was devastated by a storm, his income dropped considerably as his clientele dispersed. In order to reestablish himself and regain his client base, he is asking for a loan of $1200 to outfit a new workshop. He is confident that this entreprise will be very remunerative since he will be able to win back his old clients and new ones as well.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1978 à Amégnran (Préfecture de VO), Monsieur B. Agbo-Komi vit dans le même village et exerce son activité de mécanique moto. Marié et père de deux (2) et à sa charge d'autres neveux, cousins et nièces. C'est à l'aide de cette activité qu'il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Très dymanique, la qualité de ses prestations lui a vallu une clientèle importante. Mais depuis que son atelier est ravagé par un orage, son revenu a considérablement chuté à cause de la dispersion de la clientèle. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de cette clientèle, il sollicite un apport financier de $1200 pour remonter un nouvel atelier et l'équiper. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il va récupérer ses clients et d'autres encore.

loans.use: open and equip a new repair shop

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Ms Julieta lives in an anticretico (a legal contract with the owner of the property to live in one, two, or more dwellings for a period of time no greater than two years for a determined sum payed in advance and refunded at the the end of the agreement). She lives here with her husband and children on calle Bolivar in the Ernesto Torrez zone in the city of Paz.

Ms Julieta sells American clothing, such as sweaters, pants, etc., at the Thursday and Sunday markets in the 16th of July zone in the city of El Alto. She asks for a loan to increase her merchandise, and thus, increase her revenue, especially since sales are very good at these fairs.

Her past history with Impro shows that in March of this year she took a first loan of 100 dollars and payed it off. This qualifies her as a responsible client and one who can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Julieta vive en anticretico (es un contrato legal con el dueño de casa para vivir en una, dos o mas habitaciones por un periodo de tiempo no mayor a dos años por un monto determinado pagado por anticipado y sujeto a devolución al cabo del tiempo acordado) con su esposo e hijos en la calle Bolívar de la zona Ernesto Torrez de la Ciudad de La Paz.

La actividad que ella tiene es la venta de ropa americana, como ser chompas, pantalones, etc. los días jueves y domingos en la zona 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto en las ferias que se instalan dichos días. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, en vista de que la venta es muy buena en dichas ferias.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro muestra que ella ya accedió a un primer préstamo por $100 en marzo de este año y a la fecha esta completamente pagado. Esto la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
At 68 years of age, Mrs. Agossi Z. has four (4) children. She has run a mat business for more than 20 years. These years of experience have given her a mastery of her profession, which allows her to meet her needs. However, her financial means are not enough for her to increase her turnover. The small income she obtains goes directly to the household expenses.

To provide herself with better means, she is asking for a loan of $850 to stockpile mats. The resale of these mats will allow her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

A 68 ans, Madame Z. Agossi est mère de quatre (4) personnes. C'est une dame qui exerce le commerce de natte depuis plus de 20 ans. Ces années d'expérience lui ont donné une maîtrise de son activité qui lui permet de supporter les charges. Cependant, les moyens financiers lui font défaut pour rehausser son chiffre d'affaire. Le petit revenu qu'elle réalise rentrant directement dans la consommation du ménage.

Pour se donner les moyens, elle sollicite un apport financier de $850 pour faire un stockage de nattes. La revente lui permettra d'augmenter son revenu financier et portant améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and re-sell mats

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Ms Nelly lives in her own house with her husband and children on calle Adrian Patino in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. Her husband is a professor. Nelly sells all types of shoes, such as boots, cleats, sneakers, etc., in the 16th of July zone, a large commercial area in the city of El Alto. Nelly employs a saleswoman who helps her when she travels to purchase more merchandise. The loan she asks for is to purchase more merchandise now that she has to travel more and spend more on fares when she has very little capital, all of which diminishes her income.

Nelly asks for a loan to improve the variety of her merchandise so as to not lose clients and increase her revenue. Her previous history with Impro shows that in March of this year she accepted a loan in the amount of 100 dollars and payed it off. This qualifies her as a responsible client with a good record and one who can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Nelly vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Adrián Patiño de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo es profesor. La actividad que Nelly realiza es la venta de calzados de todo tipo, como ser botas, botines, tenis shoes, etc. en la ciudad de El Alto, zona 16 de julio, un lugar muy comercial. Nelly tiene a una vendedora que le ayuda cuando ella viaja a comprar más mercadería.

El crédito que solicita es para poder traer mas mercadería ya que con el poco capital que trabaja ella tiene que viajar mas veces y gasta en pasajes de ida y vuelta, lo que disminuye sus ingresos. Nelly necesita este préstamo para tener una mejor variedad de mercadería, no perder clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico con Impro muestra que Nelly accedió a un crédito por $100 en Marzo del presente año y a la fecha esta completamente pagado. Esto la califica como buen cliente con buen record de pagos y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Client wants to pay off the loan in advance. Nelly will be applying for another loan very soon.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo is an artisan specializing in leather. He makes medium-quality soccer balls, the same that are marketed in the fairs in the city of El Alto. He has eight children, all of which are independent. He works to support himself and his wife. They live in the Villa Dolores zone of the city of El Alto.

He asks for a loan to perchase high-quality material (leather) to increase his revenue. This is his twelfth credit. His good payment history on his previous eleven loans permits him to access another loan without any objection.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirilo es artesano en cuero de res y elabora balones de fútbol de mediana calidad, mismos que son comercializados en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene ocho hijos todos independientes. El trabaja para poder mantener a su esposa y a él mismo. Vive en la Zona de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra materia prima (cuero de res) para incrementar su ingresos. Es el crédito numero doce; su buen historial de pago de los once créditos previos le permite acceder a otro préstamo sin ninguna objeción.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality material

payments.comment: Early payoff. Cirilo is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Mégbégna Valerie

texts.fr:
Born in 1955 in Afagnan-Aglbéta (Prefecture Lacs), Mrs. Mégbégna Valerie S. lives in Aného. Having lost her husband 1 year ago, she has been left alone in charge of a family composed of eight (8) people, of which three are her children. Very dedicated and full of initiative, she set up a small display of general food products which she manages meticulously. However, her display is open-air and she is obliged to take her merchandise inside at nightfall and during rainy weather. To overcome this problem, she would like to achieve stability by building a kiosk to protect her display. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $1200 to realize this project and replenish her store. This will allow her to increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1955 à Afagnan-Agbléta (P/Lacs), Madame S. Mégbégna Valerie réside à Aného. Ayant perdu son mari depuis plus 1 an, elle est devenue seule à prendre en charge la famille composée de huit (8) personnes dont trois de ses enfants. Très dévouée et pleine d'initiatives, elle s'est consituée un étalage d'alimentation générale qu'elle gère de façon minutieuse. Cependant, son étallage est à ciel ouvert et elle est obligée de faire rentrer ses marchandises à la tombée de la nuit et face à la pluie. Pour pallier à ces probèmes, elle veut avoir une stabilité en construisant un kiosque qui abritera son étalage. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour réaliser ce projet et ravitailler la boutique en marchandises. Ceci lui permettra d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et d'améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To build a kiosk to display her wares

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Aged 39, Mrs. Amivi S. currently lives in Afagnan with her entire family. She is married and has four (4) children. She is a woman who greatly helps her husband with the daily household expenses through her revenue-generating business, which consists of selling fried fish. To increase her income, she wanted to plan a fixed point where all her customers can come supply themselves. Also, to avoid stock shortages, she wants to buy a freezer in order to preserve fish. After having estimated this project to cost $1200, she is asking for a loan for its realization. She intends to obtain substantial income capable of changing her way of life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 39, Madame S. Amivi réside actuellement à Afagnan avec toute sa famille. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. C'est une femme qui aide énormément son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de leur ménage de par son activité génératrice de revenu qui consiste à vendre du poisson frit. Pour augmenter son revenu, elle a voulu aménager un point de vente fixe où toute sa clientèle viendra s'approvisionner. Aussi pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle veut acheter un congélateur afin de pouvoir conserver les poissons. Après avoir estimé ce projet à $1200, elle sollicite un crédit pour sa réalisation. Elle compte dégager de revenus substantiels susceptible de changer son mode et son cadre de vie.

loans.use: To buy a freezer in order to preserve fish

loans.name: Wangang

texts.en:
G. is married and has seven children. His father died when he was a young boy. The death of his father deprived him of education as he had no one to support him. This memories coupled with the hardship he faced when he was sick are reasons he wants to earn and provide for his children.  He joined GHAPE in 2006 and took his first loan that same year. He succeeded in repaying the loan completely. He also provided excellent umbrella repair services to his community. Umbrellas are used during the rainy season which lasts from March to October. During the dry season the burning sunshine also calls for the use of umbrellas.

G. plans to increase his stock by buying needles, threat, spokes, handles and tarpaulin. This investment shall provide the community with shades (umbrellas) during the rainy season and the damaging sun rays.  He plans to repay his loan in 15 months, the first repayment installment  commencing at the end of the first month after disbursement.

loans.use: Repairing Umbrella

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ms Angela is 59 years old and married. She lives in her own house with her husband who is an auto repairman and works independently from his own shop. They have three children, all old enough to work independently and contribute to the family's income.

Angela owns a localized eatery in the municipal market of Paraguari. She has 26 years of experience in this field, and her business is one of the oldest at the market. Her business goes very well. However, the infrastructure of her home is deteriorating. She hopes that by fixing her home she can improve its appearance and physical space. For this, she asks for a loan of 275 dollars to invest in the renovation of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ángela tiene 59 años D. edad, es casada, vive en una casa propia con su esposo, el es chapista D. autos y trabaja D. forma independiente en su propio taller. Tienen 3 hijos, todos ya mayores que trabajan D. forma independiente y aportan con los ingresos D. la familia.

Ángela es dueña D. un comedor ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Paraguarí; cuenta con 26 años D. antigüedad en el ramo y es uno D. los negocios más antiguos del mercado. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pero la infraestructura D. su local está muy deteriorada por lo que ella desea mejorarlo para tener así una mejor apariencia y espacio físico; para ello, necesita un crédito D. $ 275 que lo invertirá en la mejora del local.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Tamunang

texts.en:
Papa A. is married and has six children. Frequently challenged by sickness, he is determined to work and earn in order to provide for the basic medical needs of his family. In 2006 he took his first loan. He succeeded in repaying it, one hundred percent. He provided his community with palm-wine. Palm wine is sap from palm-tree. It is sweet when it is newly tapped. When fermentation takes place it becomes strong and tastes like beer.  Palm-wine bars are venues where mostly men meet to share breaking news items.

Given a loan of $300, A. plans to increase his stock in the palm-wine business and add new businesses in other to spread his risk and to find out which business is more profitable for him to embark on in the long run. He plans on starting a piggery. He plans to repay his loan in 15 months with sales from his palm-wine investment, which provides daily income.  Loan repayment will commence a month after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase and retail of palmwine

loans.name: Ayolah

texts.en:
Born in 1973, J. is one of two wives and mother of six children. Hardship following the death of her husband in 2003, a motor accident she had on the Bamenda Bambui road, and food insufficiency are her sources of motivation and determination. Committed in changing her family situation she took her first loan in 2006 and started a small medicine store. She succeeded in providing her community with First Aid services with non-prescription drugs.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to increase her stock by buying more medicine. She also plans to start a puff-puff and firewood business. Puff-puff is made out of wheat flour. They are table tennis-size balls fried in deep oil. This delicious food is often served with beans, porridge and tea. Primary schoolers enjoys puff-puff mostly as snacks. Firewood and puff-puff are in great demand on a daily basis. She plans to repay the loan over a period of 15 months. Loan repayment will commence a month after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Medicine store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen Faviola S. is the mother of two children, Rodriguez (23) and Rosamera Cabrera (21), and the wife of Ribel Mensero. She currently is selling different types of clothing, shoes, and other personal effects. With this loan she is going to try and buy more products to sell, as well as some things to fix up her shop, which is currently out of her home. In the future, Carmen hopes to be able to have her own store separate from her house and to be able to provide a better life for her family.

NOTE: Carmen is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell and to fix up her shop.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Kossiwa L. is married and has five (5) children. She currently lives in Mawussi in the sub-prefecture of Afagnan, where she runs her agricultural and handicraft (rope-making) businesses. The sale of agricultural products and ropes constitutes her sole source of income. Given that the growing season has begun and the region's soils are poor, she needs fertilizer to re-energize the production capacity of her soil in order to increase yield. In addition, she buys more often the raw materials for the fabrication of ropes. Limited by her means, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to invest in her business, whose yield will provide her with improved living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame L. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle réside actuellement à Mawussi dans la sous préfecture d'Afagnan où elle exerce ses activités champêtres et artisanales (fabrication de cordes). La vente des produits agricoles et des cordes constitue sa seule source de revenu. La saison champêtre ayant débuté et les sols de sa localité étant pauvres, elle a besoin de fertilisants pour redynamiser la capacité de production de ses sols afin d'augmenter le rendement. En plus, elle achète plus souvent les matière premières servant à la fabrication des cordes. Limitée par ses moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir investir dans ses activités dont le rendement lui apportera une amélioration des conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Zama

texts.en:
Born in 1964, S. was once married. She regrets the fact that she abandoned school and got married. Unfortunately for her the man she sacrificed her education in favor of abandoned her and their five children. During this period of great emotional and economic hardship she learned about GHAPE empowerment credit (EC) program. Determined to improve her lot and be available to her kids, she took her first loan in 2006. She used the amount to pay for pay and acquire hair dressing skills.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to buy a hair dresser.  With this investment, she will provide her community with hair beauty treatment and apprenticeship facilities for young girls. She intends to pay back her loan over a period of 18 months. Loan repayment will commence a month after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Hair Dresser

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Ms Gladys is 33 years old and single. She lives with her parents and has a 13-year-old child who attends high school. This is his her greatest joy. Her son is one the best students in his class. Beyond studying, he also helps her with her business selling products.

She owns a small company located in the municipal market where she sells corn, corn flour, and charcoal. She has five years of experience in this business. She started working in this field with the help of her mother, who owns a storeroom at the municipal market. Her mother helped her economically and provided her with necessary merchandise to start up the business.

Since she is the only person to provide this type of business and the principal provider at the market, she needs to increase her production. She wants to purchase corn in greater quantity so that she can supply her requests and obtain important discounts to help her increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Gladys tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, tiene un hijo de 13 años que estudia en el colegio y es su mayor alegría; ella nos cuenta que su hijo es uno de los mejores alumnos de su clase y además de estudiar el la ayuda en el negocio vendiendo los productos.

Ella es dueña de una microempresa que está ubicada en el mercado municipal donde comercializa maíz en grano, harina de maíz y también carbón; tiene una antigüedad de 5 años en el negocio. Ella comenzó a trabajar en dicha actividad gracias a la ayuda de su madre, quien tiene una despensa en el mercado municipal; ella la ayudó económicamente y le facilitó las mercaderías indispensables para el inicio de la actividad.

Como ella es la única que posee este tipo de negocio, es la principal proveedora del mercado, ella necesita aumentar su producción, por lo que desea comprar granos de maíz al por mayor, de esa forma podrá abastecer sus pedidos y obtener importantes descuentos que la ayudarán a aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase corn in greater quantity

loans.name: Djoukey

texts.fr:
A married father of eleven (11) children, Mr. Djoukey A. was born in 1956 in Tannou, where he currently lives. A farmer for 30 years, he has mastered farming techniques and always makes good agricultural harvests, especially when the climatic conditions are favourable. The good yield he realizes is in general due to the seeds he uses. His current seeds have already been used for 4 years and are beginning to lose their productivity and need to be renewed or replaced by new ones. However, the lack of investment capital is a current problem. For this, Mr. A. is asking for a loan of $800 to buy selected seeds and fertilizers to revitalize his business. The improvement of his yield will give him financial means to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de onze (11) enfants, Monsieur A. Djoukey est né en 1956 à Tannou où il réside actuellement. Agriculteur depuis 30 ans, il maîtrise les techniques cultirales et fait toujours de bonnes campagnes agricoles surtout lorsque les conditions climatiques sont favorables. Les bons scores qu'il réalise sont généralement dûs aux semences qu'il utilise. Ses semences actuelles sont déjà utilisées pendant 4 ans et commence par perdre leurs capacité de production et ont besoin d'être renouvellées ou d'être substituées par de nouvelles. Cependant le manque de capital d'investissement constitue un problème actuel. Pour cela, Monsieur A. sollicite un fond de $800 pour acheter des semences sélectionnées et des fertilisants pour redynamiser son activité. L'amélioration de son rendements lui donnera une force financières pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy selected seeds and fertilisers to re-engergize his farming

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica B. F. is the single mother of Angel Miguel F. (4). She is currently selling frozen products such as ice cream, frozen juice drinks, ice, etc. With this loan she is hoping to buy more supplies such as bags, ice chests, and bottles in order to be able to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by buying fresh fruit to make and sell her own fresh juices in order to be able to better provide for her son.

NOTE: Jessica is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and goods for her store

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Messan A. was born in 1974. He is married and supports a family of seven people, including his children. He has at hand an agricultural enterprise encompassing a vast range which includes fields of oil palms. Given the profitability from the type of palms he owns, he wants to make use of remaining land by planting young palms. Yet he lacks the financial capital to buy these plants. And so he is requesting a loan of $800 to realize this project. If successful, the project will significantly improve living conditions for this family because the oil palm is a commercial crop.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Messan est né en 1974. Il est marié et supporte une famille de sept (7) personnes dont ses enfants. C'est un exploitant agricole qui a un vaste domaine à sa disposition et dont une partie est occupée par les palmiers à huile. Vu la rentabilité de la variété de palmiers qu'il possède, il veut exploiter tout le domaine restant en repiquant de jeunes plants de palmiers. Cependant, il faut du capital financier pour l'achat des jeunes plants. Il sollicite un apport financier de $800 qui lui permettra de réaliser ce projet. La réussite de ce projet améliorera de façon significative les conditions de vie de cette famille car le palmier à huile est une plante à caractère économique.

loans.use: To create a large plantation of  oil palms

loans.name: Eni .

texts.en:
S. is from a polygamous family and has five children, four of whom are in school. To support the heavy school needs of her children, she has had to work extremely hard. This pushed her to join GHAPE in 2004 and took her first loan of $40 which she used in opening up a pig farm. One of her pigs has given birth to seven piglets and she is now facing the problem of feeding the pigs.

Given a loan of $100, she plans to buy 500kg of pig feed. Members of her community interested in pig farming will be able to have piglets to start their own farms. 

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Fattening of pigs for sale.

loans.name: Fointein .

texts.en:
C. is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Unable to raise business capital, she joined GHAPE in 2006 and took her first loan of $40 and opened up a small grocery. Her greatest wish is to build a house for herself and her family as they are currently renting which is expensive. To make this dream a reality and support her children, she needs to grow her business to earn a higher income. 

Given a loan of $300, she plans to buy palm oil, groundnuts, sugar, soap, beans and fresh tomatoes for retail. Her business is of great importance to her community because it has shortened the distance of going to the market and her products constitute basic necessities.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Sale of groceries.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa A., age 48, is married and has 8 persons to support. For several years, she has dedicated herself to preparing cassava flour, generally called "gari". She is very devoted and has plenty of initiative. Revenues from commerce in gari allow her to provide for her family and to help with running her home. These revenues are not great enough for any investing. Thus, there is a need for working capital to acquire cassava, or entire fields of cassava, in order to increase her gari production. The success of this project will allow her to improve living conditions via an increase in revenues. She is requesting a loan of $800.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 48 ans, Madame A. Akossiwa est mariée et a en charge huit (8) personnes. Depuis plusieurs années, elle s'est consacrée à la préparation de la farine du manioc communément appelée « gari ». Elle est très dévouée et pleine d'initiatives. La commercialisation du gari lu procure des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de contribuer à la gestion de son ménage. Le revenu obtenu n'est pas aussi consistant pour lui permettre de faire des investissements d'où la nécessité d'un fond de base qui servira à acheter du manioc ou des champs entiers de manioc afin d'accroître sa production de gari. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d'améliorer ses conditions de vie à travers l'augmentation de son revenu monétaire. Elle sollicite un apport financiers de $800.

loans.use: To buy some cassava or  entire fields of cassava to increase her production of gari

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina S. is the mother of two children, Julio Manuel S. (2), Dianna Michelle Santan (7), and the wife of Adriano De la Cruz. Dina currently is selling clothing and also selling a common type of food here called Yucca. With this loan she is hoping to be able to not only buy more merchandise in order to expand her business, but she is hoping to be able to go to a better farm from which to buy the Yucca. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a larger house and better provide for her family, because her husband is ill and is not able to work all of the time and therefore she is the main source of income for her family at this time.

NOTE: Dina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase utensils to help her prepare Yucca and to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr:
Ablam A. was born in 1967. He is married, a father of six, and is very active earning his living from agriculture, which constitutes his main source of income. He grows various crops according to the season. Today, arable lands are undeniably becoming poorer and poorer, and crops are successful less and less. Now then, his entire life and family depend on these crops. In order to reap a good harvest, these lands need fertilizer. His corn plants are stunted. For these reasons, Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizers and some pesticides, which will allow him to treat his crops against devastating insects. A successful season will result in a good harvest. And the sale of these staple crops will provide for his family and make their lives better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Ablam est né en 1967, marié et père de six (6) enfants. Il est très actif et vit de l'agriculture qui constitue sa principale source de revenu. Il fait des cultures variées selon les saisons. Aujourd'hui, force est de constater que les terres cultivables s'appauvrissent et les cultures réussissent de moins en moins. Or, toute sa vie et celle de sa famille en dépendent. Pour donner de bons rendements, ces terres ont besoin de fertilisants. C'est pourquoi Monsieur A. Ablam, vu le niveau actuel de ses plants de maïs, sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter de l'engrais et des produits phytosanitaires qui lui permettront de traiter ces plants contre des insectes dévastateurs. La réussite de la saison lui permettra de faire une bonne moisson. La vente des vivres lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de mieux vivre.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Fon

texts.en:
M. is married with seven children. Her children's education is her primary motivation. She borrowed from neighbors at a very high interest rate before receiving her first loan of $40 from GHAPE, which she invested in crop cultivation. Before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, which has been reinforced by bi-monthly meetings.

Given a loan of $200, M. plans to expand her pig-farm by constructing 2 stalls and buying a piglet. She plans to cultivate foodstuffs using manure from her pigs. She will then supply food and manure to neighbors and consequently increase the supply of foodstuffs and meat in the community.

M. plans to pay her loan over 18 months. Loan repayment will begin four months after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Pigs and retailing of foodstuff

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
Born in 1951 in Tannou, Mr. Kodjovi H. is a brave carpenter practicing woodworking there in his home village. He is very experienced and has completed many projects thanks to his business. As a husband, he has 10 family members to support. Besides providing his services, he also shows his work, which his many customers do value. Currently, he lacks the financial means to acquire the lumber for producing showpieces. He is convinced that giving shows is one way of attracting customers.

Thus, he is requesting a loan of $1200 for lumber to boost his business. If he is successful, he will have improved his income and the quality of life for his entire family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1951 à Tannou, Monsieur H. Kodjovi est un vaillant menuisier qui exerce son activité dans ledit village. Très expérimenté, il a grâce à son activité réalisé beaucoup de projets. Marié, il supporte une famille de dix (10) membres. Outre ses prestations de service, il fait des expositions de ses ouvrages, ce qui lui a valu une clientèle importante. Aujoud'hui, le manque de moyens financiers l'empêche de s'approvisionner en planches afin de fabriquer des ouvrages pour exposer. Mais il est convaincu que l'exposition constitue pour lui une source d'attraction de clients.

Ainsi, il sollicite un apport financier de $1200 pour s'approvisionner en planches en vue d'une bonne reprise de ses activités. S'il arrive a réaliser ce projet, il aura amélioré son revenu et partant la qualité de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire lumber for woodworking

loans.name: Ezounougan

texts.fr:
Ezounougan A. is a local merchant. He was born in 1933 and has 15 family members to support. A brave man, he started a grocery business 20 years ago, and thus, he is able to provide for his family despite his advanced years. His ability to manage his revenues allows him to maintain steady sales. However, most of his revenues go towards daily household needs, and he is encountering difficulties reinvesting in the expansion of his display of goods. Having demonstrated his management abilities, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to revitalize his shop. Increasing his sales will allow him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Ezounougan est un commerçant dans sa localité. Né en 1933, il prend en charge une famille de quinze (15) personnes. Brave, Monsieur A. a commencé ce commerce d'alimentation générale et divers il y a 20 ans et c'est grâce à cela qu'il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille malgré son âge avancé. Sa capacité de gestion de ses revenus lui permet de maintenir une certaine constance de chiffre d'affaire. Toutefois, une grande partie de ses revenus étant consommées par les besoins quotidiens du ménage, il rencontre des difficultés de reinvestissement pour agrandir son étallage. Ayant démontré également sa capacité de gestion de Il sollicite un crédit de $1200 afin de ravitallier sa boutique en marchandises. L'augmentation de son chiffre d'affaire lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in general food items

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina S. S. is a single mother of four: Emiar de Sanchez (15), Adyes (14), Roselin de Sanchez (13), Samira de Sanchez (11). With this loan she is hoping to open up a chicken farm and restaurant. However, she does not feel that it would be beneficial to her to sell the food in her town and so she is hoping to expand her market to a larger nearby town. She is hoping that in the future she will be able to have her own small restaurant and be able to provide a better life for her four children, because at the current time she is struggling to provide basic care for all of them.

NOTE: Alina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and cooking supplies

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy B. R. is an enterprising interior decorator. Her business, Wendy Decoracion, sells scented candles, framed three-dimensional reliefs, baby accessories, curtains, pillow cases, and other textiles. She will use this loan to buy materials to expand her stock of goods. Wendy's entrepreneurship helps her and her husband Juaquin support their two daughters: Lisi (10) and Dilovi (6). Wendy hopes her business will be successful enough to be able to provide Lisi with the computer lessons she's wanted. If Lisi learns how to use a computer, she can someday work in an office in the town near her home.

NOTE: Wendy is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Materials for expansion

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria has a talent for working with her hands and is very ceative. She is married with four children; they were her motivation to start her own floral arrangement and balloon business three years ago. This is how she is able to to help her husband with the household and her children's educational expenses. The originality and experience that Flor puts into each one of her creations has helped her gain many clients and grow her business.

Fortunately, Flor has had more requests and needs a loan of 275 dollars to purchase materials for the production of arrangements. With this loan, she expects to meet the demands of her work and offer her clients the best service. She will pay off her loan in 4 months. This is a very important part of Flor's and her family's life, and they greatly appreciate your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor Maria tiene mucha facilidad para las manualidades y es muy creativa, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, quienes fueron el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace tres años con la elaboración de arreglos florales y de globos, de esta manera es como puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. La originalidad y experiencia que Flor deposita en cada una de sus creaciones le ha ayudado a ganar más clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Afortunadamente Flor ha tenido pedidos más grandes y necesita de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los arreglos, con esto espera cubrir la demanda por sus servicios y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 4 meses. Sé parte importante en la vida de Flor y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Cesar Rafael

texts.es:
Cesar Rafael is a young entrepreneur and married with two young children. Five years ago he inherited from his father a factory producing pants and jean-made products. Little by little he is growing the business and improving the quality of his products. He now employs three people to help keep up with his client's demands.

In order to increase his production his machines need maintenance and repair. Right now, he has a very large order and would like to finish it in time. For this reason he asks for a loan of 1,200 dollars, which he will pay off in 6 months. Take part in the growth of the business and in the well-being of this family. They greatly appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar Rafael es un joven emprendedor, está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Hace cinco años heredó de su padre una maquiladora en la que elaboran pantalones y cortes de mezclilla, poco a poco ha estado creciendo y mejorando la calidad de sus productos, ahora ya cuenta con la ayuda de tres empleados para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

Para pode incrementar su producción necesita darle mantenimiento y reparar las máquinas que utiliza, actualmente tiene un pedido muy grande y quiere poder terminarlo a tiempo, por esta razón ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y en el bienestar de esta familia, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Machine maintenance and repair

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is orginally from Apodaca, New Leon. She is married with four children. She hopes to offer her children a good education and improve their way of life. This was impossible to accomplish on only her husband's salary. Thus, she was motivated to start her own business selling soft drinks, ice cream, and snacks. She started her business four years ago in her own house. Little by little her reputation has grown among her neighbors, increasing her business' image.

To increase her sales, she hopes to improve the appearance of her business. It is for this reason she asks for a loan of 250 dollars, which she will use toward the renovation. She expects to pay off the loan in 3 months. This business is a very important part of Francisca's and her family's life, and they sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es originaria de Apodaca, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella desea poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, que sería imposible con el salario que su esposo recibe, esto la motivo a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de refrescos, helados y botanas hace cuatro años, inició las ventas en su propio domicilio, poco a poco se ha estado dando a conocer entre sus vecinos y surtiendo mejor su negocio.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas desea darle un mejor aspecto a su negocio por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en remodelación, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Francisca y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Renovation

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus is married with four children. The unemployment that exists in the country has had an impact on her husband's attempts to sell his roasted corn. His income is insufficient to support his family's basic needs. This is why Maria has sold beauty products for the last four years. She started her business along with her neighbor, and now, Maria also counts on her children's help.

In order to meet her client's requests and continue to grow her business, Maria asks for a loan of 250 dollars to purchase merchandise. Your contribution can help improve this family's way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, la falta de empleo que hay en el país ha afectado para que su esposo consiga un empleo por lo que se dedica a la venta de elotes, pero con el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, esta es la razón por la que Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace cuatro años, inició el negocio junto con una vecina y ahora también cuenta con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella es muy responsable y cubrirá su deuda en tres meses. Ayuda al crecimiento de este negocio, con tu colaboración puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman. She is married with three children; they have motivated her to start her own business since the salary of her husband, who works as a stonemason, is too small to support all the family's needs. Because Oralia is a self-starter, four years ago she decided to start her own business selling jewelry and hamburgers. Fortunately, the business has done very well, and her requests and sales have grown.

Her desire to improve her family's quality of life motivates her to work everyday, and now, she wants to see her business grow. She asks for a 250 dollar loan to purchase merchandise. She pledges to pay off her loan in 3 months. By supporting Oralia, you can become a part of this business' development and the well-being of Oralia and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene tres hijos que han sido el motivo para iniciar su propio negocio, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su salario es muy bajo para poder cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que Oralia siendo una mujer emprendedora decidió comenzar con las ventas de joyería y hamburguesas desde hace cuatro años. Afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien y cada vez se incrementan más sus pedidos y ventas.

El deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la motiva a trabajar mucho día a día, y ahora quiere hacer creer su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes formar parte en el desarrollo de este negocio y en el bienestar de Oralia y su familia, ¡apóyalos!.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria is married with three children; they are 3, 7, and 12 years old. Her husband works temporarily as a laborer in a carpentry shop, and thus, there are periods of no work and no salary. For this reason Luz started her own supply shop one year ago. With 100 dollars she purchased groceries and produced supplies. She started selling to her village and isolated areas of the city. The low prices and high quality of her products were greatly appreciated by her customers, and thus, her busiiness has grown.

To increase her sales she asks for a loan of 475 dollars to purchase merchandise to meet the growing demand. She pledges to pay off the loan in 6 months. You can help improve this family's way of life by contributing to the growth of Luz's business. She sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Maria es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 7 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una carpintería pero es temporal y hay ocasiones en las que no recibe su salario, por lo que Luz emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de despensas, hace un año con $100 dólares que tenía compró artículos de abarrotes y elaboró las despensas, empezó a vender en su colonia y en localidades apartadas de la ciudad, gracias a los bajos precios que ofrece y la buena calidad de sus productos tuvo buena aceptación de parte de sus clientes su negocio ha crecido mucho.

Para incrementar sus ventas necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía con lo que podrá cubrir su creciente demanda, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, Luz te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nora Irma

texts.es:
Nora is a single mother of three children; they are 12, 14, and 15 years old. Previously, she received economic support from her children's father. However, for three years now he has neglected his children completely. For this reason Nora started her own business producing and selling flour tortillas. This is how she has been able to obtain the resources to support her children and pay for their studies. It has not been easy for Nora, but her well-being is the greatest reward.

At this moment Nora asks for a loan of 750 dollars to purchase supplies to produce her products, as well as purchase tables, coolers, and grills. With these she expects to increase her production and business. She pledges to pay off the loan in 6 months. You can help improve this family's way of life. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 12, 14 y 15 años de edad, anteriormente recibía apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos, pero desde hace tres años se ha desobligado por completo, por lo que Nora inició su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, de esta manera es como obtiene los recursos para mantener a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios. No ha sido fácil para Nora sacar adelante a su familia ella sola pero su bienestar es la mejor recompensa.

En estos momentos Nora necesita de un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, así como para compra de mesas, enfriadores y parrillas con lo que espera incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda mejorarás la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and work equipment

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus is married with three children; they are 7, 13, and 21 years old. Five years ago her husband lost his job to a disability, making it difficult for him to find another job. The family's debt began to accumulate. For this reason Maria decided to start her own business selling foods. So as not to neglect her children, Maria started preparing various dishes in her home, and little by little client's requests and demands for greater quantities began to increase. Now she has incorporated the service of banquet halls for special events and has received great praise from her clients.

To keep up with client demands, Maria asks for a loan of 825 dollars to purchase necessary supplies for the production of her various dishes, as well as to purchase kitchen utensils. This loan will help her increase her production and her quality of service. By contributing to this business you will be helping this family. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 7, 13 y 21 años de edad. Hace cinco años su esposo perdió su empleo a causa de una incapacidad física, esto también le dificultó para encontrar otro trabajo y las deudas de su hogar comenzaron a acumularse, fue así como juntos decidieron emprender su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, para no descuidar a sus hijos Maria empezó a preparar diversos platillos en su casa y poco a poco se fueron incrementando sus pedidos y las cantidades que demandaban sus clientes, ahora han incorporado el servicio de banquetes para eventos especiales y ha recibido muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Maria necesita un crédito de $ 825 dólares que destinará a la compra de los insumos que requiere en la elaboración de sus platillos, así como para comprar utensilios de cocina, esto le permitirá incrementar su producción y la calidad del servicio que ofrece. Forma parte de este negocio, tu contribución será de mucha ayuda para esta familia. Ellos agradecen sinceramente el apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and work equipment

loans.name: Mirna Concepción

texts.es:
Mirna is 35 years old. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is divorced and a mother of three children; they are 5, 9, and 15 years old. She started her own business selling tamales so as to obtain the necessary resources for her family, especially since she does not receive any support from her ex-husband. Mirna works from her own home, which has allowed her to remain close to her children. She works very hard every day with the hopes of improving her family's quality of life and being able to offer her children an education.

Right now she receives special requests for events; however, she does not have the necessary means to meet these demands. She asks for a loan of 475 dollars to purchase larger steam pots and a bigger tank of gas. With these she expects to increase her production. She pledges to pay off the loan within 4 months. You can be a part of this business' growth. Mirna and her family sincerely appreciate any support you may offer.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirna tiene 35 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, es divorciada y madre de tres hijos, de 5, 9 y 15 años de edad. Inició su propio negocio con la venta de tamales para obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, ya que no recibe un buen apoyo de su ex esposo. Mirna trabaja en su casa lo que le ha permitido también estar al pendiente de sus hijos, ella desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder ofrecerles una buena educación para lo que se esfuerza día a día.

Actualmente recibe pedidos para eventos especiales pero no cuenta con los medios necesarios para poder cubrir su demanda, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de vaporeras más grandes y un tanque de gas de mayor capacidad, con lo que espera incrementar su producción, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, Mirna y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: To purchase work equipment

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca Esthela is 33 years old. She is married with a 10-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old son. Three years ago her husband's job forced him to move to another city. Since he had not yet settled, his expenses in the first couple of months were high, and he was unable to send money to his family. However, being a self-starter, Blanca started her own business selling foods to obtain the necessary resources for her family. She started producing and selling foods to foreign students who lived near her house. Once her products began to be known for their quality, her requests increased. Now she produces all types of foods for special events.

Blanca hopes to continue growing her business. She asks for a loan of 475 dollars to purchase a blender, skillets, kitchen utensils, and necessary supplies to increase production. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Your contribution is a great help to the well-being of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca Esthela tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de una niña de 10 años y un pequeñito de sólo 3 años de edad. Por razones de trabajo su esposo ha tuvo que cambiar su residencia a otra ciudad hace tres años, los primeros meses como no se había establecido tenía muchos gastos y no podía enviar dinero a su familia, pero Blanca por ser una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas para obtener los recursos que necesitaba su familia, inició elaborando y vendiendo comidas a estudiantes foráneos que vivían cerca de su casa pero pronto comenzó a darse a conocer la buena calidad de sus productos y a incrementarse sus pedidos, ahora elabora todo tipo de comidas para eventos especiales.

Blanca desea poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de una licuadora, sartenes, utensilios de cocina e insumos que requiere para incrementar su producción. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, tu colaboración es de mucha utilidad para el bienestar de esta familia.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and work equipment

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is 45 years old and married with five children; they are between the ages of 13 and 17. On occassion, her husband would be unemployed and they would not have the resources to provide their family with basic necessities. Three years ago Elvia decided to start her own business. First, she started washing clothes, and then, she started producing foods for sale. Her product's great quality increased the number of customers and her business.

Now she asks for a loan of 475 dollars to purchase a small oven, a tank of gas, and kitchen utensils. With these she expects to increase her production and offer a better service to her customers. Elvia pledges to pay off the loan within 4 months. In your hands is the well-being of this family. They sincerely appreciate your contribution to the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, de entre 3 y 17 años de edad. En ocasiones a su esposo le faltaba trabajo y no tenían los recursos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ante esta situación desde hace tres años Elvia decidió empezar a trabajar primero lavando ropa ajena y después elaborando comidas para vender, la buena calidad de sus productos le ha permitido incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.
