Ahora esta solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que planea destinar a la compra de una estufa pequeña con horno, un tanque de gas y utensilios de cocina, con lo que espera incrementar su capacidad de producción y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Elvia se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase work equipment

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: “I live in a village called Pakpattan in Pakistan. Due to distance from cities, there are few economic opportunities in Pakpattan. I have been fortunate enough to operate a school canteen with my husband for the past few years for which I require a loan to purchase additional stock for my canteen before the school semester begins in August. I have two small children who attend school as well and I hope that my business income will ensure their better future."

loans.use: Purchase snacks to stock up the school canteen before the school reopens

loans.name: Sheedan

texts.en: “I live in a small town in Pakistan and have been selling milk of buffaloes for the past 35 years. However, my husband now wishes to install a new seat for his Rickshaw (a three wheeled motor vehicle) to provide transportation service to more people around town. We believe that the transportation business is more profitable than the dairy sector. My husband and I need a loan for this new seat so that we can increase our income to support our family of nine.”

loans.use: Upgrade Rickshaw

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en: “I live in a Pakpattan, a small town 200 km from the second largest city Lahore in Pakistan. My husband and I work together to make a living for our five children. While I sew clothes at home for neighbours, my husband would like to purchase a second-hand car to provide taxi service in large cities. We have pooled in some of our savings and looking for an additional amount to make our new business venture possible.”

loans.use: Purchase second car to provide taxi service

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: “My husband and I work together where I embroider clothes and he sews them in his tailoring shop. We need a loan to purchase sewing machines and some raw material for our business in a village located in the heart of Punjab, the most populous province. With the additional profits, we hope we can give our children a proper education that they deserve.”

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Meedan

texts.en: “My family and I have faced many economic constraints due to which my children were forced to drop out of primary school. In 2006, my husband managed to open a small store from which he earns $3 to $4 per day. I want to help him diversify his business and purchase an additional buffalo to keep at home. While I take care of the animals and milk them, he can sell dairy products at our store. We require a loan to purchase the buffalo.”

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Ms Amalia S. is 49 years old and married with three children. Her husband owns a carpentry shop in their home that provides an income to sustain the family. Their three children attend a public high school in the city. They also help their mother and father with their businesses.

Amalia has always been a self-starter. She started her own business selling clothes door-to-door. After some years of saving, she was able to start a small business in the city's municipal market where, today, she owns a butcher shop.

Work is going very well, but she has hopes of developing the business. She hopes to acquire meat in larger quantities, in this way she can receive important discounts and also offer a greater variety of product. To acquire these larger quantities, she asks for a loan of 400 dollars, which she pledges to pay off.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amalia S., tiene 49 años ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su marido tiene una carpintería en su casa que les proporciona ingresos para el sustento D. la familia; sus tres hijos están estudiando, ellos asisten a un colegio público D. la ciudad, no obstante ellos también ayudan a su madre y a su padre en sus oficios.

Amalia siempre fue una mujer muy emprendedora, ella empezó vendiendo ropa D. forma ambulante; luego D. unos años D. ahorro pudo montar su microempresa en el mercado municipal D. la ciudad, donD. hoy día es dueña D. una carnicería.

A ella le va muy bien con su negocio, por lo que tiene deseos D. seguir ampliándolo, para ello ella desea adquirir carne D. los frigoríficos al por mayor, pues D. esta manera consigue importantes descuentos y también más variedad en sus productos, el monto que necesita es D. $ 400 y se compromete a devolverlos mensualmente.

loans.use: To purchase cow meat in large quantity

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en: "My husband and I want to expand our business. We sell dairy products in the local market from our goats and buffaloes. If you can lend me this money, my husband and I will be able to purchase livestock feed and fodder to sell in the market. If this venture is successful, we will later sell fresh soil in order to diversify products that we can sell in the market. I have lived in a small village all my life located about 200 km from Lahore."

loans.use: Purchase livestock fodder

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: “I have a family of ten including myself and live in a village in Pakistan. My children who have finished school are employed. Two of my sons operate a Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle), but one of them needs to purchase a new Richshaw—we have pooled in some of our savings and require an additional loan.”

loans.use: Purchase a Rickshaw

loans.name: Sheema

texts.en: “I manage my family’s dairy business of which we sell 3 to 4 kilos per day. My husband used to work in a local factory, which he quit due to an injury. Now that he is feeling better, we need a loan to purchase a Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle) on which he will provide transportation service to local townspeople. My eldest child works while the three younger ones go to school.”

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es:
José de Jesús is 46 years old, married, and has four children. His wife work as a secretary in a publice office. Their four children go to high school and are excellent students. He hopes his children complete their studies by receiving a university education, so they can have better opportunities in life. José is a dentist. He has already dedicated 20 years to this activity and he has his own dental office in his home. Thanks to his good work and dedication he has been able to increase his portfolio of clients. His family has moved ahead in life thanks to his work.

José constantly strives and trains to be updated with the latest advances of his profession. José desires to improve the image of his dental office and add a few finer touches to the front of his office. For this purpose he requests a loan of $800, which he will invest in materials and manual labor to renovate his dental office.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

José de Jesús, tiene 46 años está casado y tiene 4 hijos, su esposa trabaja como secretaría en una oficina pública, sus 4 hijos van al colegio y son alumnos excelentes él desea que sus hijos culminen una carrera universitaria para poder tener mejores oportunidades en la vida. José es mecánico dental, el se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 20 años y posee un consultorio propio en su casa. Gracias a su buen desempeño y dedicación él ha logrado aumentar su cartera de clientes y ha sacado adelante a su familia gracias a su trabajo.

José constantemente se especializa y capacita para estar actualizado con los últimos avances de su profesión. José desea mejorar la imagen de su consultorio y darle unos retoques a la fachada de la misma, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 800 que los invertirá en compra de materiales y mano de obra para refaccionar el consultorio.

loans.use: Pay for materials and manual labor to renovate his dental office

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Señor Heriberto González is 37 years old. He lives in a little house with his wife and their son. His wife works as a traveling sales person. Their son is 13 years old and goes to high school. He fills his parents with pride because he is an excellent student.

Heriberto is a taxi driver. He began as a driver for a taxi company, and with time he was able to save his money and buy his own vehicle and work independently. Six years ago he became the boss of his own taxi station, where he works with ten other taxi drivers, each one with his own vehicle. The taxi station is next to the bus stop, where the movement of people is rather high and this generates a good income for him. He always keeps his vehicle in good condition and does the necessary maintenance on time. The tires of his taxi are already worn down and it is time to change them. For this purpose, Heriberto is requesting a loan of $200 to acquire new tires and keep his taxi in good shape.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

EL señor Heriberto González tiene 37 años, vive en una pequeña casa con su pareja y el hijo de ambos. Su señora trabaja como vendedora ambulante; su hijo tiene 13 años va al colegio y les llena de orgullo, pues es un excelente alumno.

Heriberto es taxista, empezó a trabajar como chofer en una parada de taxis, con el tiempo pudo ahorrar y adquirir su propio vehículo y trabajar de forma independiente. Hace 6 años él es dueño de su propia parada de taxis, donde trabaja en conjunto con otros 10 taxistas, cada uno con su vehículo propio. La parada de taxis está ubicada en la terminal de ómnibus, donde el movimiento de gente es bastante alto y le genera buenos ingresos. El siempre mantiene en muy buen estado su vehículo, realiza los mantenimientos necesarios con puntualidad; las cubiertas de su taxi ya están gastadas y es momento de que las cambie, por ello, Heriberto solicita un crédito de $ 200 para adquirir cubiertas nuevas y mantener en buen estado su taxi.

loans.use: Buy 4 new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Señor Marcial R. N. is 36 years old and married to Helena. They have two sons: one is five years old and the other is three years old. They all live together in their own house. They both contribute to the family income: Helena is a dressmaker and Marcial has a forest nursery.

He began this activity three years ago, when he took a course on reforestation. He loves his job and he loves plants. In his nursery he has different types of plants such as roses, orchids, daisies, etc. He told us that he hopes to contribute to the preservation of the forests because they are the lungs of the planet. Marcial tells us that this activity is also very profitable, if he does it with the appropriate techniques. Now he speaks with various youth from the community who work with him voluntarily.

He has many clients, among them there is a group of Germans dedicated to reforestation and the preservation of green areas. As winter approaches, Marcial hopes to strengthen the care of his plants. For this he hopes to acquire meters of wire mesh with which he will improve the structure of his nursery. For this reason he requests a loan of $200 that he will use to acquire mesh.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El señor Marcial R. N., tiene 36 años, está casado con Helena y tienen 2 hijos, uno de 5 años y otro de 3. Ellos viven todos juntos en una casa propia, ambos aportan con el ingreso familiar, Helena es modista y Marcial tiene un vivero forestal.

Se inicio en esta actividad hace 3 años, realizo un curso sobre reforestación, él ama su profesión pues le encanta las plantas, en su vivero tiene diferentes tipos de arboles típicos del nuestra foresta, así como también rosas, orquídeas, margaritas, etc.; él nos cuenta que desea aportar con la preservación de los bosques que son el pulmón del planeta. Marcial manifiesta que esta actividad también es muy rentable, si se realiza con las técnicas apropiadas, hoy día cuenta con varios jóvenes de la comunidad trabajando con él voluntariamente.

El posee muchos clientes, entre ellos hay grupos de alemanes que se dedican a la reforestación y preservación de áreas verdes. Como el invierno se acerca el desea reforzar los cuidados de sus plantas, para ello desea adquirir varios metros de tejido de alambre con los que mejorara la estructura de su vivero, para ello solicita un crédito de $200 que los utilizará para la adquisición del tejido.

loans.use: Purchase wire mesh

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Señor Ángel C. is 45 years old, married, and has one son who is six years old. His wife is a teacher and works in a public city high school, supporting her husband with the household income. Ángel finished his secondary studies, but due to a lack of economic stability for his parents, Ángel had to move to the capital in search of new opportunities for work, and there he was also able to study. He studied three years in a technical school, where he learned the trade of a radio technician. Later, this helped him start his own business, and he was able to return to Ybycuí to be with his family. Señor Ángel is doing very well. He has formed a clientel and he works for big businesses that come to him to repair all types of televisions, radios, cameras, closed circuits, etc. He also does maintenance for these products. Every day new models and products are entering the market, and don Ángel needs to modernize the instruments that he uses for repairing these machines. For this reason, Ángel requests a loan of $200, which he will use to acquire a box of new tools and various spare parts, which he can only acquire in the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El señor Ángel C. tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años. Su esposa es docente, trabaja en un colegio público de la ciudad y ayuda a su marido con los ingresos de la casa. Ángel culminó sus estudios secundarios, pero debido a la falta de estabilidad económica de sus padres, Ángel, tuvo que emigrar a la ciudad capital en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo y así poder solventar el mismo sus estudios complementarios. Estudió durante 3 años en una escuela Técnica, donde aprendió el oficio de la Radiotécnica; posteriormente, esto le ayudó a montar su propio negocio, y pudo volver a Ybycuí junto a su familia. Al señor Ángel le va muy bien, tiene una clientela formada y trabaja para grandes empresas que llevan a su negocio para reparar todo tipo de televisores, radios, cámaras, circuitos cerrados, etc. y también realiza los mantenimientos de los mismos. Como día a día salen al mercados nuevos modelos de productos electrónicos, don Ángel necesita modernizar sus elementos de trabajo que utiliza para el reparó de las máquinas; para ello, Ángel solicita un crédito de $ 200 que lo utilizará para adquirir una caja nueva de herramientas y repuestos varios, que solo puede conseguirlos en la ciudad capital.

loans.use: Buy a box of tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Negmatjon

texts.en:
Negmatjon has been engaged in business for over 6 years. He is married and has 2 children and his wife is a teacher. Negmatjon is well-educated but has not been able to find a good job. He therefore decided to sell office supplies in his friend's shop. His friend employed Negmatjon as a seller and gave him the opportunity to sell his own goods as well. Negmatjon bought these goods from a wholesale market in Tashkent, Uzbekistan. Gradually, Negmatjon was able to increase the turnover of his working capital and by 2006, he saved enough money to open his own shop.

Negmatjon became a client of Micro Invest in 2007. With their loans, he was able to expand the range of goods he sold. His business is now located in the center of Panjshanbe market. Today he has many clients and always tries to meet their needs. He is now requesting a $1,200 loan to buy school supplies for his store.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: “I take care of my three small children and sew for neighbours when my household chores are finished. My eldest child is in kindergarten. I would like to see my children attend and finish school so that they have a bright future. Hence, my husband requires support for buying stock for his new fruit cart and requires a loan. My husband and I both hope that our new business will be more successful and yield a reasonable profit.”

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom has a small candy store on the first floor of Pahjshanbe market. She is married and has 4 children. Her elder son is in 8th grade, and helps his mother at the store after lessons.

Dilorom became a client of Micro Invest in 2006, when she borrowd $100 to expand her assortment of candy and attract more clients. She only sells candy produced in Russia, which is provided by various distributors. Her candies are of high quality, so her small shop is one of the well-known shops in Panjshanbe.

She is now requesting another loan, this time for $1,000, to buy more candy and increase the volume of her goods so that she can sell and earn more for her family.

loans.use: Increasing her inventory of candy for her candy store

loans.name: Dilbarhon

texts.en:
Dilbarhon is an accomplished seamstress and runs a sewing workshop located in Panjshanbe market. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a worker and they live with his parents. Dilbarhon has received good training and a high education as a designer of children's clothes. Today, she has many clothes clients whose needs she always does her best to meet.

She became a client of MicroInvest in 2006 and received a $100 loan. Gradually, Dilbarhon increased her loan to $1,000. She now has good turnover of her working capital.

Two private schools have placed orders with her workshop for her to sew school uniforms for the start of school in September. For this, Dilbarhon is requesting an $800 loan to to buy 4 rolls of silk fabric to sew school uniforms for pupils.

loans.use: Purchase of silk fabric for sewing uniforms

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is 38 and has four children. She graduated from the pedagogical college and is a qualified schoolteacher. As the income of schoolteachers is very low she is not working in the school now. Her family's primary income is generated by Lola's clothes-selling business. All her children attend school. Her husband is currently working in Russia and supports his family financially.However, his earnings are not enough for the large family of 4 children plus Lola.

That is why Lola started her own commercial business. She sells children's clothes and works at different local markets. A year ago, she came to Microinvest and received a loan. This helped her to expand the assortment of clothes she sold.

Lola is now requesting a second loan to buy school uniforms for sale. As the school season is starting soon, selling school clothes will be a highly profitable business and she hopes to bring in some much-needed income for her family with this move.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru:
Olim A. has been an active client of MLF Microinvest for over 3 years. He has over 8 years of entrepreneurial experience. Olim is married with 2 children. His children are in school. Olim's dream is to provide a good education for his children. He started his business selling men's shoes with $200 in initial capital. Now the value of his assets is $900. He requests a loan of $1000 to increase his inventory. He wants to use the profits for his children's education.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Акилов Олим, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 8 лет. Он женат, имеет 2 детей. Его дети ходят в школу. Его мечта, дать своим детям достойное образование. Свою деятельность начал с продажи мужской обуви, его актив составлял 200$. Сейчас его активы составляют 900$. Ему необходимо 1000$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Mujasar

texts.ru:
Mujasar D. has been an active client of MLF Microinvest for over 3 years. She has over 7 years of entrepreneurial experience. Mujasar is married and has 4 children. All her children are in school. She started her business selling children's clothing. Mujasar picks up the goods from Bishkek and sells it at her kiosk located at the Punchshanbe market. She needs a loan of $300 to increase the inventory and expand her kiosk.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Дехконова Муясар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 7 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Дети учатся в школе. Свою деятельность начала с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек. Ее торговая точка расположена на рынке Панчшанбе. Ей необходимо 300$, увеличение товарооборота и расширения своей точки.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Buston

texts.ru:
Buston N. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 3 years. She has been in the sales business for at least 8 years. She is married with 1 child. She stared her business by selling dishes. Her assets were initially worth $100, today they are worth $600. She personally travels to the neighboring country to buy her inventory.

Buston has a stall at the ‘Pharovon’ marketplace, located in the town of Gafurov. This is an open market place, so she is forced to pack up her dishes/plates every evening, take them home and then bring them back in the morning. In this daily transport process she looses ¼ of her inventory ! She sees having her own shop as the solution to her problem. She needs $500 to open her own shop.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиева Бустон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 8 лет. Она замужем и имеет 1 детей. Свою деятельность начала с продажи посуды, ее актив составлял 100$. На сегодняшний день ее актив составляет 600$. За товаром ездит сама в соседнюю страну.

Набиева Бустон торгует на рынке «Фаровон», расположенный в г. Гафурове. Это открытое помещение и ей приходиться каждый вечер убирать и отвозить товар домой, а утром привозить их на рынок. При транспортировке она теряет ¼ часть своего товара. Она видеть решения своей проблемы в открытие собственного магазина Ей необходимо 500$, открытия собственного магазина.

loans.use: To open her own shop

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira`s mother used to be the one who was in business, and Zamira only helped. After finishing school and not having found work, however, Zamira began to spend all her time working at their market stall. One year ago their whole inventory consisted only of Tajik galoshes. Gradually Zamira has been able to expand her business so that their inventory now includes ready-made dresses and notions.

As Zamira is only 20 years old and not yet married, she lives with her parents and her business is one of the sources of income for her family.

Zamira is trying to increase the profitability of her business and consequently, one year ago, she took a loan from MicroInvest. She says this has given a boost to her business and provided her the opportunity to make additional profit.

To purchase goods, Zamira goes to wholesale markets in Istaravshan and Karosuu, Kyrgyzstan. To travel to Karosuu it is necessary to take roundabout roads because on the way, there is a border with Uzbekistan. Travel across that border is forbidden for citizens of Tajikistan. But Zamira manages to go to Karosuu anyway, because goods are cheaper there.

Now it's the summer season and Zamira wants to further expand her inventory. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to be repaid over a period of 12 months. (The lady in the photo is Zamira`s mother.)

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Nazira O. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 4 years. She has been in the sales business for at least 6 years. She is married and lives with her parents. She began her business by selling baked goods - cookies/biscuits. Today she sells sweets and candy. She gets her inventory from her suppliers. Her stall is located in the town of Gafurov, in the ‘Pharovon’ marketplace. Nazira needs $400 to increase her sales and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Очилова Назира, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 4 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 6 лет. Она не замужем, живет с родителями. Свою деятельность начала с продажи мучных изделий (печенье). Сейчас она продает и конфеты. Товары поставляют ей поставщики. Ее торговая точка расположена г. Гафурове, на рынке «Фаровон» Ей необходимо 400$, увеличение товарооборота и расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To increase sales  and expand the busienss

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Isroil S. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 4 years. He has been in the sales business for over 13 years. He is married with 3 school going children. His dream is to give his children a good education. He began his business by selling men’s shoes. His assets were initially worth only $100, but today they are worth $500. Isroil needs $500 to increase his sales. He plans to use the resulting profit for his children’s education.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Султонов Исроил, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 4 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 13 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Его дети ходят в школу. Его мечта, дать своим детям достойное образование. Свою деятельность начал с продажи мужской обуви, его актив составлял 100$. Сейчас его активы составляют 500$. Ему необходимо 500$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is 41 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband does not have regular work and has left for Russia to earn money. Gulnora and her daughter make a living sewing national Tajik dresses and selling them in the markets. To make and sell the dresses, Gunora has rented a place in the market , where her daughter always helps her. As demand for dresses is high this season, Gulnora travels 80km to buy fabric from the wholesale market.

She recently received a loan from Microinvest which she used to purchase fabric. This increased quantity of ready dresses brought her business additional profit. Therefore, she is now requesting a second loan to purchase more fabric to meet growing demand.

[You can see Gulnora's daughter, who helps her with her sewing business, in the photo]

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen P. is 61 years old. She is a widow and lives with her one child in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a diligent mother, working very hard to cover all the family's expenses. Pen P. has invested in building some different rooms to rent to the garment workers in her area. She usually makes on average $3 each day. She and her child, who barely makes enough from working as a teacher, have not only to cover all the family's expenses, but need to take care of her three grand children.

To generate more income for her vulnerable family members, Pen P. had the idea to increase the number of her rooms to meet the needs of several tenants in her place. To do this, P. is requesting a loan amount of $500 to help her. 
She and her family would be grateful for your trust and support.

loans.use: To build different rooms to meet her tenants' needs.

loans.name: Umarboi

texts.ru:
Umarboi U. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 2 years. He has been in the wholesale business for at least 5 years. He is married with 3 children, all of whom are going to school. He began his business by selling rice. Initially his assets were worth $50. Today they are worth $120. Since the harvest season starts in August, Uramboi needs $200 to increase his sales. He will use the resulting profits to improve his children’s welfare.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Усмонов Умарбой, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 5 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Его дети учатся. Свою деятельность начал с продажи сельхоз. культурами, т. е. рисом. На начало его деятельности его актив составлял 50$. Сейчас его активы составляют 120$. Так как в августе начинается сезон, ему необходимо 200$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на благополучие своих детей.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Хайдаров Анварчон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 4 лет. Он женат. Свою деятельность начал с продажи аксессуарами на рынке Панчшанбе. Он считает что его бизнес очень прибыльным. За товаром он ездит сам в соседнюю страну, но на этот раз хочет поехать в Китай, за имеющим спрос товаром. Для этого ему необходимо 1000$, для увеличения товарооборота.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Anvarchon [Anvar] H. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 2 years. He has been in business for 4 years. Anvar H. is married. He started his business by selling accessories on a marketplace in Panchshanbe. Anvar H. believes that his business is very profitable. Usually he delivers his goods from a neighboring country, but now Anvar H. wants to go to China to buy the goods that are in demand. He asks for $1000 loan to help pay for the trip and increase the volume of the goods sold.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Хочаева Гавхар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Свою деятельность начала с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек. Ее торговая точка расположена на рынке Панчшанбе. Ей необходимо 300$, увеличение товарооборота и расширения своей точки.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Gavhar H. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 3 years. She has been in business for 3 years. She is married and has 3 children. She began her business by selling clothes for children. Gavhar H. personally delivers her goods from Bishkek. Her retail spot is located at a marketplace in Panchshanbe. Gavhar H. asks for $300 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold and grow the size of her retail spot.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Suraiy

texts.ru:
Хочиева Сурайе, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 2 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Дети учатся в школе. Свою деятельность начала с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама в Бишкек. Ее торговая точка расположена на рынке Панчшанбе. Ей необходимо 300$, увеличение товарооборота, а полуученую прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Suraiy H. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 3 years. She has been in business for 2 years. Suraiy H. is married and has 2 school-age children. She began her business by selling clothes for children. Suraiy H. personally delivers the goods from Bishkek. Her retail spot is located at a marketplace in Panchshanbe. Suraiy H. asks for $300 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold. She plans to use the extra profits to pay for education of her children.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Ортиков Баходур, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 15 лет. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Свою деятельность начал с продажи молочных продуктов, после начал торговать и мясными изделиями, т. е. колбасой. Товары ему поставляют его же поставщики. Ему необходимо 700$ для увеличения своего товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на достойное будущее своих детей.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Bahodur O. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for more than 3 years. He has been in business for 15 years. Bahodur O. is married and has 5 children. He began her business by selling milk products and then expanded into selling meats and sausages. Bahodur O. personally delivers goods from his suppliers. He requests $700 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold. Bahodur O. will use the extra profits to improve the future of his children.

loans.use: Increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is only 19 years old, but has already been running his own business for several years. He is married and has 2 children, one whom is newly born. He and his family live away from his parents. He has no regular work and trading is his only source of income. He sells an assortment of men's wear and shoes. He buys goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan and sells them in markets located in his region. He has been a client of Microinvest for 1.5 years.

He spent his first loan on purchasing a new assortment of summer shoes for his business, which he says gave an immense boost to his business and brought a good profit.

He now hopes to expand even more and for this purpose, has requested a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap married in 1983 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She has run a grocery store at her home since 1999. In addition, she also sells vegetables wholesale by contracting with farmers to purchase the vegetables. Her husband drives a remork (motor taxi with carriage at the back). He transports garment factory workers from their villages to the factory site every day.

After receiving her first loan from MAXIMA, Sopheap was able to contract for vegetables from local farmers with advance payment. As a result, she was able to make more money. She has already taken loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount requested is $1,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her inventory, repair her husband's remork , and to repair their house.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items, repairing remork (motor taxi with carriage at the back) & repairing house.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sopheap Kong has enough money to pay off her loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Anorjon

texts.en: Anorjon is educated as a teacher and previously she worked in a school. The money earned by teaching was not enough to support her family as she has 5 children. Three of them have their own families and live separately. Two of them do not have families and live with Anorjon. Her husband works as the head of the bus station, but his salary is not big and it is only enough for food . That's why Anorjon, in spite of her 58 years of age, has been trading in the market for several years. This allows her to earn profits for her family and she even helps her married daughters. This past winter one of her daughters got sick and Anorjon helped her because her daughter's husband earns little. To expand her business Anorjon got a loan from Microinvest a year ago. Now she wants to get a new loan for further expansion of her business.

loans.use: Further expansion of her business

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Srey Mao has been married for 16 years and has 3 children. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor when she was 15 years old. Then, she started making her living by weaving silk. Her husband is currently serving as a police officer in the local commune. He has been a policeman for more than 6 years. One of their children is a construction worker in the commune.

Srey Mao has requested a loan of $150 from MAXIMA to buy silk material and sewing thread. She is able to earn enough to support her family and repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread

payments.comment:
Dear all lenders,

Srey Mao Mith already paid off the loand. Thank you very much to all lenders.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny married in 1989 and has 7 children, 3 sons and 4 daughters. She has raised pigs since 1998. Her husband drives a motor taxi. In addition, he also plants vegetables and food crops. All of their children are young and 4 of them are attending school in the village.

Ny has taken loans from MAXIMA four times already. This time, she has asked for $500 to purchase more baby pigs and food for her pigs. So far Ny has never had any problem with repayment of her loans.

loans.use: Purchasing more baby pigs and food for her pigs

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
KI. married in 1972 and has 4 children. She started her grocery store in 2000 on a small scale. After receiving a first loan from MAXIMA last year, she was able to expand her business. KI.'s husband is currently serving as a member of the commune council. Neither of them was able to finish primary school. Therefore, they are working hard to support their family and send their 2 younger children to school.

KI. has asked for a loan of $500 from MAXIMA to continue to expand her grocery business by purchasing more grocery items and soft drinks. With her grocery store, she will have no problem repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items and stocking soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Muzambil

texts.en:
Muzambil is 25 years old, married, and has 2 small children. For several years she has been selling children's clothes in the central market of Isfara city. Her husband works in administration at the same market. Their two incomes support the household. Muzambil's mother-in-law helps her by looking after the children while Muzambil is at work.

Muzambil's inventory is quite varied and includes children's clothes for every age group. The goods she sells are high quality; that's why she always has regular customers.

Muzambil has been a client of MicroInvest since December 2005. The loans she has received have been essential in her attempt to increase the volume of her business. She used to purchase her goods from the nearest wholesale markets, but now she goes to Karosuu of Kyrgyzstan Republic to do her buying. This allows her to make additional profit on her sales.

Now Muzambil is requesting a loan of $1200 so that she can further expand her business.

loans.use: expand her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira is 31 years old. She is the youngest daughter in the family, is not married yet and lives with her parents. After graduating from school she started a business. She started small by trading different small things, and gradually enlarged her capital and now she has quite a big business. To buy her goods she travels to Tashkent, 230 km far away, and to Kokand, 100 km away. She buys quality goods and that's why she has many regular customers. She also buys ready made national dresses from local dressmakers. All of this business allows her to get an income to support herself and her parents. Recently she received a loan from Microinvest and expanded her business. She is now going to expand her business further and would like to get a new loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hadiyahon

texts.en: Hadiyahon has been a client of Microinvest for a year. She is married, is 49 years old and has 3 children. She receives a small pension and her trading is an addition to her income. Her business is small, but allows her to cover the family's expenses. She sells national Tajik shoes and different small things. She goes to Istaravshan to buy goods. The demand for her goods is high and Hadiyahon tries to always be in the market in order not to lose customers. She is asking for a loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Memgoto

texts.fr: Madame Memgoto T. est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend du poisson séché dans un marché périphérique de N’Djaména. Quelques fois, elle achète du poisson frais avec les pêcheurs, surtout certaines espèces annuelles, pour les fumer et les conserver pour les revendre plus tard.  Elle sollicite un prêt de $450 pour acheter du poisson frais, les fumer pour les revendre. Avec le commerce du poisson, elle parvient à répondre aux besoins de sa famille, tel que le paiement des frais de scolarité de ses enfants et d’autres choses

loans.use: Achat des caisses de poissons séchés et fumés dans les zones de pêche pour les revendre en détails à N'Djaména

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a new phone accessories shop

loans.name: Eunice

texts.fr: Madame Eunice N. est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle est âgée de 42 ans. Eunice vend du savon et des habits pour femme devant sa concession. Son commerce marche assez bien, mais elle veut augmenter la quantité des marchandises à vendre. C’est pourquoi, elle sollicite un prêt de $225. Elle est sure qu’avec ce prêt, elle pourra améliorer son niveau de vie et celle de sa famille. Puisqu’elle aura plus de marchandises à vendre.

loans.use: Achat des habits pour femmes te du savon à la frontière entre le Tchad et le Cameroun pour les revendre à N'Djaména

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his  newspaper vending business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon O. M. is a 45 years old Newspaper Vendor. He is married and has two children. His wife sells vegetables in a small stand along the busy PondaMali road. Only one of his children attends school and the other one has already finished schooling. He owns his own house and does not have to meet any cost in paying house rent. He did not go to high school and he worked as a casual laborer in different capacities. It was then that the idea of vending newspaper clicked and he decided to go for it. He started selling newspapers over 10 years ago and his business has flourished over the years. He gets Newspapers supply from all the media houses and he is able to make enough returns to cater for his family needs. He is the only vendor in Ponda Mali and has to ensure that all his clients get the newspapers on time. This has however not been possible for him since they are widely distributed and he is not able to serve all of them well. He is now planning to buy two bicycles and hire an assistant to enable him reach all his clients. He is requesting for a loan of US$300. He intends to use US$200 to buy the bicycles and modify them so that they are able to carry all varieties of newspapers, US$30 to pay the assistant he will hire and US$ 70 to buy a variety of magazines to sell to his clients.He is hard working and is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: To expand his newspaper vending business

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia is 43 years old, is married, and has 2 children. The oldest is 17 years old and is a student in the last year of high school. The younger one is 8 years old and is in the second year of primary school. Dionisia’s husband works as a private security guard for a family. Dionisia’s family lives in their own house.

She is a seamstress and she inherited this job from her parents. Her father was a tailor and her mother was a seamstress. She is a very entrepreneurial person; her clothing is well maD. and her prices accessible. She makes shirts, pants, sports clothes, and uniforms for businesses and high schools. Two months ago she proposed a plan at two high schools to make all of their uniforms. Due to her quality work and low prices, both high schools accepted her proposal and now she must make approximately 100 uniforms for them.

In order to get started, she is requesting a loan of $300.00 which she will use to buy fabrics at whole-sale price. This way she can get good discounts and start her work so that she can deliver the orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Dionisia tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 17 años es estudiante, actualmente cursa el último año D. la secundaria y el menor tiene 8 años está cursando el segundo año D. la escuela primaria; el marido D. Dionisia trabaja como guardia D. seguridad privada en una casa particular; todos ellos viven en una casa propia. Dionisia es modista ella heredo el oficio D. sus padres; su padre fue sastre y su madre modista; ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, sus trabajos son bien elaborados y sus precios accesibles, ella confecciona camisas, pantalones, remeras, ropas deportivas y uniformes para empresas y colegios. Hace unos meses presentó en dos colegios grandes D. la ciudad diseños D. uniformes para elaborarlos exclusivamente, gracias a su buen trabajo y bajos precios los colegios aceptaron su propuesta y debe elaborar alrededor D. 100 remeras para dichos colegios. Para poder empezar su labor ella solicita un crédito D. $ 300 que les servirá para comprar las telas al por mayor, D. este modo ella obtendrá importantes descuentos y podrá empezar su trabajo para entregarlos en fecha.

loans.use: To buy fabrics at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is 44 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Three of them work in Argentina and only son, who is 13 yeas old, lives with Lucia and her husband. Her husband is 49 years old and is employed in a textile business. Lucia worked for several years in the same textile business as her husband, but after a reduction in personnel, Lucia was left without a job and she received a severance payment.

Since she is a very entrepreneurial kind of person, she immediately invested her severance pay in her own business, based in her home. Lucia has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells all kinds of basic goods, such as sugar, bread, corn, dairy products, mate herb (used to make a type of tea), etc. The business is going very well for Lucia. With a previous loan she added on to her house so that she would have more physical space for storage. Demand for her products is high, thanks to her good location—there is no competition in the neighborhood.

Lucia needs to increase her stock of merchandise in order to keep up with demand. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan of $300.00, which she will use to buy mate herb, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, wine, and breads.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia; tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, tres D. los cuales trabajan en la Argentina y solo su hijo menor D. 13 años vive con ellos. Su esposo tiene 49 años y es empleado D. una empresa textil. Lucia trabajó varios años en la misma empresa textil que su marido, pero luego D. una reducción D. personal, Lucia quedo sin trabajo y cobró una indemnización por su despido. Como ella es una persona activa y emprendedora, inmediatamente invirtió el dinero cobrado por la indemnización y montó su propio negocio en su casa. Lucia posee una despensa en su casa, done venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, como azúcar, pan, maíz, lácteos, yerba mate, etc. A Lucia le va muy bien con su negocio, con un préstamo obtenido anteriormente ha ampliado su casa para poder contar con un mayor espacio físico para el almacén; la demanda D. sus productos es muy alta gracias a su buena ubicación, pues no tiene competencia en la zona. Hoy Lucia se ve en la necesidad D. ampliar el surtido D. su mercadería, para poder abastecer su demanda, para ello solicita un préstamo D. $300 que lo utilizará para comprar yerba mate, azúcar, gaseosas, productos enlatados, aceite, vino y panificados.

loans.use: To buy mate herb, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, wine, and breads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his bicycle repair business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Gloria is 35 years old, is single, and is the mother of a beautiful 1 year-old daughter. She lives with her parents in the city of Ybycuí. After finishing high school, Gloria went to the capital of the country (Asunción) to study that which is now her profession—hairstyling. The course of study was two years long. Afterwards, she returned to Ybycuí to open her own hair salon. Her business is located in her house. This allows her to coordinate her job with caring for her baby and her parents, who are elderly.

Thanks to her good work and professionalism, she has a good number of clients. She wants to increase her income, so she is thinking of selling clothing for children and women in her salon. There are no clothing shops in the area and her clients are always asking for this type of merchandise. Gloria is requesting a loan of $800.00 to go to the capital to buy sports clothes, nylons, underwear, jewelry, and clothing for children. She plans to sell them in her salon so that she can have an extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, y madre una hermosa niña de 1 año, ella vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ybycuí. Al culminar sus estudios secundarios, Gloria, viajó a la capital del país (Asunción) para estudiar lo que hoy día es su profesión, peluquería, el curso duró 2 años, posteriormente volvió a sus ciudad natal para abrir su propia peluquería. Su negocio se encuentra en su casa, esto le ayuda a coordinar su trabajo con la atención de su bebe y el cuidado de sus padres, que ya son de avanzada edad. Gracias a su buen trabajo y profesionalismo tiene una buena cartera de clientes. Ella desea aumentar sus ingresos, tiene pensado vender ropas para niños y damas dentro de su local, pues en la zona no existen tiendas cercanas y sus clientes solicitan mucho este tipo de mercaderías. Gloria solicita un préstamo de $ 800 para ir a la capital a comprar remeras, ropas deportivas, medias, ropa interior, bijouterie y ropa para niños en grandes cantidades para venderlos en su peluquería y así poder tener ingresos extras.

loans.use: To buy sports clothes, nylons, underwear, jewelry, and clothing for children

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
I would like to invest in purchasing parts for computer repair, since I haven't been able to make any repairs due to a lack of many parts. My work has decreased, and my earnings as well. I am requesting $1200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

"Me gustaria invertir en la compra de piezas para la reparación de computadoras, ya que no he podido hacer algunas reparaciones debido a que me faltan gran variedad de piezas y mi trabajo ha bajado y por lo tanto mis ganancias". Solicito $ 1,200.00 para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing computer parts

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón is 27 years old, is single, and doesn’t have children. He lives alone in a small house that he rents. Ramón started working when he was very young. He went to the capital city to look for work when he was 15 years old because his family was very large (a total of 7 siblings) and there just wasn’t enough money. He lived in the capital for several years, where he worked as an assistant in an upholstery shop. Over time he gained experience in the business and saved enough money to return to the city of Ybycuí, where he opened his own upholstery shop.

With his savings he bought a professional sewing machine, rented a house, and opened his business there. He tells us he has a lot of work because there are only two people in town that do upholstery. With a previous loan that was extended to him he was able to buy a motorcycle, which is very helpful to him for buying materials and delivering small jobs. With what he earns he is able to provide for himself and help his mother, who still lives with four of his younger siblings.

Ramón needs a loan of $250.00, with which he wants to buy more supplies for his work, such as foam, vinyl, leather, fabrics, glues, and staples.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramón tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, vive solo en una pequeña casa que alquila. Ramón trabajo desde muy joven, a los quince años tuvo que viajar a la ciudad capital a buscar trabajo pues como la familia era muy numerosa (7 hermanos en total) el dinero no alcanzaba. Vivió en la capital por varios años, trabajo como ayudante en una tapicería, con el tiempo adquirió experiencia en el rubro y luego de ahorrar dinero suficiente volvió a la ciudad de Ybycuí donde monto su propia tapicería. Con sus ahorros compro una máquina de coser profesional, alquilo una casa para vivir y monto su negocio en el mismo lugar. El nos cuenta que tiene mucho trabajo ya que en toda la ciudad, existen solo dos personas que se dedican a dicha actividad. Con un préstamo que se le fue otorgado con anterioridad el pudo comprarse una moto, que lo ayuda a desplazarse mejor para comprar sus materiales y entregar trabajos pequeños. Con lo que gana puede mantenerse y ayudar a su madre que aún vive con cuatro de sus hermanos más pequeños. Hoy día Ramón necesita un préstamo de $ 250 que desea invertirlos en la compra de más materiales de trabajo, como espuma, cuerina, cuero, telas, gomas, cemento y grampas.

loans.use: To buy foam, vinyl, leather, fabrics, glues, and staples for upholstery work

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description:

Mr. Jose has eight years dedicated to the business. He started this activity when he was very young, because he would help his mother in order to obtain income for their home. He sells all kinds of pants, jeans and skirts. His business is located in a market close to his home. What is more he travels to various provinces of Guayaquil also to complete his sales. Jose works from 7 am until 2 pm from Monday to Sunday. He travels one day a week to the provinces to sell his merchandise.

Use of the Loan:

Mr. Jose desires the loan to buy more pants, since he does not account with sufficient capital to invest. He travels to the city of Cuenca to buy merchandise and what is more spends for travel expenses. He desires the poan to be able to travel with more money and in this manner acquire more merchandise which will permit him to give a better sales price to his customers.

Personal Information:

Mr. Jose is 45 years old, is married to Mrs. Monica and they have two children of minor age who are in college. His wife helps him in the business when he goes out to travel. His house has two floors but is in construction. They have a stable home and good family realtions. Mr. Jose aspires to grow his business through loans and in this manner to give a better education to his children and better the quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don José lleva 8 años dedicado al comercio, el inicio esta actividad desde muy joven, porque ayudaba a su mamá para obtener los ingresos para el hogar. El vende todo lo que son pantalones jeans y faldas. Su negocio esta ubicado en un mercado cerca de su domicilio. Además el viaja a distintas provincias de Guayaquil para también realizar sus ventas. José trabaja desde las 7am hasta las 14pm de lunes a domingo. El viaja 1 vez a la semana a las provincias para vender su mercadería.

Uso del Préstamo

Don José desea el crédito para comprar más pantalones, ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir. El viaje a la ciudad de Cuenca a comprar la mercadería y además gasta en viáticos. Desea el crédito para poder viajar con más dinero y de esta manera adquirir más mercadería lo que le permitirá dar un mejor precio de venta a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Don José tiene 45 años, es casado con doña Mónica ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que están en el colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio cuando el se va de viaje. Su casa es de 2 pisos pero esta en construcción. Tienen un hogar estable y buena relación familiar. Don José aspira crecer son su negocio a través de los créditos y de esta manera darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia

loans.use: Increase his inventory of pants - Incrementar su inventario

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 24 years old and has a small garage in Kirkuk to fix cars and vehicles. This is his first loan application from AL-Aman. He wants to get $1200 to purchase a new testing machine for his garage and new equipment. He has a big family, and he wants to enhance his family's standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new testing machine for his garage and new equipment

loans.name: Werlinton

texts.es:
Werlinton began his business four years ago. He sells delicious coconut and tropical fruit ice cream. His business is open everyday from 8:00am to 8:00pm.

Werlinton needs the loan to buy fruit and supplies needed in the production, maintenance, and sale of the ice cream.

Werlinton is 40 years old and is single with four children. From a young age we was interested in work. His first business was in the production of coconut sweets, a typical delicacy from his country. With the high demand for his sweets, Werlinton came up with the idea to make ice cream from tropical fruits. His house is made out of wood. He hopes to improve his business and income in order to generate work for those who sell his product.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Werlinton inicio su negocio hace 4 años. El producto que vende son los deliciosos helados de coco y frutas tropicales. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8am-a -20pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Werlinton necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más frutas y materiales que se utilizan para la elaboración, conservación y venta de los helados.

Información Personal

Werlinton tiene 40 años es soltero tiene 4 hijos. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar. Siendo su primer negocio la elaboración de los dulces de coco típicos de su tierra la sobre oferta de estos dulces Hizo que en Werlinton surja la idea de crear los helados de frutas tropicales. Su vivienda esta construida de madera. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir creando fuente de trabajo para las personas que venden sus productos.

loans.use: Comprar frutas y otros ingredientes para sus helados // Purchase of fruit and other ingredients for his ice cream

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Glenda inicio su negocio hace 12 años. Vende ropa, bisutería, cuadernos y regalos. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 7am-a -10pm. Su negocio se mantiene gracias a la experiencia obtenida en el manejo y calidad de productos que Glenda ofrece a sus clientes.

Glenda began her business 12 years ago. She sells clothes, notebooks, gifts and imitation jewelry. She attends to her clients everyday from 7:00am to 10:00pm. Her business is in existence, thanks to Glenda’s client service and product quality.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

Glenda necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos modelos de ropa. Así como también artículos de bisutería. Para poder ofrecer variedad en los productos que ofrece a su clientela.

Glenda needs the loan to buy new styles of clothes and costume jewelry and thus offer a wider variety of products to her clients.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Glenda tiene 23 años 1 hijo su esposo la abandono por lo que ella ve sola por su hijo. Razón por la cual Glenda se decidió iniciar este negocio para colaborar en la manutención de su hogar .Vive ocupando un espacio de la casa de su padre. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir ayudando en su hogar y un día no muy lejano llegar a tener su propia casa.

Glenda is 23 years old and has one child. Her husband left her and she alone cares for her child. For this reason, Glenda decided to start this business to be able to support her household. She lives with her father. She hopes to improve her income to be able to help her family. She also hopes that in the future she will be able to have her own house.

loans.use: Comprar nuevos modelos de ropa // Purchase new styles of clothes

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old, and he has a shop to sell electric equipment in Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1200 to purchase an air cooler from another city and sell it in the market. His wedding is in the next couple of months. He wants to prepare himself and work hard to be ready for his new life. He is looking forward to a good future.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase air cooler

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Consuelo inicio su negocio hace 10 años. El producto que vende son blusa, jeans y ropa interior. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8am-a -7pm en su casa o recorre su mercadería dentro del sector donde vive o fuera de ella.

Consuelo began her business ten years ago. She sells blouses, jeans and underwear. She attends to her clients everyday from 8:00am to 7:00pm. She sells out of her house and in and outside of her neighborhood.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

Consuelo necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos y variados modelos de prendas de vestir .Para damas, caballeros y niños. Además Consuelo nos indica que tiene en proyecto la implementación de una cabina ya que por su sector no hay. Y tienen que salir a la principal para realizar las llamadas a celulares.

Consuelo needs the loan to purchase various style of clothes for women, men, and children. In addition, Consuelo mentioned that she has plans to offer cellular service, given that there is none in her neighborhood. People have to go outside of her neighborhood to make cellular calls.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Consuelo tiene 56 años .Tiene 1 hijo que vive de manera independiente. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero lejos de la ciudad. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar. Siendo su primer negocio la venta de legumbres. El mismo que por ser demasiado forzoso y estar afectando su salud lo tuvo que cerrar. Con la ayuda de su hermana pudo iniciarse en el negocio que actualmente lo tiene ocupando parte de su casa. Aspira ha mejorar y mantener su negocio para de esta manera seguir colaborando en el progreso de su hogar.

Consuelo is 56 years old and she has one son who lives with her independently. Her husband works as a day laborer far from the city. From a young age she was interested in work, with her first job selling vegetables. She had to leave this job given it was hard work and it was affecting her health. With the help from her sister she was able to establish her existing business out of her house. She hopes to maintain and improve her business and in turn be able to enhance her home.

loans.use: Adquirir nuevos modelos de ropa // Purchase new style of clothes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
This entrepreneur’s name is Elena F. and she is 23 years old. She is married and does not have children. She lives with her husband in a small house located in a small town near Caaguazú. Her husband works in a shop that rebuilds electrical components of car motors.

She is the owner of a small business located in the Abasto market. She travels very early every day to go to her business, which is 30 minutes from her house. She sells all kinds of women’s clothes, such as pants, shorts, t-shirts, and coats.

Because of the fact that it is the winter season, she would like to buy warm clothing to sell. She is requesting a loan of $400.00, with which she will buy clothing for winter, such as sweatpants, sweaters, coats, pants and wool sweaters. There is a lot of demand for these types of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La emprendedora se llama Elena F. y tiene 23 años, ella está casada, no tiene hijos. Ella vive con su esposo en una pequeña casa ubicada en un pequeño pueblo de Caaguazú; su marido es empleado en un taller de rebobinados. Elena es dueña de una microempresa ubicado en el mercado de Abasto de la ciudad, ella viaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para ir a su negocio que queda a 30 minutos de su casa. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, vende todo tipo de prendas femeninas como remeras, pantalones, shorts, camisas, camperas y calzados. En vista de que es temporada de invierno, ella desea comprar pendas de abrigo para la venta, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 400 con los que comprará compra de ropa para invierno como: buzos, poleras, sacos, pantalones y polleras de lana, pues tiene bastante demanda de estas prendas.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing, such as sweatpants, sweaters, coats, pants, and wool sweaters

loans.name: Delmira

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

La Señora Delmira empezó su negocio hace 4 año, vende ropa para niños en las afueras de la ciudad, tiene como respaldo para su trabajo a sus dos hijos los cuales siempre salen a la entrega de sus productos ya que sus clientes cada día crecen y ella solo no se alcanza

Mrs. Delmira began her business four years ago. She sells childrens’ clothes in the outskirts of the city. She has her children as support for her business as they deliver her products to her growing clientele, which she cannot handle by herself.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

La señora confía en su crédito ya que necesita comprar mercadería de la temporada de frió, pues tiene varios pedidos y su economía no le alcanza para poder realizar una inversión fuerte su preocupación es que sus clientes siempre estén satisfechos

Mrs. Delmira has trust in the loan, which she will use to buy seasonal merchandise for the cold weather, given she has several orders and her income does not meet for a strong investment. Her concern is to be able to meet her clients’ satisfaction.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella, uno de ellos estudia, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es en un tiempo futuro tener su negocio en casa

Mrs. Delmira has six children of which three live with her and one studies. Her home is made out of bamboo and her goal is to be able to have her business at home.

loans.use: Comprar mercaderia de temporada // Purchase  seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a small shop in the Kirkuk market to sell shoes. He wants to get $1000 from AL-Aman to bring more goods. He has a lot of responsibilities. His father and mother live with him, and he has two kids and a wife. He is responsible for all of them.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

El Señor D. tiene una tienda que empezó hace 2 años producto de un crédito que realizo a una institución financiera, en su negocio le ayuda su esposa y su suegra, venden todo lo relacionado a productos de primera necesidad y últimamente su negocio esta creciendo debido a que esta ubicado en una via principal de su sector

Mr. Diaz has a convenience store he opened two years ago, a result following a loan he received from a financial institution. His wife and mother-in-law help with the business. They sell various products to meet the immediate needs of his clients. Recently, his business has been growing, given the shop is located in an important avenue in his community.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

Quiere comprar mas mercadería ya que sus clientes le han realizado varios pedidos y las necesidades del sector son muchas, ella quiere tener su negocio variedad de productos por que en el sector solo existen dos tiendas de este tipo

Mr. Diaz needs the credit to buy merchandise, given his clients have ordered various products and the needs of his community are large. He wants to carry a variety of products; as his community only has two businesses of this type.

Información Personal

Tiene 26 años no tiene hijos, su vivienda es mixta y su dificultad es que no tiene capital para poder invertir en su negocio pero confía en el crédito y de esta manera poder progresar y ampliar su negocio

Mr. Diaz is 26 years old and does not have children. His concern is the lack of capital to invest in his business. However, he trusts that this loan will allow him to progress and to enhance his business.

loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia // Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a small shop in the Kirkuk market to sell shoes. He wants to get $1200 from AL-Aman to bring more goods. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Carmen sells various products and gifts for every occasion. In addition, she has years of experience as a seamstress and she makes a type of knitting called bees nest which she supplies to a clothes factory. She also sells home products to her clients through credit arrangements which has been working out well for her.

Loan Use

Mrs. Carmen needs the credit to buy merchandise and raw material, given she is receiving more and more orders for her products and she lacks cloth to make her dresses.

Personal Information

Mrs. Carmen is 42 years old and she has four children of which two are students. Her house is made out of bamboo and her husband helps her at home. She has a stable family environment.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Carmen tienen a la venta artículos de novedad y regalos para toda ocasión, adema que hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración de vestidos y fabrica un tipo de tejido llamado nido de abeja que entrega a una fabrica de ropa. Ademase ella ha incursionado en un negocio de dejar artículos del hogar a crédito y le esta yendo muy bien.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y materia prima pues cada vez son mas los pedidos que tiene y le falta tela para elaborar mas vestidos.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 42 años y cuatro hijos que estudian de los cuales dos estudian su casa es de caña su esposo le ayuda en la casa y tiene estabilidad familiar

loans.use: Buy merchandise and sewing materials

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Don José tiene a la venta productos Yanbal (cosméticos de belleza) y además vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños, este negocio lo comparte con su esposa. Este negocio lo inicio con la motivación de sus padres. El también se da tiempo y Hace guardia por el sector y recibe un ingreso mas por ese trabajo

Mr. Jose sells Yanbal beauty products and clothes for men, women and children. Jose works with his wife. He began his business with his parents’ support. Jose finds time to work on the side as a security guard for which he receives an additional income.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería Yanbal y mas ropa para satisfacer a sus clientes, pues ya que ellos dan oportunidades de pago esta estrategia ha hecho que mas clientes adquieren sus productos.

He needs the credit in order to purchase Yanbal products and clothes in order to meet his clients’ needs. Jose provides his clients with a flexible payment plan, a strategy that has helped in attracting more clients.

Información Personal // Personal Information

El tiene 20 años y dos hijos que aun no estudian su casa es de caña y tiene estabilidad familiar. El y su esposa tienen la seguridad que juntos trabajando y aumentando su mercadera lograran asegurar la educación de sus hijos y poder construir mejor su casa

He is 20 years old and has two children who are not in school yet. He lives in his sister-in-law’s house and has a stable family. He and his wife feel assured that by working together and by increasing their product line they will be able to provide for their children’s education and allow them to build a better home.

loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia  // Purchase beauty products and cloathes

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a small shop for car and vehicle spare parts. He has a big family: his wife, four children, and his mother live together. He wants to get $1200 to paint his shop and bring more goods for his shop. He wants to increase his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Business Description

Felicita sells Yanbal brand cosmetic products. Seven months ago she also began selling lunches to construction workers. She got into the cosmetics business through a friend who suggested that she sell them, and she started selling the lunches with the help of another friend.

How the Loan Will Be Used

She needs the loan to buy more Yanbal merchandise so that she can keep herself in the market; if she doesn’t have sufficient inventory, her customers will go elsewhere. She also hopes the lunch business will prosper so that she can have another source of income for her family.

Information About Felicita

She is 36 years old and has four children. Her house is of mixed construction and she has a stable family life. She and her husband are eager to improve their business. Since it is their only income so they are very aware that they have to make it prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Felicita se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de belleza de marca Yanbal, además desde hace siete meses se ha dedicado a la venta de almuerzo en las constructoras. El primer negocio lo consiguió mediante una amiga que le propuso que vendiera el producto y el de los almuerzos lo consiguió por medio de un compadre.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería Yanbal y así mantenerse en el mercado pues si no comprar mercadería sus clientes buscaran a otra proveedora. Inclusive ella espera que el negocio de la comida prospere y tener otro ingreso seguro para su familia

Información Personal

Ella tiene 36 años y cuatro hijos su casa es de contracción mixta y tiene estabilidad familiar. Ella y el esposo están afanosos por mejorar su negocio pues siendo su único ingreso están consientes que tienen que hacerlo prospero

loans.use: To buy more merchandise of the type her customers like

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Business Description

Felicidad has been selling Yanbal brand cosmetic products for several years. She began this business at the suggestion of a cousin. At first she only sold to family members and friends, but due to good demand and the excellent attention she gives to her customers, she began selling to others, as well.

How the Loan Will Be Used

Felicidad needs the loan in order to buy more merchandise so that she can have a good inventory for when the prices are reduced—then she can sell at a better price. She is also starting to sell items on credit, which has also been well received by her customers.

Information about Felicidad

She is 34 years old and has a daughter who is in school. Her house is made of cane, but she has begun to build one of cement. Felicidad hopes to get ahead with her business so that she can give her daughter an education, which she herself never got to have.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Felicidad se dedica ala venta de cosméticos de belleza de productos Yanbal desde hace un años y comenzó ese negocio por referencia de una prima que le sugirió comenzara con esta empresa. Al principio solo vendía a sus parientes y amigo pero debido a la gran acogida y a su excelente atención

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y así tener para cuando lleguen las promociones poder vender a mejor precio. Además esta incursionando en la venta de artículos a crédito que también han tenido muy buena acogida

Información Personal

Ella tiene 34 años y una hija que estudia su casa es de caña pero ya ha comenzado a construir la de cemento. Felicidad desea superarse en el negocio para asi brindarle a su hija la educación que ella no pudo tener

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Ms. Amadu is a single parent with one child. She has two years of experience in the food business. As she is a single parent, this income generating activity is the one which permits her to survive and to ensure all the basic needs are met for herself and her child. Even if she has a lot of financial responsibilities, she will be able to pay back her loan because every day all her prepared dishes are sold out; there is always a demand for her food.

Ms. Amadu is a member of the group “ENTENTE” in which five people want to receive a loan of $125 each. The total loan solicited by the group is $625.

loans.use: To purchase rice and oil to increase her business.
